Frontend.jobDescription:
Top Requirement: All resumes submitted must contain links to examples of front-end and graphic design work such as websites, marketing banners, headers, logos, etc in order to be considered for this position!


***We are only accepting applications from US citizens or those with green cards currently living in the US at this time willing to work full time in our San Diego office. ***


Tired of working on boring projects?

Do you want to sharpen your skills in a team-based environment?

If so, here's your chance to be part of a stable company that will provide a great professional work environment, interesting work and strong learning and career growth potential! You will work daily in our San Diego office as this is not a remote opportunity.

We are looking for someone to help improve visual elements of our websites and applications who can combine the art of design with the art of programming. We need someone to bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation. We help define how the application looks as well as how it works.

We have an immediate opening for a front-end Developer to build and maintain our marketing focused websites and applications in a LAMP environment. This is a solid opportunity for someone with proven work experience as Front-End developer looking to progress in their career.

Responsibilities:

Develop new user-facing features.
Build reusable code and libraries for future use.
Debug, test, operate, and support your code.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
Design and implement creative solutions for web and internal applications by optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end.
Collaborate with the existing developers on project scope and design approach.
Perform tasks within InfusionSoft CRM via web-based UI and API.
Stay organized with our project management system.

Requirements:

Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery and Bootstrap.
Good understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as ReactJS, JSON.
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Must have WordPress experience.
Must be proficient with MySQL databases and writing optimized SQL queries within PHP code
Experience with Laravel or similar PHP frameworks
Experience with Git, Linux, and Apache
Experience with and understanding how A/B split tests, multivariate tests and web performance.
Must have advanced knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Photoshop.
Must be very detail oriented and creative
Must have code management experience with Git at the command line

Bonus Qualifications:

1 year experience with InfusionSoft CRM
Apache or IIS Configuration experience
Amazon Web Services configuration experience
Previous work with APIs
Experience writing and documenting well-abstracted, reusable code for themes or UI components.

Benefits:

Relocation assistance available for the right candidate
Health
Dental
Vision
Birthday celebrations
Holidays Off
2 Weeks Paid Vacation
All the free coffee you can drink

​Relocation assistance available for the right candidate

Frontend.jobskills: Javascript backbone.js node.js angular.js HTML5 CSS3 Perl PHP MySQL Flash Actionscript DOM XSLT/XML jquery SEO graphic design frontend responsive UI UX social media streaming video
Frontend.jobDescription:
FRIENDFINDER NETWORKS OVERVIEW


FriendFinder Networks Inc. is a leading Internet-based social networking and technology company operating several of the most heavily-trafficked websites in the world. We provide our customers with a wide variety of online products and services, appealing to members of diverse cultures and interest groups, so they can interact with each other and enjoy our content. Our sites’ services include social networking, online personals, live and recorded video, online chat rooms, instant messaging, photo and video sharing, blogs, message boards, email and premium content websites.

 

We’re looking for a talented Front End Web Developer who is driven by challenges to build the next-generation social media platform to join our team. We enable the engineering team to collaborate, build, and deploy lightweight web and mobile apps for social networking and live-streaming videos used by millions of users every day. You will work closely within a team of engineers who have a profound and immediate impact on our vision with real-time social media in the global community. We connect people fast, anywhere in the world, in real-time 24 hours a day.

 


WHY JOIN US?


Our mission is to bring people with shared interest together through social media in a safe, enjoyable, and friendly environment. We want to hire people who share our global vision of connecting people through social media, to join our collaborative team. People who thrive on being challenged, enjoy collaborating with others, and want to engineer solutions for people with common interests to connect. Are you ready to take on the challenge and work on exciting projects?

 

WHAT WE WANT


FriendFinder Networks is looking for a talented Front End Web Developer who will design, develop, test, and implement web sites that are seen and used by millions of people every day all over the world. Your contributions will ensure the best possible user experience for everyone who visits our web sites 24 hours a day, every day of the year, all over the world.

 


WHAT YOU WILL DO

Will write front end code in HTML/CSS and JavaScript
Will hand-code standards-compliant pages using table-less layouts from design mockups
You’ll work on cross functional teams providing guidance on user interface design and implementation
Will test code across platforms and browsers
Will document all your work and communicate issues when they arise
Will assist troubleshooting production issues

 

WHAT YOU MUST HAVE

Must have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field and/or equivalent work experience
Must have experience developing social networking sites
Must have at least 2 years’ of front-end development experience
Must have a minimum 1 yeas’ experience with Javascript framework (i.e., js.backbone, js,node, etc)
Must have expert proficiency in XHTML and CSS
Must have experience using Photoshop/ImageReady for image slicing and optimization

 

WHAT YOU SHOULD HAVE

Should be familiar with any or all of the following: Perl, PHP, MySQL, Flash, Actionscript, SEO, graphic design/UI
Should have expert proficiency in JavaScript, DOM, XSLT/XML, jQuery
Must be familiar with cross-platform and cross-browser issues, web standards and best practices
Should be familiar with HTML5, CSS3, and emerging web technologies
Should be an excellent problem-solving skills (flipping coins and using Ouiji Boards is not acceptable)
Should have the ability to learn new tasks outside immediate range of skills
Should have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Should be able to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Should have a high degree of honesty and integrity
Should be deadline oriented and able to multi-task in a fast pace environment
Should be a team-player, positive attitude, and flexible
You must be comfortable with adult content
You must be at least 21 years old

 


REPORTING TO THIS POSITION: 
No direct reports

 

PERKS 


FriendFinder Networks Inc. and its subsidiaries offer a business casual work environment, flexible work hours, and a competitive salary.  The benefits package includes:
401(k) with a 5% match on eligible earnings with no vesting period
Medical (Kaiser HMO, Aetna PPO), Dental, and Vision
Flexible Spending Account for Healthcare and Dependent Care
Life Insurance, AD&D, LTD and Short and Long Term Disability
Paid Time Off (20 days PTO) and Holiday Pay (12 company paid holidays off)
Employee Assistance Program
Commuter Benefits
529 Education Plan
Tuition Reimbursement
Health Club Reimbursement 

 

ABOUT US


FriendFinder Networks is an international leader in social media founded in 1996 by Andrew Conru.  Originally started as a main-stream social networking site, the company quickly adapted to consumer preferences, and branched out into different social media verticals. Andrew Conru is still directing FriendFinder Networks’ vision for pioneering new development of innovative and social media technology connecting people every day all over the world.

 

OUR HUMANITY 
(Equal Opportunity Employer)

At FriendFinder Networks we are proud to celebrate diversity of people for the benefit of our employees, our products, and the global community we all belong to.  

 

It is the policy of FriendFinder Networks Inc., and its subsidiaries, to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.   All employment practices such as recruitment, selection, promotions, and other terms and conditions of employment are administered in a manner designed to ensure that employees and applicants for employment or services are not subjected to discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, medical condition, disability, marital status, religious or political preferences or union affiliation.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Senior Front End Engineer (React, React Native)
 Seeking a Front End Engineer to develop mobile and web applications using React and React Native.  If you are a Senior Front End Engineer and have experience with React and/or React Native this may be the opportunity you are looking for. As a Senior Front End Engineer you will design and build the mobile and and web application using React and React Native.  You will assist in designing the user interface as well as implementing and connecting to back end services.  In this position you will work with other motivated and talented developers with a significant impact on design, architecture and direction.  Looking for a passionate and professional software engineer who enjoys doing things the right way.  Ideally this person should have a deep understanding of JavaScript, React and React Native.  Additionally this person should understand user experience design, code, security, quality and sustainability.  As a software professional you understand the importance of coding clean, estimating, taking deadlines seriously, and interfacing well with other team members, teams, and end users. Requirements
 5+ years of experience building enterprise class mobile and web apps
Deep knowledge of JavaScript
Solid experience with React and / or React Native
Mobile development experience, preferably with React Native, is a big plus
Experience writing client-side JavaScript using React, React Native, Redux (or equivalent technologies)
Solid understanding of CSS and browser differences
Experience with modern browser technologies
Experience with API’s
Experience with Databases
Good UX and design sensibilities
Excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and self-motivated
Experience with Git
  Recognized by Deseret News as Glassdoor's top 63 companies: Ranked # 33 http://www.deseretnews.com/top/3901/0/The-top-63-companies-to-work-for-in-Utah.html

will be responsible for turning business requirements and technical specifications into platform features and functionality.   This person will also be responsible for bridging gap between user experience and user Interface designs and java developers during eCommerce web site development, performance and design considerations, and web development for auxiliary and one-off websites.

Frontend.jobDescription:
The Senior Front-End Web Developer position builds usable, compelling, and technically sound front-end interfaces for web and mobile applications. The Developer contributes technical leadership to shape solution architectures, implement quality user experiences through hands-on development and promote and mentor others in front-end best practices. 

Essential Functions
Strategy & Planning

• Collaborate with business partners to understand needs and define requirements for websites and software applications.
• Acquire and interpret business requirements, and determines the most efficient/appropriate technologies. 
• Help with identifying and implementing bleeding edge technologies and UI frameworks
• Develop architecture roadmaps of our sites UI stack
• Submit and review technical and process improvement recommendations as a member of the technical leadership team.
• Collaborate with developers on Front End best practices and style guides.

Acquisition & Deployment

• Accurately translate business and user needs into usable, compelling, and technically sound interactive solutions, utilizing multiple technologies.
• Estimate hours for project tasks.
• Build semantic, accessible, and maintainable front-end interfaces with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
• Schedule and lead brainstorming activities surrounding interface functionality.
• Perform complex programming assignments requiring an advanced aptitude of established programming standards, methods, and best practices. Collaborate with UX and Visual Designers as well as back end developers & other team members to achieve an optimal user experience that meets business needs

Operational Management

• Utilize a flexible approach to changing priorities in an Agile work environment
• Manage and prioritize workload efficiently 
• Maintain and modify web applications; make approved changes by amending application documentation, develop detailed programming logic, and coding changes.
• Provide support for critical web application problems and issues. 

Incidental Functions

• Conduct research into new technologies, including tools, components, and frameworks.
• Train and knowledge share with the design and development teams.
• Mentor and coach developers and/or Professional Apprentices.
• Project and task management and reporting as necessary.
• Make presentations to management, clients, and peer groups as requested.
• Schedule and lead project and communication meetings with clients.
• Analyze performance of websites and take action to correct deficiencies. Assist with other projects as may be required to contribute to efficiency and effectiveness of the work
• Participate in hiring activities and fulfilling affirmative action obligations and ensuring compliance with the equal opportunity policy. 
• Provide input to manager on team evolution and growth strategy
• Minimal travel as required
• Work outside the standard office 7.5 hour workday as required.

Position Requirements
Formal Education & Certification

• Bachelor degree or foreign equivalent in related field or equivalent experience. 

Knowledge & Experience

• 5+ years IT experience.
• 3+ years working with JavaScript/jQuery (including AJAX), modern front end frameworks, standards-based semantic markup, and using front end debugging tools.
• Deep knowledge of CSS3 and HTML5.
• Very skilled in responsive Web Development.
• Ability to follow web accessibility (Section 508 and WAI) standards.
• Strong sense of design and typography.
• Demonstrated experience with Photoshop.
• Demonstrated use of Source Code Control, preferably Git.
• Experience building single-page web applications that perform well in modern, mobile, and legacy browsers (responsive UI).
• Demonstrated eye for usability and user experience.
• Experience generating templates for various content-based tools (blog, wiki, WCM).
• Knowledgeable in common UX/UI design patterns, best practices, and standard conventions.
• Experience working as part of an enterprise web team, interfacing with back-end developers, designers, web engineers, and external agencies or partners.

Personal Attributes

• Advanced analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
• Strong written and oral communication skills.
• Proven ability and initiative to learn and research new concepts, ideas, and technologies quickly.
• Effective at working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
• Excels at translating an idea or need into a completed solution or work product.

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future.  
Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, pregnancy, genetic information, creed, citizenship status, marital status, or any other consideration prohibited by law or contract. VEVRAA Federal Contractor requesting priority referral of protected veterans.

USA-IL-Greater Chicago-Chicago  |  Information Technology 

 Senior Front End Developer  
   
 “The limit of our growth is going to be our imagination and product ideas – not technology.”       – Mohit Kapoor, CTO

A work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile. 
Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars. 
Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius

 What you’ll bring:

Front End Developer - UI/UX 
REF#: 
 30371

 Smithsonian Networks 

JOB TYPE: 
 Full-Time Staff 

JOB SCHEDULE: 
 Full-Time 

JOB LOCATION: 
 New York, NY 

ABOUT US: 



Smithsonian Channel, owned by Smithsonian Networks, a joint venture between Showtime Networks Inc. and the Smithsonian Institution, is where curiosity lives, inspiration strikes and wonders never cease. This is the place for awe-inspiring stories, powerful documentaries and amazing entertainment across multiple platforms. Smithsonian Channel combines the storytelling prowess of SHOWTIME(r) with the unmatched resources and rich traditions of the Smithsonian, to create award-winning programming that shines new light on popular genres such as air and space, history, science, nature, and pop culture. Among the network's offerings are series including Aerial America, America in Color, First Ladies Revealed, Polar Bear Town, The Lost Tapes, Amazing Monkeys, America's Secret Space Heroes, Mighty Ships, Mighty Planes and Air Disasters, as well as critically-acclaimed specials that include Titanic's Fatal Fire, The Obama Years: The Power of Words, Nightmare on Everest, Diana and the Paparazzi, Diana: The Day We Said Goodbye and Flying High with Phil Keoghan. Smithsonian Networks also operates Smithsonian Earth, through SN Digital LLC., a new subscription video streaming service delivering spectacular original nature and wildlife content. To learn more, go to www.smithsonianchannel.com, or connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. 

DESCRIPTION: 



Is writing awesome software and crafting a stellar user experience your true calling in life? Do you thirst for the challenge of writing code that could be used by millions of users? Do you love the intersection between development and product? Are you an avid learner who's always looking to polish their knowledge? Do you want your voice to be heard in the projects that you are working on? If that's you, we should talk. 


Smithsonian Channel seeks an innovative front-end developer who has strong core front-end development skills and is also deeply focused on creating great UI/UX - critical to keeping our users happy. This position presents an opportunity to work on exciting web projects on a small but mighty team. Join us as we build the future of television! 


We have: 




A fully modern tech stack 


Exciting projects and opportunities that will challenge you 


A small, yet high-caliber team of developers 


A fancy for writing quality software 


A get-it-done attitude 


A team of digital pioneers that you will be working with to craft custom solutions for a wide range of projects 




QUALIFICATIONS: 





3-5+ years of experience with front-end development 


Strong knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, CSS preprocessors (we use SASS), and JavaScript/jQuery 


In-depth knowledge of responsive web design 


Experience writing code that is scalable and responsive across the multitude of platforms and devices 


A deep concern about the quality of user experiences you are developing, and the desire to be a UX champion 


Experience with cross browser and device compatibility issues and solutions 


Experience with version control software (we use Git) 


The ability to problem solve independently and in a team environment 


The motivation to adapt to and learn emerging technologies 


The ability to play nicely with other humans (i.e. people skills) 


Self-starter mode 





You might also have: 




Experience with JavaScript libraries (other than jQuery) and frameworks 


Experience writing technical documentation 


Previous work experience in digital media, preferably at a media company (television, publishing, etc.) 





Please be able to provide a portfolio link or send code samples for projects that you are proud of. Personal projects are welcome!

Frontend.jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, Seamless Engineering (Full Stack, Front End focus)
Frontend.jobskills: Automated, Business Intelligence, C++, Customer Service, Developer, Development, Iterative, Java, JavaScript, Networks, Recruiter, Scrum, Software Engineer, Testing, Windows
Frontend.jobDescription:
What you'll be doing... 



Would you like to work on one of the most disruptive products in the Business Intelligence industry? Tableau introduced the world to self-service data visualization by replacing paper reports with dynamic, interactive data visualizations to help people see and understand data. Come join a tight-knit Seamless Experience team whose mission is to help new users quickly discover and share initial value of Tableau in their organizations.  


We are looking for a senior developer to architect and deliver solid front-end components and delightful user experiences. Seamless Experience touches every part of the Tableau product from desktop, server and online. We focus on smart onboarding and content publishing and sharing to increase user engagement, collaboration and retention. Candidates need to have demonstrated technical leadership in prior roles with a diverse background of technologies for front- end, and data access development. If you have deep knowledge in a particular layer or domain then leverage that expertise to have big impact while showing a strong desire to stretch yourself and add to your skillset. Our engineers hold each other accountable for the quality of their features so candidates need to embrace hunting for potential issues in designs and code and implementing automated tests.  

Who you are… 
 * LI-EM1
Educated: Y 
ou have a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field. 
Experienced:  
You are a seasoned developer with 6+ years’ experience building commercial web software products. You are a seasoned developer and fluent in commonly used design patterns and a solid understanding of architectures relevant to multi tier applications. Experience working with Test and Learn, multi-variant testing and incrementally building websites in rapid iteration cycles is a plus. 
Technical: 
 You have multiple years of professional experience working with TypeScript, React, Angular, or other JavaScript frameworks and tools. You also have experience in at least one OO language such as C#, Java, or C++. You know how to navigate a variety of languages and frameworks to build great solutions. 
Customer-focused. 
 You regularly think from the customer perspective, and use data to support and verify your ideas. User experience is important to you. You are eager to identify and fix user issues in the field. 
Passionate.  
You love building easy to use and beautiful user interfaces. You have a passion for solving complex problems, and how to break them down into smaller, high quality deliverables that allow adding customer value as soon as possible. You write tests for your code as a way to maintain high quality. You understand what it takes to write software that is used by thousands, even millions, of people. You love products that "just work" - that are robust, scalable and perform well. You keep your standards high. 
Curious. 
 you like to understand how things work. You don't settle for just making something work without understanding how it works. When you learn a technology, you dig deep, and are not satisfied with knowing "just enough." 
A proponent of continuous improvement. Y 
ou are able to identify areas for improvement and work on positive change over time, balancing change with productivity. You refactor, eliminate technical debt, and fix "broken windows." 
Collaborative.  
Tableau works as a team - and so should you. Tableau is organized around small teams that are collaborative, iterative, introspective, self-managing, and continuously improving, utilizing a Scrum team model. At a macro level we value helping other teams: resolving blockages, removing redundancies, identifying interdependencies, and doing all we can to eliminate silos and work as a larger team. We value good communication skills, and folks who build networks of relationships within and between teams. You can constructively review the work of others to ensure high quality and adherence to best practices. 
Team builder. 
 You want to build our teams and make them stronger. You mentor fellow team members and learn from them, you have peers review your code, and vice-versa. You also participate in interview loops, and reach out to friends, colleagues, and the general public to assist in filling open positions. 
You are a recruiter. 
 Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world! 



Tableau Software is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry. Our culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!  


Tableau Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Frontend.jobTitle: Senior Front End Developer on Agile Team
Frontend.jobskills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React, React Native, Sass, KnockoutJS
Frontend.jobDescription:
We are a closely-held web and mobile application development firm and we are looking for driven senior-level Front End Developers.  Are you experienced and current in your front end development skills and dig JavaScript and frameworks?  Looking for a no-politics zone to do your best work?  Mercury is the place for you!
The Work
The interface developer will be engaged in a range of web and native application development including:
Custom business applications utilizing rich HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript-driven front ends
ASP.NET MVC with Knockout and custom vanilla JavaScript
Large-scale web application development with React (sometimes Angular but not so much)
Use of React Native to develop iOS and Android applications
Skills & Requirements
The position requires strong front end Web development using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React and other JavaScript frameworks.  Many of our applications are built with JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks at all tiers while many use the .NET Framework paired with standards-based markup, MVC and either vanilla JavaScript or KnockoutJS.  The Senior Front End Developer will also be instrumental in the construction of native applications.

Mercury's Front End Developers possess strong skills in the above technologies and just as important front end design patterns, common interface frameworks and testing.  A passion for web standards and modern interface/JavaScript frameworks is also pretty darn important.
Some Specifics
At Mercury you will:
Build modular React components with directives and ES6
Write RESTful API specs for back end devs to construct
Develop NodeJS web services
Build with all the new hotness including pre-processors (mostly SASS, some LESS), plugins and build tools
Drive standards-based .NET MVC-based front ends
Deploy solutions to the cloud including Azure and AWS
Live and thrive in JavaScript, JavaScript frameworks and single page applications
What Kind of Projects Will You Work On?Web, native mobile and collaboration applications for the Southeast's fastest growing commercial real estate firms
Data dashboards, drill down business intelligence reports and mobile reporting for global professional services firms
iOS and Android applications for Fortune 50 consumer products field workforce
How to Know If You're A Fit
If any of the following excites you, we definitely want to talk to you!
Shop Talk Show
Eloquent JavaScript
React Native

Frontend.jobDescription:
IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 6 million students worldwide, is seeking Front-End Engineers to provide the face of the IXL product.

The IXL Product Engineering team develops the user-facing features of the website and the back-end code that connects these features to our databases and other services. We created and maintain the practice engine, where students answer the questions created by the Content team; Analytics, which turns practice data into actionable information for teachers; the Recommendations area, which suggests skills for students to try next; and much more.

You will utilize cutting-edge technologies like React to bring dynamic, user-facing components to life. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team. At IXL, we believe that building a creative and engaging user experience is invaluable to our mission of improving education through technology. 

International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.
What You'll Be DoingTake control of the whole front-end development process from code design to implementation
Collaborate with product managers to build a world-class user experience
Tackle tough design challenges to create reusable user interfaces while writing clean, scalable code
Engineer the front-end architecture that powers our web application
Discover new technologies and establish best practices as the front-end landscape evolves
What We're Looking For1+ years of experience in software engineering
Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline
Expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Familiarity with at least one JavaScript library or framework (e.g., React, Angular, Ember)
Passion for new technologies, current trends, and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility, security, and usability
Enthusiasm for improving education through technology
About IXL
IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: delivering an immersive learning experience to all students, in all grades and subjects, in schools and homes worldwide. With 1 in 8 U.S. students already learning on IXL (answering over 50 million questions every day!), IXL inspires educators and learners around the world and is changing how students feel about learning and about themselves.

Frontend.jobDescription:
ABOUT TREFIS

Trefis is a fast growing software company with unique technology serving B2B enterprise customers. The company was founded by MIT, investment banking, and McKinsey alums.

Trefis’ unique technology automatically transforms complex analysis/models into a distinctive interactive visual format, where users can create/compare alternative scenarios. The platform provides multiple benefits for better decision making and better business results.

Trefis customers include investment banking firms, consultants, private equity, and Fortune 500 companies. Within the corporate market, use cases span the business system. Trefis stock value has appreciated 10X in the last few years, with the goal to do so again in the next 3-5 years.
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for someone to play a key role in developing front end data visualization software, utilizing React Redux and Highcharts.JS software. The role will touch all aspects of the product lifecycle, from working with stakeholders, to rapidly developing final products.

We value someone who:
Understands the fundamentals and the tradeoff between various frontend frameworks
Can quickly move from design concepts to implementation in both Greenfield projects as well as understanding the Object Oriented nature of our more mature platforms
Excels in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, where quick iterations are valued
Takes pride in quality architecture and well structured extensible code

The ideal candidate has the following skills:
Experience in jumping headfirst into real applications built with multiple front end frameworks - React, Redux, Angular, jQuery and native Javascript
Strong understanding of Objects, Arrays and comfort with large, complex Data structures
Intimate knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, with the ability to find solutions for less compliant browsers
Strong understanding of object oriented and functional programming paradigms
Desire to plan out and build a test driven front end
Ability to work efficiently with Git
A good eye for usability and design aesthetics
LOCATION

Boston/Telecommute. We have an office in Boston, but the majority of the team works remotely from all over the U.S. and Canada.

COMPENSATION

Competitive base salary, strong equity upside, benefits, and progressive vacation policies

CONTACT


Email tech.jobs@trefis.com with the subject "Front-End Javascript Developer" and tell us why you are perfect for the job, and any relevant prior experience. Code samples and/or live URLs are preferred.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Who We Are:
 DAKCS Software Systems is an industry leader in simplifying the process of accounts receivable management and collection software by creating innovative cloud and on-premise collection agency management software solutions.  We specialize in accounts receivable management,  collection management, predictive dialing/IVR, e-payment, client access, self-service and e-signature requirements with elegantly designed, configurable enterprise solutions.

Position:
 We are currently looking for a full time UI/Front End Developer to join our team.  We want someone who has the ability to get their hands dirty with front-end code and understands how to design a great user experience across various platforms/screens (web, tablet, mobile). We want someone who can design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance our software solutions with an emphasis on user interfaces. 

What you will be doing: 
You will be building the next-generation web applications with a focus on the client side and redesigning our existing UI and creating new UI designs. You will assist in maintaining and updating the company website ensuring the style and layout follows our brand guidelines. You will be a part of our development team and will assist will all code reviews and perform testing/debugging of the software. You will also participate in planning and design meetings and research and help implement new technologies.  You must be able to work outside standard business hours when required.

Job Requirements


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree (B.S.) in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other technical field.
Must have at least 3-5 years relevant work experience, including web application experience. 
Ability to code in various programming languages including: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Knowledge of user interfaces and responsive design.
Must be familiar with Windows Operating System, Visual Studio, Windows Development Environment, and Microsoft .Net Frameworks.
Knowledge of WordPress 4.0 and how theming works. 
Ability to follow instructions and respond to management direction, keep commitments, and complete tasks on time or notify appropriate person with alternate plan.
Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, and develop alternative solutions.
Ability to display original thinking and creativity, generate creative solutions and use feedback to modify designs. 

Highly Desirable Skills
Experience with ASP.NET/WCF
Experience with Agile Software development environments.
Familiarity or experience with code repositories and version control software (Git).
Familiarity or experience with Issue & Project tracking software (Jira).
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign)
What you will love about us:
 
Competitive salary
Very stable & challenging work
Joining a company who highly values their employees
Casual environment
Medical, dental, life, disability, generous paid time off, holiday pay
Bi-monthly massages
Company celebrations
Recreational allowance - Yes we pay you to have fun!
Much more

Get ready for a dynamic new career as a UI/Front End Developer


Our Culture:
 DAKCS Software Systems is committed to creating an environment that enhances the lives of those that work here and those whom we serve, accomplished through challenges, opportunities and results. We are proud of our long standing culture.  We have an open working environment made up of top down transparency. We hope to inspire honest interactions and trust by saying what we mean, aligning our actions to our words and taking responsibility for our actions. Our products are crafted with innovation, heart and pride and we are committed to creating positive change in order to improve our company, our products, and our environment.  At DAKCS, we work hard, play hard, keep score, win and celebrate as a team.

Find out more about us: https://www.facebook.com; https://www.linkedin.com; https://www.instagram.com
Qualified applicants receive equal consideration. No question is asked for the purpose of excluding any applicant due to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, disability, or any other factor prohibited by law or regulation. DAKCS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER (M/F/D/V).
DAKCS participates in E-Verify. Through participation in the E-Verify program, DAKCS electronically verifies the employment eligibility and Social Security Number of all new hires.

Frontend.jobskills: Full Time, Full Time
Frontend.jobDescription:
Delta Defense LLC is the private company that provides Marketing, Operations and Customer Care for the USCCA. The USCCA provides education, training and self-defense insurance to the most responsible gun owners.  



Delta Defense, LLC, is one of the fastest-growing companies in America.


Inc. 5000 company 6 years in a row!

#3 Journal Sentinel Top Workplace - 2017

#1 Milwaukee Business Journal Top Workplace - 2017


We are a fun, fast-paced and rewarding place to work and grow!  




We hire rockstars, and help them rock even harder! 


Position Summary:



The IT and development team at Delta Defense manages the entire application lifecycle of the business from front to back. This includes everything from a simple landing page, and extends all the way back to our own APIs, iOS and Android apps, CMS and CRM solutions, server infrastructure, and business intelligence.


The daily work is an exciting blend of custom internal web application development and enterprise solution integration. We build solutions for our users, as well as many different internal departments: the Sales and Marketing team, Member Services team, and our Content Team just to name a few. We also build tools that we use internally to help keep all of this complexity under control.


With so many unique internal and external customers to satisfy, we have a wide range of exposure to different problems that need solving. This isn???t rinse and repeat development; we are in the trenches developing the future of the company with generous levels of autonomy. Company leadership inspires teams to grow and evolve professionally and personally, and we thrive on testing new ideas. This allows us to move quickly and seize exciting opportunities, building solutions using the frameworks, tools, and technologies that best meet the task at hand.


 


As a fast-growing company with wide-ranging digital offerings, there are opportunities everywhere. Our team moves to capitalize and innovate on these opportunities in a fast-moving and positive, collaborative culture that empowers individuals and teams to bring their ideas to life.


You will love working here as a developer. Seriously. 

 


The Senior Front End Developer sets the standard in development practices related to the front end stack, and serves as a key technology visionary and leader to the development team at large.


This person has experience building medium to large, dynamic web applications of moderate to high complexity using modern JavaScript design patterns and tools.


This is not a management position, but this role is expected to support the development team and ensure the team???s overall success.

 


Duties/Responsibilities:



Available as a key technical resource contact when discussing implementation of new software initiatives.

Develops web applications with a combination of languages/frameworks appropriate for the task at hand.

Helps to ensure that other front end developers are meeting team standards, teaches and assists when introducing or learning new technologies.

Empowered to make key design decisions.

Empowered to approve code merges and deployments.

Proactively recommend workflow and system changes/enhancements.

Mobile-first design. (we use Bootstrap)

Applications work in all supported desktop browsers as well as mobile browsers.

Writes documentation (both formal and ???inline???), often aimed at developers, and sometimes aimed at end users.

Coordinates with UI/UX designers, as well as Back End developers to implement desired functionality.

Skills/Abilities and Education Requirements:


Adaptability (able to learn new libraries/frameworks and adapt to existing codebases)

Analytical thinker with strong problem solving skills.

Cool under pressure.

Time management and reliability. (able to accurately predict turnaround time on projects and deliver on those timelines)

Advanced knowledge of web application design patterns.

Experience with a major JavaScript framework. (Angular, Vue, Ember, Backbone, etc.)

Strong understanding of asynchronous design patterns.

Experience with JavaScript module loading (RequireJS, Browserify, Webpack)

Familiarity with CMS-assisted development.

Ability to work both independently and collaboratively to meet deadlines.

Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of version control. (we use Git)

Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of development and workflow tools: npm, Grunt/Gulp, comfortable on the command line, debugging.

Bachelor???s degree in Information Technology/Business or related field is preferred, in lieu of degree equivalent work experience may be considered.

2 to 4 years experience in similar or related role.

Demonstrates the Core Values of Delta Defense, LLC.

Frontend.jobDescription:
UCLA External Affairs builds enduring relationships that promote  advocacy and financial support for UCLA. The department of Advancement  Services is an internal service group that coordinates and performs  vital administrative, financial and technology services to the other  UCLA External Affairs departments. It is a key partner in major  initiatives across External Affairs and is the custodian of UCLA's  million-entity Customer Relationship Management System and Ecommerce  Platform. Under the department of Advancement Services, the  Application Development Team leads technological innovation and plays  a critical role in the digital transformation of UCLA External Affairs  in order to meet challenging business demands.
 
The Application Development Team is seeking an experienced software  engineer to fill the role of Senior Front-End Software Engineer. Under  the supervision of the Director of Application Development, you will  act as a team leader and technical expert for software application  development for all of External Affairs. As a team leader, you will  evaluate solution options, design application architecture and lead  complex large- and medium-size application development projects. As a  technical expert, you have a mastery of modern web application  frameworks, including front-end and back-end development as well as  hands-on experience developing applications on premise and/or in  cloud; and you are knowledgeable of application containerization and  DevOps concepts. You will have the vision and ability to introduce new  technology as well as a detailed working knowledge of a wide variety  of software development tools. You will have expert knowledge of  object-oriented programming combined with practical experience with  Microservices architecture, skills in writing code, and the ability to  analyze, synthesize and utilize complex technical and functional  information to communicate with end-users and senior management.   Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills are also must for  this role.
 
The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative  Action Employer advancing inclusive excellence. All qualified  applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to  race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,  national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other  protected categories covered by the UC nondiscrimination policy - 
 
For a more detailed description of this position please  or visit  UCLA s Development Careers website at:  http://www.developmentcareers.ucla.edu and click on  Other External  Affairs Positions  to view requisition #27390.

Frontend.jobskills: HTML5 ; CSS3 ; Sass/Less ; JavaSript
Frontend.jobDescription:
Beautylish is looking for an experienced Front End Engineer to join our small, selective engineering team.  We are creating a compelling new retail model centered around providing fast and personal service. We are a collaborative team of builders who apply software in inventive ways to solve interesting technical and business problems.

We believe that high quality engineering and design comes from simplicity, not complexity. We understand that clean and minimal solutions are not always the easiest solutions to create, but are worth the investment. Our culture is centered around building extraordinary experiences for both internal and external users, and we are looking for engineers who share our philosophy and are looking to make an impact.

Front End Engineers at Beautylish are focused on three core areas:

Web and mobile consumer products.
 We are continually improving our user experience and polishing our design. We are a team that cares about the people that use our products and are always looking for creative and fun ways to make the Beautylish experience more enjoyable.

Internationalization and localization.
  We ship to 50+ countries and growing.  Our goal is to make the Beautylish experience feel as familiar as possible no matter where you live.

Sophisticated CRM and efficient operations.
 We believe that the greatest power of technology is its ability to connect people. We build systems that surface data in novel ways to enhance our personal relationship with our customers.

Things we look for include:

Expert understanding of HTML5, CSS3, Sass/Less
Experience building large, modular and maintainable JavaScript code bases
Experience with web analytics tools, performance tuning and browser compatibility differences
Understanding of progressive enhancement and graceful degradation, accessibility, SEO, and responsive design.
Prior experience building large web apps
B.S. in Computer Science or a related field
At least 3 consecutive years of post-degree work in a similar role

Above all, we look for people with a passion for learning and continual improvement.  


You'll love joining the Beautylish team at our San Francisco headquarters because we're a group of passionate, dedicated people striving for daily excellence in a collaborative atmosphere. With continuous opportunities to learn, you'll have the possibility to grow your role with your skills. Compensation is dependent on experience and includes a comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance, 401(k) with employer matching, competitive PTO, commuter benefits, charitable giving matching, flexible hours, and a great employee discount.

About us

Prevention, detection and reporting of criminal and other suspicious activity is a widespread, costly problem for financial services companies. Our mission is to constantly apply and adopt the latest technological trends and creative innovation to change the way companies detect money laundering, terrorism and related crime. Making it more affordable, yet much more sophisticated. We aim to help our partners go beyond satisfying government requirements, to minimize reputational risk and genuinely address harmful activity 
As an Engineer at Beam in its very early stage you will be a critical asset responsible for many tasks and systems that span our entire product and internal infrastructure. As part of the team you will be part of shaping the technological landscape, build new products, add and improve features, scale and maintain the systems that keep our customers happy. You will also build internal tools and systems to help streamline and optimize internal initiatives.
Who are you?

You are a seasoned engineer who continuously delivers amazing customer experiences. You feel home with the customer, their needs and are obsessed to help them get the job done better than ever before. You take pride in defining, owning, and maintaining the technical work environment. Lastly, you have been looking for an opportunity where you can leverage your passion and skills for a greater good against financial crime.
What you'll do
Own and champion Beam's UI/UEX design & development building responsive web applications from the ground up
Collaborate with the team to build a distributed cloud based SaaS solution for transaction monitoring
Break down complex use case scenarios into simple and enjoyable customer experiences 
Design and build REST APIs
Participate in client interactions
What makes you a perfect fit?
10+ years creating well written, performant, and easily readable code using HTML5, Javascript, Node.js, and related frameworks
Hands-on experience developing responsive single page web applications, using technologies like Angular or React
Experience in creating prototypes and high-fidelity wireframes
Business driven and result-oriented individual
Obsessive attention to detail in delivering quality user experience and underlying software
Passionate about open source 
Relentless in keeping solutions secure
Familiar with cloud infrastructures such as AWS
Strive in a fast paced environment
Effective communication & collaboration skills
BS in Computer Science or related field
An existing portfolio or samples of work demonstrating relevant experience
Extra credit

Understanding of microservice architectures, principles and patterns
Experience with containerization
Understanding of messaging systems such as RabbitMQ
Experience with data visualization and displaying complex data structures
Worked in a financial services context related to risk management
Experience in blockchain technology and crypto-currency
Open source contributor
Acted as lead or mentor to others

Frontend.jobDescription:
Summary

 The comScore Front-end team is looking for a Software Engineer to design, build, and support complex front-end solutions using cutting-edge web technologies.

The comScore Front-end team is looking for a Software Engineer with experience in modern web frameworks. You will work with our product and UI/UX teams to define requirements and design features that are user-friendly and technically sound. You will build out components and unit tests using the latest version of Angular on the front-end and Node.js on the server-side. We use agile methodologies and all your work will be code reviewed, tested, and released during the course of a sprint.

 Responsibilities
 * Develop responsive front-end applications using Angular, Typescript, HTML, CSS
 * Collaborate effectively with product owners, design, and QA to define specifications and deliver features iteratively
 * Be passionate about code quality, testing and performance
 * Integrate with external APIs as well as build out APIs using Node.js

 Skills and Qualifications
 * BS in Computer Science or related engineering qualification
 * Proficient in web development technologies including JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
 * Prefer experience in at least one modern web framework such as Angular
 * Prefer experience with Node.js
 * Prefer experience with a statically typed language such as TypeScript
 * Prefer experience with writing unit tests and unit testing frameworks
 * Prefer experience with build systems, continuous integration (Jenkins), and distributed source control (Git)
 * Prefer experience in developing large scale/high traffic consumer facing web applications
 * A passion for user experience

 About comScore:   comScore is a leading cross-platform measurement company that measures audiences, brands and consumer behavior everywhere.

comScore completed its merger with Rentrak Corporation in January 2016, to create the new model for a dynamic, cross-platform world. Built on precision and innovation, comScore's data footprint combines proprietary digital, TV and movie intelligence with vast demographic details to quantify consumers' multiscreen behavior at massive scale. This approach helps media companies monetize their complete audiences and allows marketers to reach these audiences more effectively. With more than 3,200 clients and a global footprint in more than 70 countries, comScore is delivering the future of measurement.

Shares of comScore stock are currently traded on the OTC Market (OTC:SCOR).

 For more information on comScore, please visit comscore.com.

 EEO Statement:   We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Position Description
 CGI is seeking a Front End UX/UI Developer to join our Team in Richmond, VA for an exciting Child Welfare project.

In this role, you will take the features and prototypes created by UX designers and use a mix of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to code those designs; and will be responsible for creating and designing web components and templates that optimize user interaction and experience.

The ideal candidate will understand the differences between UI and UX design, and have a creative yet organized approach to tackling problems and creating mobile-friendly solutions. Those in the role will work closely with various members of this organization to play a key role in the successful launch of web features and application. Your future duties and responsibilities
 * Be responsible for Front End Developer responsibilities for the WV Child Welfare opportunity
 * Review designs created by UX designers; proactively ask any necessary clarifying questions during the design walkthroughs and during check-ins
 * Write necessary markup and code to implement those visual and interactive elements
 * Maintain quality and consistency of markup standards and css assets
 * Collaborate with internal team members (such as functional leads, developers and UX designers) for review and feedback
 * Implement consistently accessible markup with the goal of supporting Section 508 conformance (understanding and leveraging Section 508/WCAG 2.0 guidelines, ARIA, etc.)
 * Evaluating, testing, and validation technologies developed for Section 508 compliance by using available testing tools/checklists
 * Optimize features and applications to ensure fast loading speeds
 * Identify and troubleshoot various front-end issues and markup/coding problems
 * Collaborate with members of the website team (including UX designers and back-end developers) to consistently improve functionality and user-friendliness of the web applications
 * Maintain updated knowledge of the development industry and any advancements in technology
 * Meet deadlines as required Required qualifications to be successful in this role
 * 3+ years in a front end development role
 * Portfolio or samples of past work and projects
 * Familiarity of the general web development and deployment process, with an emphasis on front end design and development practices
 * Solid grasp of HTML 5, CSS 3, and building responsive web applications with Bootstrap v3 and/or v4
 * Solid grasp of Adobe Dreamweaver and wireframe tools (such as Wireframe CC)
 * Solid grasp of Javascript and frameworks such as JQuery and/or Angular JS
 * Ability to interpret and implement application and feature designs from prototypes and sketches
 * Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with designers, developers, and other relevant staff members or clients
 * Willingness to troubleshoot and solve complex problems
 * Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
 * Flexibility to adapt to evolving requirements

 Nice to Have Tools: Invision Studio, Sketch, Mockflow

 Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other related field Build your career with us.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Number: R0025430 


Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years. Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise. 

Front End Web Developer, Mid The Challenge: Are you passionate about crafting an amazing user experience? The right interface can make a mission efficient, encourage early adoption, and save time and resources. We're looking for you, a front end developer who will use equal parts skill and vision to build an experience that delivers functionality and efficiency. 

This is an opportunity to meet challenges in the improvised threat defeat client by collaborating with a development team to build solutions to combat ever-changing threats with user centric design. You'll work with intelligence analysts, business systems analysts, software developers, and network engineers to create a seamless user experience using JavaScript, Angular, HTML, CSS, Restful APIs, Java, Leaflet, and D3. You'll work with the development team to ensure accessibility for all users by developing a front end that functions across browsers, platforms, and devices while meeting accessibility and security requirements. With mentoring, positive code reviews, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers. Join us as we build systems to identify and defeat improvised threats for the better. 

Empower change with us. 
Build Your Career: A challenging and dynamic work environment isn't all we have to offer. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect:-access to experts in virtually every field-a culture that focuses on supporting our employees-opportunities that provide stability while offering variety 

You'll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal featuring more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We'll help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success. 
You Have: -Experience with server-side application development using languages, including Java, PHP, or Python-Experience with usability analysis, testing, and client-facing engagements, including design discussions and product demonstrations -Experience with structured build software, including Gulp, Grunt, or NPM-TS/SCI clearance-BA or BS degree in Computer Engineering or 4+ years of experience with HTML, CSS, or C#, including CSS frameworks, such as Bootstrap or Foundation and 3+ years of experience with developing front-end applications-DoD 8570 Compliant Security+ or CISSP Certification prior to start 
Nice If You Have: -Experience in working with various intelligence disciplines, including GEOINT, HUMINT, MASINT, OSINT, and SIGINT and comprehension of the data and tools associated with these disciplines-Experience with Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) operations, including small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS)-Experience with testing frameworks, including Jasmine, Karma, or Selenium -Experience with Linux scripting in BASH or Perl -Experience with using JavaScript visualization libraries, including D3, Leaflet, CytoscapeJS, and VizJS-Experience with network security, including access and authorization for PKI and chain trusting -Experience with Agile development methodologies -Knowledge of JIRA, Confluence, Git, and GitHub or GitLab -Knowledge of Web development, JavaScript, JSON REST, CORS, JSONP, Web architecture, and HTTP specification 
Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Description 



UX Front-End Developer 



Epsilon's User Experience team is responsible for designing great customer experiences across the organizations growing product suite. We're looking for a UX Front-End Developer to work directly with UX Designers and Developers to build pixel-perfect UI components based on supplied design specifications. You'll be a key player in building out living style guides from the ground up and your use of scalable and efficient code will be applied to the development of world-class platforms and applications. This position is located in either our Wakefield, MA or Irving, TX office.  

What you'll do 


Bridge the gap between user interface design and technical implementation  
Develop reusable code and components for Epsilon's style guides  
Implement new features for Epsilon's products by quickly and efficiently transforming mockups into working user interfaces  
Work alongside UX team to ensure style guide components are accurately represented across products  
Collaborate with other development teams to develop a strategy that enables a great user experience  
Continuously research new and best coding practices  

The skills you'll need 


Demonstrated mastery of HTML5 and CSS3  
Proficient understanding of JavaScript  
Experience building and maintaining living style guides and implementing them across multiple products  
Passion for user experience and user-centric development  
Strong communication skills that include leading design-related conversations, ability to build and nurture good relationships and foster an environment for open, productive, collaboration  
Self-starter and passionate learner  
Creative problem-solver with a strong eye for detail  
Strong team player who is able to self-manage time and deliverables proactively  
Experience with version and source control, preferably Git, Github and Jira  

Other skills we'd like 


Experience with Bootstrap, Angular, React, SASS  
Experience working in an Agile team structure  
Experience working alongside UX team  
Familiarity with Sketch, InVision, Zeplin, Adobe Creative Suite or similar tools  

Experience & Education 


4+ years of experience in front-end development or related discipline  
Degree in computer science, design or related field  

What it's like to work at Epsilon 


Collaborative and friendly environment  
Casual dress code  
Open workspaces  
Flexible work schedule  
Unlimited vacation time  
Community Service Programs  
Training opportunities  

Qualifications 


Conditions of Employment 
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.

  Great People, Deserve Great Benefits 
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly.  If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.  From tuition reimbursement to scholarship programs to employee stock purchase plans and 401(k)s, we offer associates a variety of benefits that work as hard for them as they work for us.

  About Epsilon 
Epsilon(r) is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon's digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs and through CJ Affiliate, one of the world's largest affiliate marketing networks. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest, that help drive business growth for brands.  Recognized by Ad Age as the #1 World's Largest CRM/Direct Marketing Network, #1 Largest U.S. Agency from All Disciplines and #1 Largest U.S. Mobile Marketing Agency, Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. Frontend.jobskills: javascript
Frontend.jobDescription:
About the Job:
  RedShelf is looking for a Front End Developer
 to work on our web based e-reader.  You would be helping us by working on new features for accessibility and studying.  A typical day would involve developing code, reviewing code for others, writing unit/integration tests, and working with the team to plan out new features or bug fixes.

Developers on our e-reader team work hard to deliver an excellent product used by 100’s of thousands of students each year.  We need developers who care about creating a great experience for people using our platform.

What are We Looking For?


First and foremost, we are looking for someone who is passionate about development and making an impact in the higher education market. Ideal candidates should a bachelor’s degree in computing, math, engineering, or another related field plus at least 3+ years of development experience with a focus in Front-End technology preferably with teams that have run Agile and/or Scrum methodology. Previous work with a Front-End JavaScript Framework (Ember, Angular, React, etc.) would be a requirement; Ember is preferred.  We need someone who has worked closely on a team to build and maintain a large JavaScript application.  And of course, we would love to have someone with experience in the education/publishing industry, but it’s not required. 

Written and verbal communication skills will be essential to this position, specifically regarding effective communication with stakeholders, including senior leadership. You should be comfortable developing and leading projects and assignments independently with little to no direction. We are looking for an individual who is capable of balancing multiple priorities, meeting deadlines, and showcasing the flexibility to adapt to the changing needs of a scrappy startup business. 

What’s the Tech Stack?
  RedShelf is based largely on open source software and tools.  If you have experience with any of the following it would be great but we are willing to train someone with the right passion and personality.
Javascript
HTML
Ember
SASS
Git
Docker

What Do We Have to Offer?
  RedShelf's team is passionate, entrepreneurial-minded and serious about making an impact in higher ed. We are committed to our mission of improving education, and that commitment flows through in everything we do. Besides our comprehensive benefit package that includes employees stock options, we offer an engaging office culture and frequent onsite and offsite events including video game tournaments, intramural sports teams, happy hours, volunteer work, and more. 

EEO Statement:
  RedShelf is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Women, people of color, individuals with a disability, veterans, and others who would enrich the diversity of RedShelf are encouraged to apply

Frontend.jobskills: Agile, Analysis, AngularJS, Business Intelligence, CSS, Developer, Development, Java, JavaScript, Lifecycle, Project, Security, User Interface
Frontend.jobDescription:
Req ID 96316BR Business Title Front End Developer with JavaScript Group MSS Location USA VIRGINIA Sterling Clearance Level Needed None Category Information Technology Job Duties and Responsibilities 
ManTech is seeking experienced and skilled professionals to provide Business Intelligence Support Services to assist the Customs Border Protection to effectively and efficiently identifying cargo, individuals and conveyances that may present additional risk to the United States; conduct terrorism analysis and global assessments that convey changes in terrorism threats and identify emerging threats; develop and evaluate CBP-wide intelligence based targeting rules and intelligence driven special operations; and coordinate and enhance analysis and targeting efforts. 

   
The Java Developer-Front End with JavaScript will: 


• Design, implement and maintain modern Single Page Application user interfaces with modern JavaScript frameworks (specifically Angular JS and React) 

• Design and utilize REST APIs in Single Page Applications 

• Work with customers and team members in an agile development environment  

• Follow Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) best practices for code build and deployments 

• Present the solution at formal and informal design reviews, and document the design according to the Government’s system lifecycle methodology  
  Location: 
 Dependent on Customer direction in either Alexandria, VA or Sterling, VA or Herndon, VA   


   

    Qualifications 
 Minimum Requirements: 


• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field  

• Minimum of 2+ years of modern JavaScript UI development experience using front end frameworks 

• Specific knowledge of AngularJS and/or React is required 

• Demonstrated expertise with User Interface technologies like HTML5, CSS/SCSS (experience using Bootstrap and Material Design is a plus) 

• Demonstrated experience in software engineering practices (e.g., reading/generating software specs, design patterns, continuous integration)  

• Demonstrated ability to think critically and creatively to develop innovative solutions to software problems  

•  Must meet the US Citizenship requirement and be able to obtain and maintain a Customs Border Protection Background Investigation 


   
Desired Skills: 


• Agile development experience a plus  

• First-hand experience working with large project teams (working with the Federal Government a strong plus)  

• TS clearance preferred   Degrees Equivalent Experience/Education 
 Bachelor's Degree 
Years of Experience 02-04 years w/Bachelors Degree 
 See Qualifications 
Position Type Full-Time Shift Day Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

The right interface can make a mission efficient, encourage early adoption, and save time and resources. We're looking for you, a front end developer who will use equal parts skill and vision to build an experience that delivers functionality and efficiency. 

This is an opportunity to meet challenges in the improvised threat defeat client by collaborating with a development team to build solutions to combat ever-changing threats with user centric design. You'll work with intelligence analysts, business systems analysts, software developers, and network engineers to create a seamless user experience using JavaScript, Angular, HTML, CSS, Restful APIs, Java, Leaflet, and D3. You'll work with the development team to ensure accessibility for all users by developing a front end that functions across browsers, platforms, and devices while meeting accessibility and security requirements. With mentoring, positive code reviews, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers. Join us as we build systems to identify and defeat improvised threats for the better. 

Empower change with us. 
Build Your Career: A challenging and dynamic work environment isn't all we have to offer. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect:-access to experts in virtually every field-a culture that focuses on supporting our employees-opportunities that provide stability while offering variety 

You'll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal featuring more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We'll help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success.

Duties & Responsibilities

 Medical Science & Computing is searching for a midlevel or senior Front-end Developer specializing in JavaScript to support the National Institutes of Health (NIH). This is a temporary position (with option to extend) located at the NIH Campus in Bethesda, MD.

Requirements

 Duties and Responsibilities
 * Develop, create, and incorporate new components for user interaction and scientific data visualization, using modern APIs and frameworks (jQuery, jQuery UI, Node, Angular, React, et al.)
 * Build robust, performant, user-facing web applications in python/Django supporting millions of daily users
 * Work as an integral part of an agile product team to deliver an unbelievably great user experience
 * Deliver responsive, accessible, mobile-friendly code of high quality (automated test/build/deploy)

 Position Requirements

* Must be intelligent, self-motivated, a quick learner, technical, and have a curious mind.

 * Excellent JavaScript skills (including ES6+)
 * Semantic markup and modern web layout techniques
 * Responsive design
 * Experience in JS testing
 * Basic knowledge of Python/Django (including testing)

 Highly Desired
 * Front-end performance
 * Adept at agile techniques and practices (DRY, KISS, 12factor, TDD)
 * Selenium testing
 * Accessibility
 * Usability/User-centered design
