Frontend.jobDescription:
Want to be a part of changing healthcare?  Want make it easier for customers to get the care they need?  Want to help people in our community lead healthier lives?  
 
That’s what WE are all about.  At OhioHealth, “Believe in WE” is more than just our tagline.  It’s the philosophy that drives our collaborative approach to improving the health of those we serve…bringing together customers, care teams, and associates.  Our Digital team plays a central role in OhioHealth’s transformation to be more consumer-centric.  
 
To achieve our bold goals, we’re looking for passionate, talented professionals that are:
Inspired by our mission: To improve the health of those we serve
Committed to our cardinal value: We honor the dignity and worth of each person
Motivated by our core values: Integrity, Compassion, Excellence, and Stewardship
 
Our Digital team is a blend of experts from Technology, Marketing, and Design who work together as one team to deliver exceptional user experiences. We’re in the middle of building a best-of-Digital discipline in-house…   
Think you might have what it takes to work with us?  If you answer yes to 100% of the following questions, we should talk!
 
1.   Are you motivated by our mission to change healthcare and make our community healthier?
2.   Do your previous digital experiences include delivering amazing product like a BOSS? (The droids we are looking for include developers, technical leads and product managers)
3.   Did you get the “droids you are looking for” reference (or at least have enough curiosity to look it up)?  Either way, did it make you smile?
4.   Do you get all goose-bumpy when you hear executives talk about how they’re committed to investing in Design Thinking, Agile, R&D, and their team?
 
You said yes four times?  Awesome.  Here’s the scope of the role:
Job Description


We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Someone who embraces Agile principles and practices. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designers, Product Owner (PO) and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.

Responsibilities

Develop new user-facing features
Build reusable code and libraries for future use
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
Participate in daily stand ups, sprint grooming, retrospectives, demos and lunch-n-learns

Skills And Qualifications

Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3.
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, like jQuery, AngularJS, ReactJS
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
Use Test Driven Development (TDD) to build the right functionality
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, TFS, Subversion

Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that applications adhere to them
CSS systems such as LESS and SASS to compile style files
Analytics solutions, such as Google Analytics
Standards-compliant code
Integrating HTML/CSS into ASP.NET environment using Visual Studio
Additional tools in your arsenal: Jasmine, Karma, Node, npm, redux, Jest, Cordova, Jenkins, Istanbul
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
3+ years’ web development experience required
2+ years’ app development experience preferred

Check out this link on YouTube! https://youtu.be/kYzNOMZJ4ps

TCI (TRI-COR Industries, Inc.) is a global IT Services and Software Products firm with a successful 34-year track record in delivering top-notch products, services and solutions to both the private and public sectors. We are a CMMI Level 3 company in both Services and Development and operate two Innovation labs where we research, develop and apply leading edge technologies prior to bringing innovations to our clients to solve their business problems. Metro Area, O’Fallon, IL, Denver, CO, Fort Gordon, GA, Dayton, OH, Burlington, VT, Oklahoma City, OK, Kansas City, MO, and The Republic of Iraq. About Vistex:


Vistex is the global leader in Go-to-Market software, providing enterprise solutions that help businesses effectively manage pricing, incentive, rebate, royalty and channel programs. With a longstanding and unique strategic relationship with SAP, Vistex offers on-premise software embedded in SAP ERP, as well as cloud-based applications. Vistex solutions enable the end-to-end administration of today’s complex, business-critical Go-to-Market programs. When companies implement Vistex software they are empowered with increased visibility into program performance, the right data to make more informed decisions, and the tools to drive revenue, streamline processes, control costs and prevent leakages. What’s more, Vistex delivers success by combining our core product development skills with world-class implementation, analytic and strategy services.

Headquartered in Hoffman Estates, IL, and with locations around the world, Vistex is searching for dynamic, enthusiastic team members to contribute to the long-term success of both Vistex and our clients!

 “Applicants for U.S. based positions with Vistex must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.”

Frontend.jobDescription:
At ProSight, digital innovation is key to our continued success and growth. The Digital team is a core component of our strategy to deliver a differentiated experience to customers and partners. The Digital team is responsible for developing online and mobile solutions for our customers, agents and employees through engaging interfaces enabled by cutting-edge technologies. We believe that the best solutions occur when the right mix of disciplines and skills are brought together on an integrated team that is open to ideas, is not afraid to push the envelope, and is ready to challenge the status quo of the Insurance industry. We are looking to build the core competencies of our team with people who are energetic, entrepreneurial, and driven by a desire to make a significant impact.

Our ideal candidate has outstanding JavaScript skills, is very experienced in AngularJS, and has a passion for code and technology. We are an agile team, so you will be a key participant in building applications and solving complex business problems. You will look for the best, and most efficient, patterns for solving a problem; if you’ve never had experience with it, you are willing to dig in and learn. Our ideal candidate is flexible, adaptive, prefers simplicity over complexity, is self-motivated, and exhibits a bias for action

 

Responsibilities:


 
Develop the client-side user interface of single-page web applications, that closely adhere to visual designs and established design standards, ensuring that they render appropriately across multiple devices and browsers
Participate in design and requirements planning, providing feedback based on your knowledge of client-side controls, patterns and best practices
Work within, and help establish, client-side coding guidelines, to ensure reusability, modularity and efficiency
Work closely with your product team to prioritize and implement new application features, while simultaneously maintaining the quality of existing features and functionality
Monitor the performance of production web applications to look for opportunities for optimization
Assist the product team in managing and grooming the product backlog, assigning points to backlog items to correctly establish velocity, and establishing sprint goals
Own the planning, completion, integration and quality of the code you produce
Stay up to date with technology, tools, design trends, and industry best practices to help evolve the brand and team skills

Qualifications:


 
Preferred 3+ years’ experience developing responsive, single-page applications using the AngularJS framework
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent work experience
Deep knowledge of HTML, CSS, REST, JSON, NODE, Bower and similar modern web frameworks/technologies, including Foundation, Bootstrap, React, or similar
You are comfortable with Agile development tools such as Basecamp, Visual Studio Team Services, Jira Agile, or VersionOne
Working knowledge of source control systems such as Github
Working knowledge of debugging, performance monitoring, benchmarking, logging and testing tools
CMS experience is not required, but is a plus
Your code is clean, efficient, and you strive for reusability in your designs
Strong technical understanding of the full stack of digital technologies (browser and server-side), and how they combine to deliver a superior user experience
Strong customer orientation
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
Motivated to create meaningful product experiences for users
Customer-centric, willingness to deep dive to understand customer needs and business drivers
Have a voice to communicate effectively with people who may not speak your “language” as a developer
Passion to succeed and continually improve skills
Desire to exceed expectations and to manage multiple projects while meeting tight deadlines
Detail-oriented and organized
Excellent problem solver and comfortable in a fast-paced environment
Capacity to set expectations and be self-directed
Team player

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Number: R0021494 


Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years. Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise. 

Front End DeveloperKey Role:Develop requirements and prototypes for analytic tools for countering WMD (CWMD) mission space and use existing technologies on classified networks to provide clients with CWMD situational awareness. Work with the task lead to identify development requirements and associate use cases with them. Work with multiple levels of technologies to synthesize robust and repeatable analytic processes and visualizations to support clients and create standard operating procedures for users. 

Basic Qualifications:-Experience in a professional work environment-Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS-Experience with SharePoint or MVC Web framework, including Angular, Ember, Backbone, Knockout, or Backbone-TS/SCI clearance-BA or BS degree 

Additional Qualifications:-Experience with developing on closed networks-Experience with Agile development-Experience with databases, including SQL or NoSQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or Microsoft Access-Experience with Python and other scripting languages, including bash, sh, or Perl-Experience with Django, Model Mommy, or iPython Notebook-Experience with TypeScript, ECMAScript, or Sass-Experience with CI/CD tools, including Jenkins, SonarCube, Artifactory, or Gulp-Experience with SCM and tools, including Git, Github, Gitlab, or Bitbucket-Experience with ArcGIS, Leaflet, ArcGIS API for JavaScript, or ArcGIS Server-Experience with the CWMD mission-Experience in the nuclear, chemical, or biological fields-Experience with the DoD or the IC as an analyst-Experience with the IC, COCOM, or Interagency, including the Department of State or Department of Energy 

Clearance: 

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.AFH26, CB16

Frontend.jobDescription:
Front End Developer 
   for Dominion Enterprises to work at our Norfolk, VA loc.  

[DESCRIPTION:] 



Pos will create user interface in AngularJS, SASS, + HTML. Work in Agile Dev environments w/ JavaScript frameworks (i.e., AngularJS + ReactJS). Write + test the various components required to successfully build a site in Model-View-Controller architecture w/ minimal assistance. Create Directives, Controllers, + Services for main functionality as well as styling + layout required for display templates. Work in NodeJS repositories to connect files to database-driven info. Opportunity to work full stack.   May undergo background checks incl drug screen and ref checks. 



[REQUIREMENTS:] 



Must have Bach in Comp Sci, Engineering, or rel field and 2 yrs rel exp in an Agile Development environment, HTML programming, CSS programming, JavaScript programming, and AngularJS 1 or 1.4. 

About Dominion Enterprises 


Dominion Enterprises (“DE”) is a leading digital marketing and software services company offering client solutions across multiple business verticals. Our customers rely on our B2B cloud SaaS solutions to establish their online and mobile brands, generate leads, and manage customer relationships through our Homes.com, Dominion Dealer Solutions, Dominion Business Solutions / DX1, Travel Media and Franchise and Business Opportunity divisions. Our B2C web and mobile applications include Homes.com, HotelCoupons.com, FranchiseOpportunities.com, FranchiseGator.com, Franchise.com, and BusinessBroker.net.   About 2,000 employees reside and work in our Norfolk, VA home office and in offices across the   U.S.    Our employees will tell you about our collaborative, innovative, team-oriented work environment, excellent career enrichment opportunities, community service opportunities, competitive earnings, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a generous 401(k). DE is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse workforce. DE is a drug-testing employer.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Summary / Description

We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Front End Java Developer (UI)
 to join our team in Falls Church, VA,
 to begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems.
 
Responsibilities:

 
Building dynamic web applications using Java technology stack and experience in the development of desktop browser and mobile web-based UI.  The candidate must have strong UI development skills using Angular2/4 and be well versed with Typescript/Javascript/JQuery.  The candidate will predominately work on UI development using Angular2/4.
 
The candidate must be willing to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple assignments and must actively support and contribute to the Agile practices adopted by the development team.  Must have a proven history of building responsive web applications and working as a multi-tier developer who can contribute to development efforts on database, server and user interface components.
 
Required Skills:
Angular 2/4/Typescript/Javascript/Html5/CSS 
Web services using REST 
Good knowledge of Oracle SQL
JAVA/JEE
Spring /JPA/ Hibernate
Agile SCRUM 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers
Work with external teams to resolve testing issues and bug fixes. 
Experience with large-scale enterprise wide IT environments containing multiple technologies, servers and logical environments
Ability to obtain a federal security clearance
Strongly Preferred Skills Sets:


• Knowledge and experience of building Applications in a cloud based environment
Requirements


Position Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 10 years of related experience or equivalent
US Citizen
CBP-BI Clearance or ability to obtain one

About Unisys

Do you have what it takes to be mission critical?
 

Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.  As a member of our diverse team, you’ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems. 

Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.

Unisys
 is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. We work with many of the world's largest companies and government organizations to secure and keep their mission-critical operations running at peak performance; streamline and transform their data centers; enhance support to their end users and constituents; and modernize their enterprise applications. We do this while protecting and building on their legacy IT investments. Our offerings include outsourcing and managed services, systems integration and consulting services, high-end server technology, cybersecurity and cloud management software, and maintenance and support services. Unisys has more than 23,000 employees serving clients around the world. 

Unisys offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, a 401k with an immediately vested company match, vacation and educational benefits. To learn more about Unisys visit us at www.Unisys.com.


Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) - Minorities, Females, Disabled Persons, and Veterans.

Frontend.jobskills: Computers General
Frontend.jobDescription:
Summary / Description

We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented UI/UX Java Developer 
to join our team in Alexandria, VA
 to begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems. 
 
Seeking experienced full stack Java developer with hands on experience building dynamic web applications on a Java technology stack. Candidates with the strongest experience for UI/UX design and experience with Federal Section 508 standards will be evaluated more favorably. Candidate must be able to provide task-level estimates, actively participate in project events, provide alternative delivery options, communicate issues and impediments to appropriate management personnel, and make commitments to the rest of the team regarding task completion. Must actively support and contribute to the Agile practices adopted by the development team. 
 
Java Developer resources will perform the majority of the development support to provide the functionality identified by the user community, troubleshoot issues, and identify/fix anomalies. It is crucial that these resources be accustomed and comfortable working within a team-based agile environment that is centric to software development. These resources will also provide operational support within the defined support hours. Strong communication skills are required to communicate with team members, other OIT resources, stakeholders, and end users.
 
Responsibilities

Translate application user stories and use cases into functional applications
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java and Javascript code
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation
Research new Java-based frameworks, techniques and tools 
Communicate effectively with multiple teams and team members, as well as with OIT resources, stakeholders, and end users.

Requirements

Required skills:
Bachelor's degree and minimum 10 years of experience or equivalent blend of education and experience.
Candidates must have at least 5 years total Java experience; strong analytical skills; Bachelor degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.
The Strongest candidates will be:
• Proficient with JavaScript and have experience with open-source web application frameworks (AngularJS preferred).
• Extensive experience with CSS/SASS/Less and CSS frameworks (e.g. Bootstrap. 
• Expertise with the standards for 508 compliance/508 Trusted Tester Certification.
Proficient in Java, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems
Skill for writing reusable Java libraries
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming
Familiar with various design and architectural patterns
Implementing unit tests (i.e. Junit, Karma)
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Familiar with continuous integration
 
Hands-on experience in:
Spring framework, 
Data access layer using iBatis or Hibernate
AngularJS or similar JavaScript framework (i.e. Ember, React, or Node)
Oracle SQL

About Unisys

Do you have what it takes to be mission critical?
 

Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.  As a member of our diverse team, you’ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems. 

Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.

Unisys
 is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. We work with many of the world's largest companies and government organizations to secure and keep their mission-critical operations running at peak performance; streamline and transform their data centers; enhance support to their end users and constituents; and modernize their enterprise applications. We do this while protecting and building on their legacy IT investments. Our offerings include outsourcing and managed services, systems integration and consulting services, high-end server technology, cybersecurity and cloud management software, and maintenance and support services. Unisys has more than 23,000 employees serving clients around the world. 

Unisys offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, a 401k with an immediately vested company match, vacation and educational benefits. To learn more about Unisys visit us at www.Unisys.com.


Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) - Minorities, Females, Disabled Persons, and Veterans.

Frontend.jobskills: Front-End Blend Developer, XAML, C#, WPF, MVVM, Microsoft Blend, Blend Software Developer, Blend Software Engineer, Blend Software Architect
Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-End Blend Developer

 

***Company has experienced significant growth, having doubled in size the last 5 years!***


 

Looking for a Front-End XAML, C# WPF, MVVM, Blend Developer to craft front end user experience for expanding product offering. Company designs, develops and maintains the most powerful trading tools on the market. Target users are institutional traders in all asset classes and their front end experience is critical to their market access.

 

The ideal Front End Blend Developer is passionate about detail, appearance and the interactive feel of the application. Frequent iteration to refine the design/interaction and implementation should come naturally. The Front End Blend Developer must have the ability to work collaboratively across multiple teams working on different projects and identify efficient code reuse between them. This is a great opportunity to contribute to the user experience design process at every step. Teams are small and fast paced matching market and customer demands for new features.

 

Responsibilities:

 

-The Front End Blend Developer will work collaboratively on multiple teams to develop concepts, prototypes and front end production code.

-The Front End Blend Developer will produce high quality production-ready front end XAML code working with a C# developer.

-The Front End Blend Developer will produce XAML code to bring to life UX specifications from visual designers.

-The Front End Blend Developer should understand and use existing styles and design patterns as well as develop new, extensible controls including maintaining multiple Style Dictionaries and themes.

-The Front End Blend Developer will design and develop new XAML components using current XAML best practices blending code and design using Microsoft Expression Blend.

-The Front End Blend Developer will create interactive XAML prototypes to proof and test new interactions, visuals, and animations.

-The Front End Blend Developer will iterate on prototype and product quality by testing for and fixing issues.

 

Qualifications:

 

-Experience with Front-End XAML, C#, WPF, MVVM, Microsoft Expression Blend.

-Must be able to provide visual and code examples of WPF Front Ends.

-Thrive in fast paced delivery environment; Start-up experience is a plus.

-Must be able to work onsite at the company’s Great Neck, Long Island New York office.

 

Nice to have:

 

-Experience in the financial industry.

-Experience working with a front end team focused on the user experience.

-Linux/UNIX basic shell skills.

-Experience with 3rd party toolkits such as Infragistics, DevExpress or Telerik.

-Agile development methods.

-Git, CVS or other version control system exposure.

-Working knowledge of Visual Studio.

 

Benefits:

 


-We have a dynamic, fast-paced working environment

-Employees enjoy free lunch on Wednesdays and an active social group

-401(k) plan

-Generous paid time off and additional sick days

-Medical, dental and vision insurance plans

-Widely recognized NYSE holidays

-Employee Assistance Programs & work – life assistance

-Exclusive service that provides members with access and discounts to a variety of entertainment offers

-Annual corporate holiday party

-Employee referral bonus scheme

 

Keywords: Great Neck NY Jobs, Front-End Blend Developer, XAML, C#, WPF, MVVM, Microsoft Blend, Blend Software Developer, Blend Software Engineer, Blend Software Architect, New York Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, New York Recruiting

Frontend.jobskills: front end, technical leader, Java, CRUX, AEM, Angular JS, Agile, RESTful API, HTML, Javascript
Frontend.jobDescription:
The Robinson Group is representing a Fortune 500 client who has just opened up a highly visible, permanent role on their Digital/Commerce group. It is an opportunity to work in a company where digital is the driver of the organization.

Career advancement, competitive salary and bonus and excellent benefits. 

Please send your resume to joliver@robinsongroup.com to start the process.

The Senior Front-End Developer/Lead will leverage leading technology platforms to realize business goals, accelerate front end deliverables, and streamline development processes. The individual will influence the use of tools and strategies as they expand across the Digital Landscape.

The successful candidate will have experience working in industries and companies on the leading edge of Digital Experience and Digital Commerce.  The team is looking for someone who is passionate about front end technologies and expert on the future of digital experience platforms. 

Responsibilities & Qualifications


This senior position will provide leadership and technical expertise in Front End Digital Technologies.

Individual is responsible for translating business requirements into technical specifications and building interactive and responsive user interfaces using cutting-edge technologies including Angular.js, Node.js, and HTML5.

Will establish UI/UX development standards and implement best in class tools to make UI/UX development fast and efficient. 

Individual will provide technical leadership for the company's website and other external facing properties. 

Responsibilities include establishing consistency of UI and UX interactions across browsers, multiple devices, build to address performance and asset caching concerns, and address global experience expectations. 

Additional responsibilities include:
Architect and implement reusable front end frameworks to support multi-channel delivery of solutions across Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) and JAVA applications.
Collaborate with the CRUX/Design teams to understand vision and establish a front-end competency that moves at the pace of business.
Define best practice around use of tools, processes, and development standards to streamline the interaction between creative and development teams.
Lead front end architectural improvements and create shared visual components that span services.
Work collaboratively with vendor teams to deliver solutions. Ensure front-end coding standard and best practices are followed by internal and external teams.
Prototype and develop new ideas and participate in the lifecycle of experience development from research to release.
Identify and implement support and front-end testing tools for team.
Provide technical leadership for the development team.

Competencies


The ideal candidate should possess the following qualifications:
7+ years of working experience in rapid product development building web pages / applications using JavaScript, JQuery, CSS, HTML
Commanding grasp of HTML, CSS, Javascript and responsive web design
5 + years of consuming RESTful APIs and WebServices
5+ Advanced experience with Javascript frameworks such as AngularJS (Required), Ember, or Backbone
3+ years of experience with Agile SCRUM
3+ Experience with data-driven product development, analytics, A/B testing, SEO, and accessibility techniques
Advanced knowledge of CSS rules and browser compatibility
Experience with CDN and CMS is a plus
Deep understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations
Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written, including good technical writing and interpersonal skills
Knowledge of Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Platform
Knowledge of SEO/SEM strategies & Adobe Analytics

Educational Required/Desired: 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, OR equivalent experience and knowledge required.

Frontend.jobskills: Web Engineering Lead, Front End Web Developer, UI Architect, Front End Web Engineer,UI Lead Engineer, Web Architecture,  Front End Architect,Angular.Js, React.js, ,API, CSS, Saas , Semiconductor ,chip
Frontend.jobDescription:
Hello

Our direct client is hiring their first Front end developer on full time basis in Palo Alto CA. Please check the JD and send me your update resume if you are available for a challenging role.

Front end Developer - Semiconductor/Chipset industry 


Palo Alto CA


Full time


Immediate hire


Semiconductor industry exp must 


We’re looking for a product-oriented frontend engineer to build productive and intuitive web applications. We want an engineer who can strike a balance between design and engineering and help us define a novel product in an old industry.

As Client’s first frontend software engineer, you will make architectural and technological decisions that shape the foundation of their products.

Responsibilities

Building a frontend application using a modern JS framework (the choice is yours!)
Implementing reusable and responsive frontend components and styles
Developing automated tests to prevent software bugs and browser incompatibilities
Maintaining our static corporate website (currently in Jekyll)
Helping out wherever needed on other web interfaces (e.g. other websites, marketing landing pages, emails, etc.)
Working with Sales, Marketing, and Engineering to design and ship new features

Qualifications

Experience building a frontend application with modern JS frameworks such as React, Vue.js, or AngularJS
Experience with integrating with a backend API and working with backend engineers to design the API
Strong knowledge of CSS, with an eye for cross-browser compatibility and modularity
Can work independently and can ship features with little guidance

Nice to Have

Expert-level experience with some JavaScript or CSS framework or tool
Visual design chops and the ability to create pixel-perfect, high fidelity mockups
Product design experience with a SaaS product
Backend software engineering experience with building an API backend service and database design
Experience in the semiconductor industry and SoC design

 

Nitesh

Nitesh (at) tivasys (dot) com

408-617-5058

Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
JavaScript, UI, TEAM LEAD Front End UI Development

If you are a Front End Lead with experience, please read on!

We are a legacy AND pressing driver in the video streaming and content space, focused on multinational markets and US markets alike. We are redefining how content is distributed and we represent some HUGE titles and entertainment houses. 

We are a high performance team, and operate under our own product umbrella, so we are looking to add to our team with that culture in mind. We encourage giving you the autonomy to use your creativity and engineering chops to get the job done.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Awesome location in Marina Del Rey
Leadership from Big4Tech backgrounds - positive leadership, that is:) Culture is super important to us. 
Anti "small cog in the wheel" mentality - chance to use new tech 
Money
Really cool product in the streaming space.

What You Will Be Doing

We need a strong front end engineer who knows all the basics on front end UI, and who is also creative to add extra touches to our products. Again, serving content from different brands and genres, there's a lot of creativity  and core engineering skills we're hoping for here.

What You Need for this Position

College experience and knowledge of:

- JavaScript - you should be pretty strong with the fundamentals
- UI
- knowledge or interest in backend (python/django). may operate like a fullstack role from time to time (mostly front end though)

What's In It for You

Money
Team 
We think - a coveted brand on your resumeSo, if you are a Front End Lead with experience, please apply today!

Frontend.jobskills: Javascript Frameworks, Front End Development, Angular / Backbone / RequireJS / Bootstrap, Git Version Control, .NET - Javascript Frameworks, Front End Development, Angular / Backbone / RequireJS / Bootstrap, Git Version Control, .NET
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
Javascript Frameworks, Front End Development, Angular / Backbone / RequireJS / Bootstrap, Git Version Control, .NET

If you are a Senior Front End Developer with experience, please read on!

What You Will Be Doing

The Front End Developer is a key role on a collaborative project team, responsible for the design and coding of solutions that enhance the user experience and increase efficiency of our mission critical, enterprise-scale business systems. Frontend.jobskills: Front End PHP Developer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Software Developer, Front-End


We're seeking an Application Developer focused on front-end technologies to join our web application team. Our challenge is to provide applications as the organization continues to grow and expand its client base in the financial services industry. Each department has a number of different needs, but there is also some overlap, so we have to make constant decisions to avoid code duplication, such as creating microservices or authoring libraries.

About the Team


Our development team believes that code is craft, writing software is a creative endeavor, and that the work we do is part of what makes our organization successful. We believe that small, empowered teams can do amazing things. We also believe in always picking the right tool for the job instead of using something "because that's what we've always done."
 We use a number of technologies in our projects, including:

PHP and C# 

jQuery, Angular 4 and React

REST APIs and GraphQL

Bootstrap and Semantic UI

SQL Server and MySQL


About the Job


You'll be helping us build new tools for the rapidly growing departments in our organization, including internal applications, web-accessible REST APIs, and front-end user experiences. You will also be responsible for updating and maintaining existing front-end projects/libraries in order to make sure they remain consistent with our front-end standards. The teams assigned to each project are typically two or three developers who work closely with our project management team and internal users. You'll use your extensive knowledge of JavaScript, HTML and CSS to improve our web-based applications. You will be responsible for helping us improve our front-end standards and help maintain documentation related to those standards.

About You


You're a developer who can turn requirements into reliable code that other people -- and your future self -- will find easy to read and modify. 
 You will be successful in this role if you:

Write client-side JavaScript, both with and without frameworks.

Have experience with modern JavaScript and TypeScript.

Have expertise in building complex layouts with CSS and HTML.

Enjoy helping other developers grow and learn new technologies.

Have strong UX and design sensibilities as well as a desire to sweat the small stuff.

Have experience with Javascript testing via Mocha, Jasmine, Jest or a similar unit testing tool.

Can be autonomous and self-driven.

Have excellent written and verbal communication skills. 


We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Frontend.jobskills: SPA, Single Page Applications, React, Redux, JavaScript, Front End, Node
Frontend.jobDescription:
We are seeking a Senior Front-End Developer to help build out our new single page web apps (React/Redux) and refactor some of our current non (React/Redux) applications. We're looking for a dynamic individual who can build well-designed, performant and effective front-end web applications that support complex business rules/flows.

You will start by learning from the experiences of our current team and our current offerings and become intimately familiar with our ASP.NET/knockout technology stack. As you improve your understanding of our business logic, you will contribute your React/Redux experiences by architecting and leading your team to develop new web apps to deliver by the middle of 2017.

You will leverage your experience to establish best practices for web development and drive the team and the codebase to a higher level. You will also have the chance to collaborate with architects in the development and implementation of our upcoming Platform as a Service (PaaS), as well as architects from the mobile team that work with the same stack (React Native/Redux).

The ideal candidate will look not only to lead, collaborate, and develop their career, but also be hungry to assist others in the development of their own careers. You’ll have the chance to set the tone of the platform you’ll be working on.

Responsibilities

Within two months of your start, utilize an agreed up technology stack (React/Redux, etc.) to create well-tested, low-latency web apps
Drive front end architectural decisions to develop a maintainable and reliable set of edge applications
Collaborate with other teams to build microservices that can serve many applications and scale independently
Enable our product team to tap into valuable data sources and build incredible features for our customers
Actively participate in all PaaS projects and work together to build high-quality solutions
Present ideas in the form of brown bags to all engineers to help shape our technical landscape
Provide constructive feedback on pull requests to increase code quality

Qualifications


We need developers who share our passion for building cutting-edge web and mobile apps. You should be active in the development community, and be passionate about all things front end. We’ve got the fast pace and agility of a startup along with the scale and security of an established company with thousands of customers. We are looking for candidates who have:
7+ years experience developing single page web applications

1+ years of experience with React.js, Angular 2 is required
3+ years of experience actively writing unit tests for JS 
2+ years of experience leading web or front end application teams
2+ years of experience with C#
Ability to work as a full-stack developer with a keen eye for UI
Experience working in an Agile environment
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Proficient with C#, ASP.NET, MVC, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and SQL
BS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering degree

Desired Skills & Experience

2+ years experience with React
2+ years experience with Redux
Exposure to mobile app development
ES2015
Node.js / Express
Leadership and ability to mentor junior developers

What We Value

We do the right thing…for our customers, our company, and each other.
We see around corners and into the future. We anticipate needs, thinking two steps or even twenty-two steps ahead.
We value diversity. We are inclusive, valuing a variety of perspectives.
We work together to get it done. We are a team - we accomplish more by working together than as individuals.
We take our work seriously, not ourselves. We have fun, celebrate our victories, and enjoy each other's company.

EMS Software is an equal opportunity employer. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at EMS Software will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. EMS Software does not discriminate against any person because of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, age or any other characteristic protected by law.

Frontend Software Engineer

 
Software Technology Group is looking for a highly motivated and skilled Frontend Software Engineer to join our team. The Frontend Engineer will need to have heavy experience and proficiency in JavaScript, React, Nodejs, and AngularJS. If you’re passionate about utilizing new exciting technologies and you want to be apart of a team who is driven and dedicated to delivering clean quality code on time, to ensure customer satisfaction, we would love to see your application today.
 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Bring new features to life by collaborating with internal teams, including UX and backend teams, to ensure product requirements are met

Research and prototype to provide insight about potentially beneficial technologies and specific industry solutions.


 

Skills - Experience and Requirements

5+ years of experience with HTML5, CSS, and Javascript

3 + years of AngularJS, React, and Nodejs experience

Solid understanding of custom directives, services, and MVC design patterns.

Experience with contributing to a project using Git.

Ability to understand and then convey front-end development patterns and best practices.

Strong communication and problem-solving skills.

Self-starter with the ability to pick up new technologies quickly

A strong grasp of computer science fundamentals, design patterns, and software engineering principles

A positive and proactive attitude toward finding solutions, meeting commitments, and assisting others

Frontend.jobskills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Angular JS, React JS PHP UI UX Front End Web Developer
Frontend.jobDescription:
We are seeking a talented Front End Web Developer who is passionate about building beautiful websites and applications, while delivering high-quality user experiences for our customers and internal users. You will implement and maintain customer-facing, front-end web pages supporting our online eCommerce, Sales, Marketing and Customer Support initiatives. Projects will include extensions and improvements to our existing web sites, development of marketing micro-sites and internal web-based tools. You should be comfortable with creating and implementing modern, responsive, optimized, and SEO friendly visual designs. We are looking for a hands-on, senior level developer that can join our technology team, working along creative designers and server-side developers. This person should be able to hit the ground running, is self-motivated, and can deliver business value in an environment that fosters creativity and imagination.

ACCOUNTABILITIES & PERFORMANCE MEASURES:
Works on our company websites and related projects as needed with an eye for design along with practical web development abilities
Develops, implements and maintains appealing front-end web pages based on market-leading User Experience competencies and design standards while producing clean, documented, semantic code
Collaborates with IT staff, marketing teammates, senior management, external vendors and other project stakeholders for requirements gathering
Coordinates assigned tasks and responsibilities, hitting all deadlines while maintaining the highest standards of quality web development

COMPETENCIES:
BA/BS degree in IT, computer science or equivalent work experience
Minimum 6+ years hands on front-end programming experience using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Angular JS, React JS, or similar frameworks
Minimum 2+ years working in PHP based frameworks such as Magento 1 and 2
Prior experience working with ecommerce/transactional based web sites required
Domain expertise in UI/UX best practices
Ability optimize code (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) for maximum performance
An impeccable eye for detail with the ability to match your UI to any design in a cross-browser environment
Capable of debugging CSS & JavaScript using industry standard tools
Translate UI/UX designs and style guides into functional user interfaces, ensuring cross browser compatibility and performance for both desktop and mobile platforms
Must be able to identify and resolve cross-browser compatibility issues
Work with cross-functional teams and participate in design discussions, decision-making and code reviews
Experience using GIT version control system
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Deep understanding of responsive design principles, application security and related trade-offs
Experience with LAMP, Linux and using SSH access
Comfortable working in Linux-based remote environments such as Amazon Web Services
Proactively scope and present new ideas to improve our website experience
Experience working with MySQL databases and caching systems a plus
International site development including multi-language, multi-currency functionality a significant plus
Prior experience in the retail or jewelry markets a significant plus

QUALIFICATIONS:
Solutions-oriented thinking; always looking for the smart/best solution to a problem rather than jumping at the first answer
A desire to be personally responsible for production-level code and a track record of delivering quality bug-free code on schedule
Personal interest in staying up-to-date on latest trends and best practices
Excellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skills
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Highly self-motivated and directed and keen attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute competing projects and tasks

Frontend.jobskills: front end development, HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, Javascript, etc.
Frontend.jobDescription:
iQuasar (pronounced i- kwey- zahr) is a Northern Virginia headquartered technology company dedicated to provide world-class products, services, and solutions to our customers in US and globally to our expanding customer base in North America, Africa, and Asia. We specialize in Telecommunications and Information Technology Consulting, Staffing, Software Development, Managed Consulting, and Software Products and Applications.

 

One of our clients in Rockville, MD 
needs a Senior Front-end Developer 
for a full-time project.

 


Position:
 Senior front-end Developer

Location:
 Rockville, MD

 


Job Description


 

Responsibilities

Design and build efficient, well tested, and reusable User Interface custom components using JavaScript, Angular or Vue, HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, Foundation, and other ES driven web frameworks
Analyze and interpret complex requirements from scientists and doctors
Ensure consistency with an established software development architecture
Introduce new technologies and best practices as needed to solve business problems
Be a part of development team to create practical solutions in Agile/DevOps environment

Position: TWO FrontEnd Developers (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript frameworks, jQuery, AngularJS, ReactJS, AJAX, Web, SharePoint, Mobile Development)
Duration: Full-Time Permanent position (no contract, no corp to corp, no remote)
Location: Dublin, OH
Salary: Excellent compensation with benefits
Skills: FrontEnd Development, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript frameworks, jQuery, AngularJS, ReactJS, AJAX, PowerShell, Mobile Development, SharePoint Development, custom features, styling, branding, web parts, workflow, infoPath, Jasmine, Karma, Node, npm, redux, Jest, Cordova, Jenkins, Istanbul, UI, UX

JOB DESCRIPTION:


We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Someone who embraces Agile principles and practices. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designers, Product Owner (PO) and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.

ROLE DESCRIPTION:
 

To achieve our bold goals, we’re looking for passionate, talented professionals that are: 
Inspired by our mission: To improve the health of those we serve
Committed to our cardinal value: We honor the dignity and worth of each person
Motivated by our core values: Integrity, Compassion, Excellence, and Stewardship
Our Digital team is a blend of experts from Technology, Marketing, and Design who work together as one team to deliver exceptional user experiences. We’re in the middle of building a best-of-Digital discipline in-house 

Responsibilities:
 
Develop new user-facing features
Build reusable code and libraries for future use
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
Participate in daily stand-ups, sprint grooming, retrospectives, demos and lunch-n-learns 


Skills And Qualifications:
 
Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3.
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, like jQuery, AngularJS, ReactJS
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
Use Test Driven Development (TDD) to build the right functionality
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, TFS, Subversion
Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that applications adhere to them
CSS systems such as LESS and SASS to compile style files
Analytics solutions, such as Google Analytics
Standards-compliant code
Integrating HTML/CSS into ASP.NET environment using Visual Studio
Additional tools in your arsenal: Jasmine, Karma, Node, npm, redux, Jest, Cordova, Jenkins, Istanbul
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
3+ years’ web development experience required
2+ years’ app development experience preferred 

MUST-HAVES REQUIREMENTS:
 

Application Code Development, Application Code Support
3+ years Web page development, Front end Sharepoint development, Web Part Development, Technical SharePoint development (custom features, styling, branding, web parts, workflow, infoPath)
2+ years Mobile App Development
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, like jQuery, AngularJS, ReactJS 


NICE-TO-HAVES REQUIREMENTS:
 

Jasmine, Karma, Node, npm, redux, Jest, Cordova, Jenkins, Istanbul

Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-End Web Developer


Location: San Diego, CA 


 


One of our clients in San Diego is looking to hire a highly talented Front-End Web Developer. They have asked us to assist them in their search for this important position.  A detailed description of the position is listed below.

 

No 3rd Parties please. Candidates must be able to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.


 

Position Description:


Our client is looking for a Front-End Web Developer with Angular 2+ experience who brings an innovative, creative, and disciplined approach to developing consumer focused products and applications. As a member of our client’s Web team, you will be expected to create artistically rich, valid and standards-compliant code that focuses on delivering the best possible user experience to all of their customers.

 

Primary Responsibilities: 


Build and maintain cutting edge, state-of-the-art web applications and sites that support, attract and retain our client’s customers


Provide web development for a variety of application development projects


Maintain, as a part of the team, all of the company’s current and upcoming web sites.


Regularly interact with all levels of internal customers, including producers, user experience designers, artists, and community relations managers


Keep abreast of web technologies, limitations, and the best techniques to overcome them


Self-manage multiple projects in a fast paced and high production team


Estimate project delivery and meet deadlines


 

 

Required Educations, Skills and Experience:


Bachelors degree


3-4+ years of Professional Front-End Web Development experience.


Candidates must have previous web development experience using Angular 2+


Strong Angular 2, Node.js, Typescript experience is a must


Strong HTML/HTML5 skills with code level experience and a keen understanding of valid markup


Strong JavaScript skills. Must possess the ability to write your own functions, understand how to work with browser events and various data types like arrays and objects, http requests, JSON, forms, closures and modules, including the use debugging tools (Object oriented experience is a plus)


Experience with other JavaScript libraries and frameworks, jQuery, Underscore, AngularJS, and working with external APIs (like YouTube, Facebook or Twitter)


Strong CSS and CSS3 experience with an understanding of cross browser inconsistencies and responsive frameworks (Bootstrap preferred). Experience with CSS processors LESS and SCSS.


Understanding of website development best-practices, the ability to create minimal documentation and follow style guides for various languages like CSS, JavaScript etc.


Understanding of SEO best-practices and how social media is used to promote content


Experience building and maintaining large web sites in a corporate environment.


Experience with various build processes – Maven, NPM, Node.js.


Experience with version control – Perforce, Git, SVN or similar.


Experience with Adobe Photoshop, slicing images, creating sprites and optimizing images for the web to create pixel perfect layouts.


Must be organized, self-starting and precise, producing accurate work with minimal need for oversight and supervision.


Ability to work under stringent deadlines and meet frequent short timeline goals


Organization and ability to adapt to shifting priorities, sufficient to handle multiple projects at various stages.


Must be able to reliably follow instructions delivered, either orally or via a design brief


Must have the ability to analyze problems, propose solutions, and drive issues to resolution


Candidates must possess excellent communication skills.


 

 

Beneficial Qualifications (But Not Required):


Experience with content management systems


Experience with Java template engines like Velocity or other (or similar technology)


Experience with web analytics (such as Google or Omniture)


Experience building and maintaining single page web applications


Strong understanding of web security and various vulnerabilities.


Experience developing mobile web applications, or developing apps for iOS or Android


 

 

Candidates will be asked to share their portfolio of code samples, prior web sites or Git repos.

 

Candidates must be able to work in the United States without sponsorship.

 

For immediate consideration, please email a MS Word or PDF version of your updated resume to Veronica Barcelo at vbarcelo@theprosourcegroup.com. Veronica can also be reached directly at (619) 319-0909. Thank you for your time and consideration.

 

Veronica Barcelo

Senior Recruiter

Prestigious Financial Firm is seeking a C# Developer with strong frontend development experience. Preferably with heavy automation and financial industry experience. We design, develop, deploy, and support real-time systems that are being utilized by the most demanding professional market participants. We care deeply about system reliability and testability, we care about the user experience and we relentlessly optimize performance, responsiveness and workflow. Our engineers have a strong understanding of computer science fundamentals and software engineering. We are analytical thinkers, we like to solve complex problems and we are always learning our craft. If it’s broken, we fix it. If it needs refactoring, we refactor it. You will work on improving existing and developing new UI components, optimize UI workflow from market data consumption to order creation & management and integrate new asset classes and products first to the market. The problems are challenging but rewarding and we look forward to hearing from you if you feel up to the task.

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Duration: Full time

 
DESCRIPTION:
End client is a leading global marketing technology and services provider, focused on customer data management and cross-channel campaign management for B2C brands across email, mobile, direct mail and web. With the industry's largest client service team and feature-rich technology, Client enables clients to build data-driven, relevant relationships with customers and serves the world's most recognizable brands in 15 countries. 

JOB DESCRIPTION

RADcube is looking for a collaborative and highly motivated Front End Web Developer to be responsible for the creation, layout, editing, updating, and maintenance of campaign landing pages, targeted emails, web forms, global web sites, and other digital assets as necessary. The ideal candidate will have an extensive portfolio of past projects and be able to articulate how these projects have driven positive business outcomes. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, organize, and constantly improve our marketing landing pages and targeted email campaign templates to be deployed to internal teams around the world
Maintain, update, and constantly improve our corporate website as well assist with the consolidation of various regional websites into one global website and content hub
Ensure that our marketing content and thought leadership pieces are designed and coded in a way that is pleasing to end users and drives business performance
Work with the Head of Digital Marketing to create digital journeys and user pathways to automate portions of our sales process for regions around the world

Experience with Wordpress, Drupal, and/or other CMS platforms

Able to resolve unexpected issues and adjust plans accordingly
Professional Portfolio highlighting past projects, ideally in the B2B space

Frontend.jobDescription:
Infrastructure Automation Team who will be responsible for deploying and integrating scripts and recipes to automate Systems configurations and COTS configurations in complex server environments. These environments, a mix of servers, workstations, and custom hardware, provide the backbone for the operational system of a critical, strategic national asset. The environments also support product development, testing, and maintenance. The candidate would be responsible for implementation of automation recipes (Chef) and scripts (Ruby, PowerShell, Python and others) as part of an automated installation process. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, have an engineering mindset, and be able to troubleshoot complex problems. This position may require some on call support and overtime as well as limited (<20%) travel for installation and troubleshooting support. .

Requirements: 

•Candidate must be able to obtain an active  clearance •For G08 = 4+ years of relevant Infrastructure/IT experience related to system installation and configuration •Background in Systems Operations environment supporting complex environment deployment and management activities •Experience with automation tools such as Chef (preferred), Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack, Fabric or similar products for O/S builds, software installation and configuration •Hands-on experience with virtualization tools and cloud computing, either private (VMware, OpenStack) or public (AWS)Systems integration experience •Ability to troubleshoot complex configuration problems or system issues •Experience with Windows or Linux System Administration •Strong scripting skills (i.e. PowerShell, Python, Ruby, bash, etc.) •Ability to communicate clearly and effectively both written and oral 

Desired Skills: 

•Experience with orchestration tools – Rundeck, VMware Orchestrator •Understanding of Infrastructure as Code and demonstrated implementation •Understanding of DevOps concepts •Experience with VMware– vCenter, ESXi, vSphere •Understanding of Change Management processes - Version Control of software and code - GIT, CVS •The ability to effectively plan their own work up and the work of others on the team\ 

Required Education: 

Bachelor Degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Computer Systems Engineering and six years of related work experience or equivalent combination of education and experience (technical Bachelor Degree = additional 8 years of related work experience).
 
TCM is an EEO/Vets/Disabled Employer.

Frontend.jobskills: 5+ years developing with advanced front-end Web Technologies; 3+ years developing with leading JavaScript frameworks; 2+ years developing with Node.js
Frontend.jobemploymentType: Full Time, Contract W2, C2H W2, Contract to Hire
Frontend.jobDescription:
Major entertainment company in Culver City has a contract to hire position open for a Front-End Developer.


The Front-End Developer will develop hybrid Video On-Demand applications for the DPG using the latest in front-end technologies. The qualified candidate must have strong experience with front-end development using HTML5 and popular JavaScript frameworks, including Angular and React. The team values well-architected, high-quality, and stable applications that provide functionality commonly seen in cutting-edge Over The Top streaming services.


In addition, this role requires a service oriented mentality, high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with the SLAs, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated with status of their requests, initiating and performing changes on production systems and proactively escalating any issues in timely manner.

 
RESPONSIBILITIES

• Develop and maintain the HTML5 and JavaScript-based Hybrid VOD applications of the Digital Platform Group

• Take visual mock-ups and deliver optimized implementations using a variety of technologies including CSS, HTML, Ajax, Javascript, React and Redux

• Use expertise of front-end development practices, software design principles, OO concepts, SEO optimizations and UI design and general best practices

• Develop and maintain performance-optimized, cross-platform markup in CSS, HTML, and JavaScript

• Establish and maintain front-end application best practices and standards

• Develop functional prototypes to demonstrate concepts and to enable rapid iterative support for evaluative research


QUALIFICATIONS

• 5+ years developing with advanced front-end Web Technologies including, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and DOM based development

• 3+ years developing with leading JavaScript frameworks (Backbone, Angular, React, Vue etc..)

• 2+ years developing with Node.js

• Has a solid understanding of build tools like Grunt, Webpack, Gulp, Broccoli or Parcel

• Tests their code with tools like Jest, Enzyme, Mocha, Jasmine or QUnit

• Strong understanding of RESTFUL APIs

• Exercises rigor in automated testing, code quality, and engineering best practices

• Balances being product focused and engineering quality minded

• Understands and is thoughtful about tradeoffs

• Leverages and contributes to open source

• Experience with front-end optimization techniques (both in file weight and perceived/actual page rendering speed)

• Adept at creating semantic, clean HTML and using CSS to separate the markup from its presentation

• Advanced understanding of AJAX frameworks, REST and JSON

• Clear understanding of object-oriented application building experience

• Solid experience with cross-browser and cross-device compatibility

• Knowledge of security regarding common web site vulnerabilities

• Full stack development background

• A good eye for design and ability to match a designer’s expectations

• Experience with Twitter Bootstrap and/or responsive design

• Well-developed time management skills with the ability to work very efficiently

• Excellent communication skills and being able to work independently or in a full team

• Experience working with various debugging tools (Firebug, Chrome Web Development Tool, IE JavaScript debugger)

• Experience implementing internationalized web sites and pages that support multiple locales/languages

• Experience with mobile and responsive web development

• Experience with XML and similar markup languages

• Experience with delivering video content or other rich-media in an HTML5 context

Dedicated Tech Services, Inc. (DTS) is an award-winning l IT consulting firm based in Columbus, OH.  We’re growing, and we’re looking for great people to grow with us!  We now have an opening for a very experienced Sr.
 Front-End Web Developer
 in Columbus, Ohio. 


U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.


We are not able to work with corp-to-corp subcontractors.

 


Required Skills and Experience:

Experience in all flavors of HTML and CSS (ten years of experience is ideal)
SASS
JavaScript and common JS libraries (Node, Angular, React)
jQuery/JSON
WCAG compliance CDN’s (shared across applications)
GIT/GITHUB
Experience developing and setting the direction for front-end coding

Desired Skills and Experience:

SPA’s (single page apps)
PWA’s (progressive web apps)
UX “Design”
C# / .Net
Web Services (REST)
Working with Content Management Systems (SiteCore)

 

Job Description:


We are looking for a very experienced Front-End Web Developer who will develop and manage front-end code and applications serving our client’s public-facing applications and technology channels, including web, mobile, and voice (voice channels include Alexa and Google Assistant). This position is suitable for a senior-level candidate. 

The developer will work closely with UX Designer(s) and backe-end developers (.Net, Node, MuleSoft) in an Agile delivery model to implement front end/user interface code for end-user applications. This is a senior level developer role with option to hire and the potential to influence front-end coding direction for our client.

 


Why work for DTS?
 

Our business model enables us to hire the best people.  We have four practices (Project Delivery, Enterprise Support, Information Security, and Development Services), each of which is led by DTS consultants who help select our employees.  They recommend outstanding people with whom they would want to work after the candidates complete our rigorous interview process.  What’s in it for you? A professional and supportive environment at DTS where high standards, respect, quality, and excellence are the norm.

Why Columbus?


Columbus is a vibrant market and is considered to be one of the top-ranked places to live and work in the nation.  It is the 14th-largest city in the United States, and the largest in Ohio.  Columbus is home to fifteen (15) Fortune 1000 companies and features a uniquely successful blend of financial services, insurance, health care, education, government, and manufacturing that is critically dependent on Information Technology. 

What We Need:


Selected candidates must provide DTS with required documents, including (but not limited to) background check permission requests, an employment application, and profile development documents as a condition of employment.  A valid driver's license and valid, reliable transportation are required.

Our Vision
: 

By building a clear sense of purpose and strong relationships within Dedicated Tech Services, the staff and leadership team can then aspire to be the technology service provider whose quality services set the standard by which others are measured and that our clients ask for by name.

Job Description: E-Commerce Front End Developer
Location: Vernon Hills, IL or Chicago, IL
Position Type: Contract



The E-Commerce Front End Developer makes certain the Client’s site looks and functions appropriately for all who use it. This role has expert understanding of Web programming languages and coding standards to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences while also having a keen eye for detail. The E-Commerce Front End Developer works closely with a talented team of Information Architects, Visual Designers, and Developers from concept through production. This role is instrumental in fulfilling the company’s vision and providing advanced solutions for our E-Commerce site and related digital marketing campaigns.

 

Candidate portfolio required!



Key Areas of Responsibility

* Leads front-end development efforts for project from conception to implementation.

* Write standards-compliant code including testing/debugging in multiple browsers and platforms.

* Works with Visual and UX Designers to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences, microsites, HTML emails, and other digital media.

* Ability to take graphic files and translate them into functional experience on web and mobile platforms.

* Participate in the functional requirements definitions for new or modified applications

Responsibilities

* Work closely with internal development and design teams to ensure flawless integration with back-end technology and a great user experience

* Maintain continuous contact with all internal and external stakeholders through the project and after completion making sure features are delivered with high quality and on time.

* Help with and manage production tasks

* Perform code reviews





Minimum Qualifications

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.

* 5 years of E-Commerce related design and development experience.



Other Required Qualifications

* Expert knowledge of HTML, HTML5 and CSS

* Knowledge of working with JavaScript frameworks to create rich interactive content

* Expert knowledge of user experience best practices and ability to implement solutions based on unique needs of specific users

* Proficiency with Adobe CS.

* Familiar with interaction design and information architecture methods and principles.

* Knowledge of the user-centered design theory and demonstrated participation in an application of study findings to range of past projects.

* Experience developing UI optimization for small screens

* Knowledge of W3C standards and SEO principles

* Strong attention to detail and ability to creatively problem solve.

* Excellent written and verbal communications skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholders including senior leadership.

* Train and mentor junior designers.

* Proven track record of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously and negotiating work flow, while meeting deadlines.





Preferred Qualifications

* Experience with E-Commerce websites

* Solid understanding of Responsive Design

* Good understanding of Web Accessibility

Our client provides the technological infrastructure that keeps communication flowing. Our client is a well-known company creating delicious and nutritious snacks for everyone to enjoy. With their innovative, modern, and dynamic approach, you can effortlessly live your healthiest and happiest life.

 

Position Overview:


In this role, you would be responsible for building out multiple ecommerce websites and creating all front-end deliverables, such as user stories, wireframes, user personas, and site maps. You would also be responsible for partnering directly with clients to achieve their goals and present strategic solutions.

 

Responsibilities:


• Develop all front-end deliverables, including strategic user stories, user journeys and flows, user personas, wireframes, site maps, and content inventories

• Work directly with clients to meet their needs, achieve their objectives, and meet user goals; present strategic concepts for client review

• Collaborate with cross-functional internal and external partners clients to ensure the project focus surrounds  the integrity of the experience 

• Remain current of emerging web technologies and design trends; provide strategic recommendations to enhance deliverables

• Implement user-centered design and usability; resolve any front-end issues that may arise

Key Qualifications:


• Bachelor’s degree

• 2-5 years’ experience

• Drupal experience

Frontend.jobskills: Front-End, UX, UI, Frameworks, Angular, Typescript, LESS, SASS, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision UXPin
Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-end Developer



Responsibilites:

Deliver working software that provides customer exceptional user experience
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Facilitate the client's product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Recommend and enforce policies for the source-code control system (GIT) and the team's use thereof. (e.g. "don't break the build”, or "DBTB” – the policy that no check-in should cause a failure in the DevOps pipeline.)
Ensure that front end code meets accessibility requirements
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Required Skills:

4+ years of front-end frameworks experience (e.g. Angular 2+, Typescript, LESS or SASS, JavaScript, Bootstrap)
Demonstrable UI/UX design skills
Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.
4+ years of data visualization (e.g. looker, D3.js, Chart.js, Google Charts) , pixel perfect reporting & report design
Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud or similar technology.
Web markup, including HTML & CSS
Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.

For more information please contact Karen Schur at 860-979-0919.
