Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-End Developer Summary:


Signature Consultants is seeking a Front-End Web Developer for an opportunity in San Francisco, CA. The Front-End Developer will need to be motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wire frames to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. The candidate will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.

 Responsibilities:


Develop new user-facing features

Build reusable code and libraries for future use

Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability

Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end

Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders


Requirements:


JavaScript

Experience with 3rd party libraries for DOM manipulation (jQuery is preferred)

Experience with AJAX / JSON

Optimization: Understands how to fine-tune and measure performance; detect race conditions; debug paint issues

Experience producing cross-browser functional code

Understands the JavaScript event model

Experience with the promise interface

Experience building modular JavaScript using AMD

CSS

Experience with preprocessors (LESS and/or SASS)

Understands how to write efficient selectors

Understands CSS rule specificity

Understands best practices for organizing rules

Understands cross-browser CSS issues

Understands responsive design approaches

Exposure to web-based mobile UI development

General Web technologies

Security (XSS, CSRF prevention)

Experience with optimizing pages for performance

Writing/understanding semantic markup

Experience with HTML5 new features

Experience with rapid-development workflow technologies (ie: Grunt)

Experience with version control (SVN, Git preferred)

Accessibility

Understands ARIA tags

Familiar with WCAG 2.0

Understands best practices


About Signature Consultants, LLC


Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the eighth consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the "Best Staffing Firms to Work For" and is now the 14th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). Frontend.jobskills: Front-End Developer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Local W2 Candidates only

 

The eCommerce team at  is looking to add another web developer to their team. We have placed 4 people on this team, one who has gone fulltime. Erin Lathers, the Front End Manager, is currently responsible for a team of 15+ developers (both onshore and offshore). The team is extremely tight and value eachothers ideas and opinions. The key to these placements are strong Javascript skills, someone who knows how to use various libraries and is experienced with its frameworks. 

The Front End team is supporting the 6  brands. They are responsible for the new features, functionality and capabilities on the eCommerce sites. They have their own unique customized java eCommerce platform. Ideally candidates will have JIRA (or bugzilla) and an understanding of Ajax, SAS, JSON, and Freemarker.


There are some very exciting projects in progress and in queue. These include Personalization initiatives, mobile platfrom initiatives, and new Registy capabilities. They are also ramping up their Product Information pages and enhancing their Check Out process. 

This candidate will:

-Serves as presentation layer developer on eCommerce development team projects (HTML/CSS/Freemarker), most specifically Registry.
-Ensures presentation layer deliverables are in alignment with standards and best practices 
-Works closely with development tech leads to support projects during all phases of delivery: contributes to or develops project estimates, creates or reviews solution designs, creates quality documentation, and performs code reviews.

Qualifications: 
-At least 8 years of experience in development, implementation, and maintenance of large systems, preferably across multiple hardware and software platforms 
-Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline with an IT or similar focus 
-Demonstrated competency developing efficient, effective solutions to diverse, complex problems 
-Demonstrated experience in designing systems and/or processes, including written specifications and documentation 
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization; able to communicate ideas precisely and accurately 
-Able to communicate and collaborate with others to reach consensus or compromise when necessary.

Technical Experience: 

-Demonstrated expertise in presentation-layer web development, including XHTML and CSS, and related standards and tools 
-Expertise in template development (JSP), Freemarker plus 
-Familiarity with Internet technologies (TCP/IP, HTTP, SMTP) 
-Have an understanding of Web Information Architecture, such as REST architectural principles. 
-Emerging web standards, such as HTML5 
-Service oriented designs and technologies (AJAX, XML/JSON) 
-Detailed working knowledge of browser heterogeneity and strategies for achieving consistency across platforms 
-Detailed working knowledge of the browser-based Javascript execution model, and strategies for optimizing real and perceived performance 
-Detailed working knowledge of browser security considerations a plus
-Client-side performance/behavior benchmarking, modeling, measurement, testing 
- Understanding of Unix/Unix-like operating systems and scripting (Linux, AIX, BSD, OSX, sh, perl, awk, sed, ssh, etc) 
-Digital imaging and image processing (file formats, batch processing, color) a plus
-Experience with Adobe tools (Flash/Flex) a plus



 


 


 

About TEKsystems:

Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants' skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

$(document).ready(function() {

$("div").each(function(index, element) {
if ($(element).attr("divType") == "pagelet") {
var divId = $(element).attr("id");
var cssClass = $(element).attr("cssClass");
var url = $(element).attr("url");
loadPageletDiv(divId, url, cssClass);
}
});
checkNotification();

});

function loadPageletDiv(divId, url, cssClass) {
$.ajax({
cache: false,
url: url + "&" + Math.floor((Math.random()*100)+1),
success: function(data) {
$("#" + divId).html(data).addClass(cssClass);
},
});
}

blur : 5,

}
});
}

// ]]> **NO THIRD PARTY VENDORS PLEASE** The eCommerce team at a well known Retail Empire is looking to build out a scrum team in their Brooklyn office. The team is extremely tight and values each others ideas and opinions. The key to these placements are strong JavaScript skills: someone who knows how to use various libraries and is experienced with its frameworks. The scrum team will be supporting the brand. This team will be responsible for the new features, functionality and capabilities on the eCommerce sites. They have their own unique customized java eCommerce platform. Ideally candidates will have JIRA (or bugzilla) and an understanding of Ajax, SAS, JSON, and Freemarker. There are some very exciting projects in progress and in queue. These include Personalization initiatives, mobile platform initiatives, and new Registry capabilities. They are also ramping up their Product Information pages and enhancing their Check Out process. This candidate will: -Serves as presentation layer developer on eCommerce development team projects (HTML/CSS/Freemarker), most specifically Registry. -Ensures presentation layer deliverables are in alignment with standards and best practices -Works closely with development tech leads to support projects during all phases of delivery: contributes to or develops project estimates, creates or reviews solution designs, creates quality documentation, and performs code reviews. Qualifications: -At least 5-8 years of experience in development, implementation, and maintenance of large systems, preferably across multiple hardware and software platforms -Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline with an IT or similar focus preferred -Demonstrated competency developing efficient, effective solutions to diverse, complex problems -Demonstrated experience in designing systems and/or processes, including written specifications and documentation -Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization; able to communicate ideas precisely and accurately -Able to communicate and collaborate with others to reach consensus or compromise when necessary. Technical Experience: -Demonstrated expertise in presentation-layer web development, including XHTML and CSS, and related standards and tools -Expertise in template development (JSP), Freemarker plus -Familiarity with Internet technologies (TCP/IP, HTTP, SMTP) -Have an understanding of Web Information Architecture, such as REST architectural principles. -Emerging web standards, such as HTML5 -Service oriented designs and technologies (AJAX, XML/JSON) -Detailed working knowledge of browser heterogeneity and strategies for achieving consistency across platforms -Detailed working knowledge of the browser-based Javascript execution model, and strategies for optimizing real and perceived performance -Detailed working knowledge of browser security considerations a plus -Client-side performance/behavior benchmarking, modeling, measurement, testing - Understanding of Unix/Unix-like operating systems and scripting (Linux, AIX, BSD, OSX, sh, perl, awk, sed, ssh, etc) -Digital imaging and image processing (file formats, batch processing, color) a plus -Experience with Adobe tools (Flash/Flex) a plus About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants' skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

Frontend.jobDescription:
FRONT END DEVELOPER  

DALLAS, TX  

Full-Time  
Third Party Applications Not Accepted  
The Position:  We are hiring to build out a new team of kind, smart, passionate, and empathetic Front End Developers in the Dallas area. A successful Front End Developer is a critical thinker and team player, focused on creating smart, elegant, high quality, flexible solutions for specific client needs.  

We are looking for passionate developers eager to help craft the identity of the Front End practice within a dynamic and fast paced environment.  
What You’ll Do:  
 Develop the Front-End for interactive, business applications using modern JavaScript solutions  
 Contribute to the development of Front-End code (HTML, CSS, JS) based on wireframes, visual design comps, and screen specifications  
 Collaborate with the UX team to produce and lead technical investigation projects and interactive prototypes for user testing and demonstrations  
 Integrate front-end code with a variety of server side frameworks  
 Develop solutions based on Front-End technical strategy and UI framework selection  
 Create solutions based on best practices for Front-End web development  
 May assist in production issue resolution and on call duties  

Skills/Experience You’ll Need: 
 5+ years of software development experience and up-to-date front-end skills on current trends, techniques, and methodologies as it pertains to Front End Development  
 Successful track record of working with popular JavaScript frameworks  
 Proven mastery of front-end technologies, including HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript and jQuery  
 Up to date knowledge of modern web standards, front-end performance patterns, SEO, scalability and accessibility  
 Strong experience with responsive design and mobile device support  
 Experience with API / data-driven web application development  
 Frameworks such as Backbone, React and Angular a plus  
 Fluency with XML, JSON  
 Experience with version control (prefer TFS or git)  
 Excellent written, verbal and visual communication skills

Frontend.jobDescription:
R0001731 Front End Developer






Working at Overstock.com: 

At Overstock.com, we strive to provide our customers with the highest quality products at the best possible prices. To be able to do this, we look to attract the most talented and innovative people to join our team of talented professionals. If you are the type of person that likes to find new and exciting ways to work efficiently, enjoys working with others in a friendly atmosphere, and is willing to go the extra mile to achieve goals, this is the place for you. Overstock.com was recently named one of America’s Most Trustworthy Companies by Forbes. As far as added benefits go, we’ve got you covered. Our competitive benefits packages and associate perks include, but are not limited to: quality health insurance plans, an employer matched 401(k) plan, a health & wellness program, gym discounts, great work/life balance, company thrown events such as private concerts and free amusement park days, and the opportunity to work with some of Utah’s brightest.


Your Role: 

In addition to the skills and responsibilities, a JavaScript Developer maximizes availability, accessibility, and utility of content and services for all users worldwide. They are able to create rich, stable JavaScript CSS, and HTML frameworks for other front end developers to use. Front End Engineers Can evaluate 3rd party plug-in and code to determine it's viability for an intended project and is able to customize, reverse engineer, or develop from scratch if needed. They know how to effectively utilize the browser cache and cookies. They also provide internal documentation for their utilities, applications, and frameworks. A Front End engineer is well equipped to provide progressive enhancements to web applications rather than provide for apps and utilities to degrade gracefully. They are very skilled at writing unobtrusive JavaScript, have little or no JavaScript in the HTML and do not pollute the global namespace. Front End Engineers are experts at optimizing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for high performance.


Responsibilities: 

Responsible for maintaining and front-end coding of the following areas: 
·          Work with different development and QA teams to code HTML/CSS mockups, test, and verify projects through development process 
·          Oversee site optimization for SEO, cleaner and concise code, and code weight 
·          Act as Liaison between creative department and NOC and IT. May have to work off-hours when issues come up 
·          Update internal documentation when new tools are available for designers to use and distribute the information to web designers and their managers 
·          Create reusable HTML and CSS modules 


Requirements: 

·          B.S./B.A. Computer Science or related field 
·          3-5 years of professional website coding experience 
·          Expert with HTML/CSS, web standards, best practices and writing clean, semantic code 
·          Proficient with javascript, good knowledge of jQuery and creating/debugging jQuery plugins 
·          Understanding of OO principles, especially with regard to HTML/CSS/JS and creating reusable UI components 
·          Expert knowledge of browser quirks and creating web apps that are consistent across all major browsers 
·          Expert troubleshooting and fixing JavaScript/HTML/CSS cross-browser bugs and using debug tools such as firebug 
·          Experience optimizing front end code for performance/speed 
·          Experience optimizing front end code for SEO 
·          Experience developing with an IDE such as Eclipse, using SVN and working on web projects in a team environment - meeting deadlines 
·          Ability to code detailed, functional pages from mockups in collaboration with web designers 
·          Ability to work with java developers to integrate front end code with server side technology 
·          Working knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 and current trends 


Preferred Qualifications: 

·          Experience with HTML/CSS/JS development for mobile platforms 
·          Experience with Backbone js, Handlebar 
·          Experience working with web services 
·          Experience integrating third party/vendor code 
·          Understanding of JS design patterns and front end architecture 
·          Experience with tools such as Yslow, Google Page Speed, GomezPerformance Portal, Charles or httpwatch 






Back to Overstock Careers

Frontend.jobDescription:
As a Senior Front End Developer, you will design and develop front end web applications using AngularJS, JavaScript or any front end frameworks based on software requirements. The Senior Front End Developer is essential to maintaining adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, usability design standards, etc. The Senior Front End Developer position is responsible for creating and consuming REST, JSON-based API's. 


As part of Workforce Solutions Customer Experience Technology team, the Senior Front End Developer will experiment with new technologies and innovative ways to solve problems. In order to be successful, the Senior Front End Developer will need to have strong collaboration and communication skills and must be comfortable operating in an agile, dynamic environment 


Additional responsibilities of the Senior Front End Developer include: 


Working with product owners, designers and other business partners to define work 
Collaborating with backend engineers on data structures and API design 
Facilitating code reviews, code quality checks, testing, automation, etc. 
Acting as a mentor and coach for Junior Engineers                               



Required Skills: 

  

5+ years of experience building highly scalable, high performance, dynamic enterprise web applications 
5+ years of experience and solid fundamental's in front end web technologies including and not limited to HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery 
2+ years of experience in AngularJS or other client-side JavaScript frameworks 
Experience with JavaScript build tools and dependency management (npm, bower, grunt, gulp) 
Experience creating responsive designs (Bootstrap, Media Queries, etc.) 
Experience with unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit) 
Experience with Java and Spring ecosystem 
Knowledge of .NET and Java build tools and dependency management (gradle, maven) 
 Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment  
 Strong customer focus and obsession with quality  



Additional Preferred Skills: 

Experience with Node.js, React, Backbone or other client-side MVC technologies 
Experience with CSS preprocessors (less, sass) 
Knowledge of Domain Driven Design concepts and micro services 
REST API design and implementation 
Knowledge of NoSQL data stores (MongoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, CouchDB) 

Education: 

  

Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science or related field.     

Primary Location: 

USA-St. Louis-Lackland 

Function: 

Function - IT Development and Client Services 

Schedule: 

Full time

Frontend.jobskills: CSS, Developer, Development, JavaScript, UX
Frontend.jobDescription:
Robert Half Technology is vetting candidates for a Front- End/ UX engineer to join a clients core engineering team. Our client is seeking a UX engineer to craft their front-end experience that helps people discover homes and neighborhoods they can call their own. This role works closely with UX designers, visual designers, and engineers to deliver a front-end experience that our users love. 

As part of the client's design team, you will be expected to tackle tough problems with elegant solutions. You will craft groundbreaking, yet accessible products and experiences. This position requires a proven track record of front-end development for interactive-multi-platform web applications. We're passionate about people, neighborhoods, and cities. Come help us design the future. 

Job Requirements 


Responsibilities: 

* Manage and evolve the clients front-end UI system 

* Craft a mobile-first, responsive, pixel perfect, and beautifully animated front-end experience 

* Partner with engineering teams to ensure a consistent implementation of the client's design language 

* Prototype solutions for mobile and web apps in partnership with design 

* Collaborate with the visual design team to maintain design consistency and coherence across the features on their web page 

* Document system and advocate to partners 

* Evangelize best UI front-end practices to designers, engineers, and product managers 


Who you are: 

* At least 5 years developing front-end solutions for digital consumer experiences 

* Has successfully implemented design systems for interactive, multi-platform web applications (i.e., not just marketing sites) 

* Experience working on cross-functional teams on large development efforts 

* Experience with modern front-end tools (e.g React, Webpack, Babel, Yarn, etc.) and CSS and other styling tools 

* Strong knowledge of JavaScript fundamentals 

* Understands and can explain the challenges associated with client-side performance and multi-device development (screen size and resolution, different pointer devices, network issues, etc.) 

* A positive attitude, open mind, and a desire to collaborate and learn 

* Enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment 

* Self-motivated and positive person that collaborates well with others 

* Passion for marketplaces, communities and cities is a plus 

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Design, CS or similar field 


Interested? Please submit a portfolio and resume as part of your application to joy.galia.meyouhas@rht.com

Frontend.jobskills: API, Architecture, CSS, Development, Director, GIT, JavaScript, jQuery, Management, Project, Scripts, Version Control
Frontend.jobDescription:
Director of Front End Development 
Charlotte, NC  



Directors of Front End Development 
 drive business and vertical initiatives and architecture for websites and website applications. They are responsible for leading a team(s) of technologists while remaining technically proficient. They will still be responsible for some execution themselves and must be able to provide technical feedback to their team members. They maintain a tight loop between development, feedback, and deployment. They will craft a solution to a business problem, design the architecture and drive the implementation of the solution, through both their personal efforts and delegating to their teams.  

 Principal Duties & Responsibilities 
: 

Interface with RV biz team/ business owner (GM, CE team, etc.) and external biz team/partner - technical advisor and partner 
Collaborate and assist as part of engineering leadership in architecting solutions for the business and/or product - can be internal or external (i.e., integrating with existing partner solutions) 
Make the high-level, critical technical decisions regarding the front-end UI of any site/application/project supported 
Accountable 


Deliverables of the team and owns the results 
Team development, including evolving team’s technical depth 
Team organization (task delineation and management, team structure) 

Develop the scope and timelines for all front-end code tasks/projects, and manages people and workload 
Provides management and mentorship and the transfer of knowledge to fellow team members 
Provide expert technical direction, communication, and feedback to the business team 
Strong technical skillset – ability, willingness, and passion to roll up their sleeves and produce high-quality code 
Strong business acumen/tech translator 
Design strategic solutions 
Impact tech organization outside core team - advocating for the team 
Identify and help to solve RV Tech wide issues and opportunities 
Tech assessment and placement - human capital and recruitment 
Assist engineering in 3rd party vendors and solutions 

 Critical Skills 
Expert knowledge and  practical implementation 
 of: 
Semantic markup using HTML5 
CSS through the use of pre-processors such as SASS, LESS, etc. 
JavaScript through either vanilla (a plus) or at least jQuery 
Can develop fully responsive websites (using CSS media queries… JS-based solutions not accepted as meeting this criterion) 
Create clean, well-organized and structured code in all of the above 
Advanced debugging and troubleshooting skills 
Experience with build tools (Grunt, Gulp, NPM, Bower, Webpack) 
Experience with version control tools (Git) 
Expert ability to scope and timeline a technical front-end project with the understanding and ability to gather the necessary inputs on their own 
Expert ability to make the right technical decisions to build a solution meeting the requirements (expertise in technical options/approaches combined with project requirements and constraints) 
Have the capability to architect a performant, scalable, and reliable technical solution to meet business needs and technical constraints 
Understanding of further reaching technical concepts (API’s, modular concepts, modular CSS, JS etc. 
Influential communicator with technical and non-technical individuals 
Share their knowledge and grow fellow developers through documentation, code reviews, mentorship, and training 
Can work autonomously and with self-initiation 

Experience 

10+ years of professional relevant experience in the role building websites, the front-end interfaces of web applications, or the like 
Previous experience building sites from scratch, writing plug-ins from scratch or developing app UI layer from scratch 
Advanced-to-expert knowledge of Web standards, semantics, and advanced concepts such as asynchronous development, repeatable patterns, modular concepts 
Have the aptitude to learn new tools, technologies, languages, and platforms 

Impressive skills:  

Reactjs/Vue.js expertise (these two are preferred, but Angular would get some points) 
Ability to architect and develop their own API’s 
Ability to architect and develop build scripts (Gulp and Webpack preferred) 
Ability to develop Progressive Web Apps (PWAs), Electron apps, React Native apps, or mobile native apps 
Ability to somewhat cross the threshold into the backend (those that go more full-stack) 
Practical Implementation of Web Accessibility Standards (compliance with WCAG 2.0 Level AA preferred) 
Knowledge of Digital Marketing acumen concepts and principles (SEO, SEM, PPC, etc) 
Building their own side projects showing more advanced skills 
Contributing to an open source project 
Volunteering time educating/mentoring fellow developers 



    Apply Now

Provide expert technical direction, communication, and feedback to the business team 
Strong business acumen/tech translator  
Design strategic solutions 

Required technical experience: 

5-7+ years of professional relevant experience in the role building websites, the front-end interfaces of web applications, or the like.  
Foundation: HTML5, CSS (SASS preferred), JavaScript (vanilla or jQuery at a minimum) 
Git version control 
Build systems – Gulp (preferred), Grunt, Webpack (second preference), NPM, Bower 
Adobe Illustrator/Photoshop and Sketch (where the designs come from) 

Expert knowledge and practical implementation of: 

Semantic markup using HTML5 
CSS through the use of pre-processors such as LESS, SASS, etc. 
JavaScript through either vanilla (a plus) or at least jQuery 
Can develop fully responsive websites (using CSS media queries… JS-based solutions not accepted as meeting these criteria) 
Create clean, well organized and structured code in all of the above 
Advanced debugging and troubleshooting skills 
Experience with build tools (Grunt, Gulp, NPM, Bower, Webpack) 
Experience with version control tools (Git) 
Expert ability to scope and timeline a technical front-end project with the understanding and ability to gather the necessary inputs on their own 
Expert ability to make the right technical decisions to build a solution meeting the requirements (expertise in technical options/approaches combined with project requirements and constraints) 
Have the capability to architect a performant, scalable, and reliable technical solution to meet business needs and technical constraints 
Understanding of further reaching technical concepts (API’s, modular concepts, modular CSS, JS etc. 
Influential communicator with technical and non-technical individuals 
Share their knowledge and grow fellow developers through documentation, code reviews, mentorship, and training 
Can work autonomously and self-initiated 

Things that will impress us:  
 
Advanced-to-expert knowledge of Web standards, semantics, and advanced concepts such as asynchronous development, repeatable patterns, modular concepts 
React.js/Vue.js expertise (these two are preferred, but Angular would get some points) 
Ability to architect and develop their own API’s 
Ability to architect and develop build scripts (Gulp and Webpack preferred) 
Ability to develop Progressive Web Apps (PWAs), Electron apps, React Native apps, or mobile native apps 
Ability to somewhat cross the threshold into the backend (those that go more full-stack) 
Practical Implementation of Web Accessibility Standards (compliance with WCAG 2.0 Level AA preferred) 
Knowledge of Digital Marketing acumen concepts and principles (SEO, SEM, PPC, etc) 
Building their own side projects showing more advanced skills 
Contributing to an open source project 
Volunteering time educating/mentoring fellow developers 
Why Red Ventures? 


Red Ventures is a leading digital consumer choice platform. Through deeply integrated brand partnerships and consumer-facing assets, Red Ventures connects online customers with products and services in the home services, financial services, and healthcare industries. We use advanced analytics, data science, and integrated technology to cultivate and customize digital connections between brands and customers. We marry the speed of a start-up, the DNA of a digital agency, the strategic thinking of a consultancy, and the analytical skills of a big data company. Red Ventures is headquartered in Charlotte, NC and has more than 3,500 employees in offices across the US as well as in Brazil and London.  


Where good becomes great. We believe in work/life balance and offer a ton of competitive perks, including:
Competitive pay 
Opportunities for leadership and career progression 
Open PTO policy 
Brand new Learning & Development Center 
401k matching 
Family-friendly health, dental, and vision insurance 
Outdoor amphitheater and jogging/bike trail 
Onsite health center 
Health and wellness programs and classes 
Onsite gyms, basketball court, yoga studio, and bowling alley 
Other perks (just ask!)  

Next Steps 



If Red Ventures sounds like the place for you, please submit an application. Also, feel free to share if you have a presence online with a blog, Twitter, GitHub, Dribbble or another platform.    Apply Now

Frontend.jobskills: React.js, Redux
Frontend.jobDescription:
As a Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for all front-end architecture/implementation, and be a key player across all areas of the engineering lifecycle, including eliciting requirements from customers, defining the feature with UI designers and product managers, building the experience by writing the code, shipping it with quality and ontime, and sustaining it through its maturity. The candidate should have strong communication skills, both written and verbal. We also expect the candidate to display a bias for action in implementing new disruptive ideas, show a desire to make our team better, and to learn and adapt quickly.
Roles & Responsibilities
- Build modern front-end solution with best practices

- Build reusable front-end code and libraries for future use

- Ensure the technical feasibility of proposed UI/UX designs

- Participate in stress tests, load tests, performance tests, making recommendations to improve performance and scalability

- Prepare software packages and documentation for deployment that adhere to the defined standard deployment policies

- Be highly responsive to critical production issues providing timely and effective solutions

- Collaborate and help team members in the development life cycle
Minimum Qualifications
- At least 4 years of hands on experience in front end web development

- Deep experience with front-end architecture, packing, best practices, dev process

- Deep experience with JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks, e.g. jQuery, React, Node.js, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, etc.

- Up to date knowledge of current Web UI best practices and usability concepts

- Expert level (or at least) strong working knowledge of current HTML/CSS

- Extensive understanding of asynchronous AJAX processes, communication with back-end via WebAPI/json

- Extensive understanding of web security- Extensive understanding of front-end routing

- Deep experience with DOM

- Knowledge of design patterns (MVC, Strategy, Factory, Singleton) and general design considerations

- Excellent communication (verbal/written) including the ability to distill technical details into human terms
Preferred Qualifications
- Previous development experience using SQL server

- Previous development experience using NoSQL databases (e.g. Cassandra, Mongo DB, Couch DB)

- Experience with UI automated testing frameworks (e.g. Selenium, Karma, Protractor)

- Experience with Cloud like: Azure, AWS

Frontend.jobskills: angularjs, React.JS, Node.JS, web development manager,  javascript, CSS, Java
Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-End Web Engineering Director


(FTE role directly with a client in San Francisco)

 

Technology


Our technology team works fast and smart. With San Francisco as our home, we take bringing new tech to market seriously, developing the latest in mobile technologies, scalable architecture, and the coolest in-store client experience. We love what we do and we have fun doing it. The Technology group is comprised of motivated self-starters and true team players that are absolutely integral to the growth of our future success. 

 

Your role: 


As leader of Front-End Engineering team, you will be responsible for the delivery of the foundation and feature development for client-side technology and related systems for our site and other properties.  Reporting to the Vice President, eCommerce Engineering, you will be responsible for building and managing a capable world-class team which can deliver on our vision. You will work closely with other engineering and technology teams, product management, and your business partners to execute an ambitious portfolio of project work as we evolve the online experience.
Drive and execute delivery of multiple key online initiatives, partnering closely with technology and business partners
Own and manage the front-end technology stack and its foundation and implementation for the site and other properties
Lead a team of over 30 full-time and contractor employees, while influencing a much larger cross- functional group
Recruit and hire top talent for the front-end engineering team
Partner with our product management team to develop strong and effective relationships
Work with other engineering and product leaders to evolve our delivery processes and drive cross-team collaboration and cooperation
Provide training and professional development opportunities for full-time employees
Demonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, and Initiative.

 

We’re excited about you if you have: 

10+ years of engineering leadership responsibility; retail or ecommerce experience
 is a plus
Experience developing and delivering using Agile methodologies

Hands-on experience with front-end technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, node.js, React, and AngularJS 2.0, Java

Understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, object-oriented-programming(OOP), frameworks
 and technologies
Demonstrated experience manage effectively through organizational growth and change
Capability to move quickly between strategic and tactical, understanding context, connecting seemingly unconnected ideas and taking action
Experience managing large and growing CapEx and OpEx budgets
Strong communication skills (oral, verbal and listening) as well as the ability to influence key decision makers and understand their points of view
Strong leadership, negotiation and execution skills with the ability to drive results, deliver and excel, and own it when you don’t

 

Keywords
: UI Director, Web Engineering Director, Front End Web Director, UI Manager, Web Engineering Senior Manager, Front End Web Senior Manager, UI Manager, Web Architecture, UI Architect, Front End Architect, Front End Lead, Web Development, UI Development

 

Please send your MS Word Resume to aparna@tivasys.com

Frontend.jobskills: React Redux
Frontend.jobDescription:
About JASK
 JASK was founded in 2016 and is headed by industry leaders with decades of experience solving real-world SOC issues. With a mission to address the security gaps that restrict security modernization efforts, JASK's world-class engineering and data science teams apply proven experience to drive advancements in autonomous SOC technology. Backed by Battery Ventures. Silicon Valley Bank, DELL and TenEleven Ventures, JASK is modernizing SOC operations for companies across the financial services, telecommunications, healthcare and government industries. OVERVIEW
 The mission of a Senior Front End Software Engineer is to design and build capabilities that let users visualize and interact with their data to meet their analytical needs. To achieve that mission, Senior Front End Software Engineers are involved in all stages of the product development and deployment lifecycle: idea generation, user interviews, planning, design, prototyping, execution, shipping, and iteration. You might spend one day interviewing users to suss out the questions they need to ask of their data and the next brainstorming mockups with Product Designers. Then it's time to take on the hard technical problems: figuring out how to make it possible for a user to explore the full range of data, at vast scale, then dive deep to understand each data point at a granular level. Technologies We Use
 Redux and React Router are central to our front-end development.
Blueprint as a re-useable frontend component library.
A combination of open-source and internal technologies that suit the problems at hand.
Industry-standard build tooling, including ESLint, Webpack, and Github.
ES6/ES2015, Babel

Who You Are

You are a strong front-end coder. Regardless of which frameworks you use or how you learned them, we’re looking for people who can write clean, effective code. You should already have proficiency in Javascript and an understanding of how web technologies work.
You are passionate about building user interfaces that enable users to solve their problems.
Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.
Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
Proficiency with programming languages such as Java Script, CSS3, HTML5, or similar languages.
Ability to work effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals.
Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
Demonstrated ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.

 
WHY JASK
 JASK is Modernizing Security Operations
 At JASK, we are dedicated to transforming the way organizations manage security operations with legacy solutions. Through innovation, collaboration and teamwork we will drive innovation in autonomous SOC technology. Our Values: Results. 
 Above all else, we expect results. We honor our commitments. We say what we do and do what we say. We value quantitative measurements over qualitative ones. We deliver results. Perseverance.
   We get up after we fall down or get pushed. We never, ever, ever quit. Collaboration.
  Consensus building and collaborative planning.  All voices should be heard and considered. Only then will decisions be made and acted upon.  Integrity and Respect.
  Ethics and morals.  Respect people of differing ethnicities, cultures, languages, backgrounds, educations, lifestyles, ideas and experiences. We assume positive intent from everyone. Excellence.
  Each person should seek excellence in everything they do, every day.   Consciously challenge each other to exert their best in their role to advance the company mission.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Front End Engineer 
London, UK  



About Red Ventures: 



Red Ventures is a technology-driven digital marketing and sales company that also owns and operates a number of digital brands. We focus on solving complex business problems for our partners, which include some of the world’s largest brands, by combining advanced data analytics with proprietary, built in-house technology to help us generate demand and attract potential customers with incredible efficiency.  We combine the speed and creativity of a start-up, the strategic thinking of a management consultancy, and the technology development and analytics of a software company– all under one roof. Couple that with a culture built on speed, innovation and collaboration and you’ll find that Red Ventures is a place unlike any other.  


Red Ventures is expanding in Europe and building a world class team based in London where we are working with top European brands as well as bringing to Europe some of our US owned and operated assets. This is a unique opportunity to be an early member of a fast growing team, backed by one of the most successful digital companies globally.  


Below are 3 films that give you some further insight to our culture and approach at RV.  

What is R|V technology? 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SC_YngB-kTs     


R|V2017: Year in Review 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FJwxXRQmxd4 
She is – Women at R|V 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qodVumciyyg 
What's the role? 



In a full stack front-end development role, you will architect and implement applications and content management systems for the web using the latest Javascript frameworks and internal RESTful APIs. You will drive the end-to-end experience from the front-end layouts through the underlying user session controllers to the cloud architecture for continuous deployment.
Develop scalable web applications for consumer-facing websites and brand landing pages 
Develop modules to assist in A/B testing of different experiences based on session data 
Develop custom drop-in components for front-end features that are reusable across applications 
Design new API interfaces for use inside and outside the organization 
Work with UX and design team to transform their wireframes into full-fledged end-to-end tech 
Work with best-in-breed frameworks and libraries for styling, layouts, and navigation flows 
Integrate new external APIs into platform 
Own full web development requirements and implementation, release management, QA regression scripts, and deployment to containerized production environments 

What We’re Looking For: 

Experience with Node.js and a UI framework like Vue or React 
Experience with client-side state management tools like Redux, VueX, or flux 
Proficiency in consuming, debugging and exploring REST API's. 
Proficiency with HTML5, AJAX, browser storage, and mobile responsive design 
Proficiency with consuming and producing RESTful APIs 
Proficiency with task runners and asset pipeline tools (e.g. npm, webpack, Gulp) 
Proficiency with security requirements, authentication and authorization layers (OAuth2, Google Sign-in) 
Familiarity with CSS extension technologies (e.g. less, SASS, bootstrap) 
Familiarity with web service delivery stacks (nginx, express, virtual host configuration) 
Familiarity with static content engines (e.g. Hexo) 
Familiarity working in the cloud, especially as it pertains to the front end: (Amazon S3 or Azure Blob, Cloudfront, Cloudflare, Fastly, etc.) 
Familiarity with tag and event tracking libraries (e.g. Segment, Adobe DTM, Google Analytics) 
Understanding of asynchronous i/o or RPC’s in Javascript and/or use of associated tool libraries (i.e., async, bluebird, etc.). 
Understanding of the HTTP fundamentals, especially HTTP 2.0 
Fluent at using Git 
Excellent communication, collaboration and writing skills 
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent education and experience 



    Apply Now

Frontend.jobskills: Agile, AngularJS, CSS, Development, GIT, HTML, JavaScript, Libraries, Management
Frontend.jobDescription:
Company Description 


At Qualtrics, our mission is to close experience gaps—the costly differences between what customers and employees expect, and what they’re receiving. 
8,500+ organizations worldwide and more than 3/4 of the Fortune 100 rely on Qualtrics Experience Management to collect and analyze feedback—more feedback than they ever thought possible. With Qualtrics XM, organizations can continually assess the quality of their four core experiences—customers, employees, products, and brands. They can be at every meaningful touchpoint, for every experience, and predict which changes will resonate most with customers and employees. 
The Challenge 


The Qualtrics Engineering team builds and maintains a scalable system with billions of pageviews a week to bridge the experience gap in digital media. We enable customers to make on-the-fly changes to their company’s websites and mobile apps to engage and listen to a targeted segment of users. We are looking for an experienced front end engineer who can empower our customers to effortlessly design beautiful and delighting user experiences. 
Preliminary Qualifications 

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent 
5+ years professional experience building customer facing web applications 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Experience building fast responsive UI 
Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Angular2 and ReactJS 
Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment and to learn new frameworks/stacks 

Preferred Qualifications 

Be highly creative, flexible and focused 
Experience with continuous delivery, git, test automation and build\deploy systems 
Experience building large-scale web applications 
Experience with MVC and single page application technologies, including AngularJS, Angular2, Polymer, Vue, Ember, React or ReactNative 
Familiarity with web application build pipelines using WebPack, Gulp, Babel, Sass / LESS 
Ability to develop in vanilla JavaScript, but also use existing libraries or frameworks when applicable 

A Day in the Life 

Work with design and product teams to understand needs, propose features, build early prototypes and transform them into exciting end consumer features. 
Develop scalable, fast, robust, and rich web-based solutions to solve complex business problems, using the latest front-end technologies 
Architect efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications 
Improve our front-end infrastructure, build UI components, and discover and tackle issues 
Attend daily stand-up meetings, collaborate with your peers, prioritize features, and work with a sense of urgency to deliver value to your customers 
Contribute to the professional development of colleagues, improving their front-end technical knowledge and the engineering practices on your team.

Job Title: Front End Lead/Manager
Why work here as a Front End Engineer Lead/Manager:

Ground floor opportunity to work with an impressive management team that has a proven track record of building successful start-ups.
Company has already raised $17+M and has additional capital commitments.
Join a company that will be the first online provider in a $45-50B industry.

As a Front End Engineer Lead/Manager, you will:

Build high-level user experiences for both web and mobile web applications
Advocate JavaScript best practices and drive modern client-side application design
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in defining, designing, and developing new application features
Demonstrate strong technical leadership in managing working with and across teams
Unit test application code for edge cases, usability, and overall continuity
Fix bugs and improve performance
Evaluate and implement new approaches/technologies to optimize shipping productivity 

What Gets You the Job?

7+ years’ front end web development experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
Prior experience in architecting complex front end applications (web and mobile)
Ability to function in a lead/manager role – strong communication skills, guidance, and ability to follow through
Deep understanding of agile and iterative development methodologies
Expert-level knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript and JS frameworks (i.e. NodeJS, ReactJS, Redux, GraphQL, etc.)
Strong proficiency in Test Driven Development (Jest/Jasmine/Mocha)
Performance optimization experience (mobile and responsive applications)
Nice to have: Familiarity with Polymer, AngularJS, Sass, ERB

Frontend.jobskills: CSS, Developer, HTML, JavaScript, User Interface
Frontend.jobDescription:
Sr. Front-End JavaScript Developer, Financial Product Firm, NYC, 180K+ 


  

Senior Front-End JavaScript Developers are needed to build out the next-generation intuitive  JavaScript based front-end / user interface for the firm's trading applications. The trading applications are used by thousands of clients worldwide to manage and trade trillions of dollars each day and this team is actively working to integrate them all with this unified system.  This is an opportunity to join a small team on the ground floor of creating next generation trading functionality using the cutting edge and JavaScript technologies you love! 

  
Responsibilities: 

Design, build and deploy large scale JavaScript features to users while keeping mission critical systems running stably   
Design and implement new cutting edge JavaScript based tools and features and incorporate new technologies to improve functionality  
Architect, develop and test applications with scope, high impact and seamless user experience in mind (JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5) 
Work with users, designers, and developers to constantly update, improve and scale the product  
Requirements: 

5+ years’ experience building mission critical front-end and user interfaces using object-oriented JavaScript   
Expert level knowledge of JavaScript and other front-end / web technologies (Typescript, ES6, HTML, CSS, Backbone, Angular, React, etc.) 
Passion for improving and optimizing JavaScript applications and UIs  
Interest in pushing JavaScript past its limits and revolutionizing how JS can be used to scale trading applications  
Open source contributions, active Github, display of technology passion outside of work is a bonus!  
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science  preferred

Frontend.jobskills: Architecture, Browser, CSS, Developer, Development, GIT, HTML, Java, JavaScript, Libraries, QA, SVN, Testing, UX
Frontend.jobDescription:
For immediate consideration please send your resume directly to ryan.jaco@rht.com 

Responsibilities 

* Advise clients on front-end strategy, framework selection, emerging technology. 

* Contribute to the development of our internal tools and reusable architecture. 

* Be a change agent. Help move our design, development, and delivery processes into the next generation. 

* Develop front-end code based on wireframes, visual designs, and UX specifications. 

* Use front-end frameworks such as: React, Angular, Ember, Vue, etc. 

* Integrate with REST APIs or other back-end frameworks. 

* Accurately estimate upcoming work and deliver reliably. 

* Be a mentor to junior developers. 

Job Requirements 


Must Have 

* JavaScript - Demonstrable mastery of JavaScript, and experience with one or more front-end frameworks: React, Angular, Ember, Vue, etc. 

* HTML - Mastery of HTML: semantics, accessibility, and cross-browser compatibility. 

* CSS - Mastery of CSS, including preprocessors (Sass preferred), naming methodologies such as 


BEM, and techniques for scaling CSS on large projects. 

* Automation - Familiarity using Node libraries to ensure code quality: JSLint, JSHint, ESLint. 

* Testing - Experience with JS unit testing approaches, such as: Jest, Jasmine, Mocha, etc. 

* Performance - Experience creating code optimized for production, via JS minification, "tree shaking" dependencies, image compression, etc. 

* Collaboration - Ability to collaborate with team members across various disciplines: UX, design, tech, business, QA, etc. 

* Planning - Experience planning and estimating complex software application projects. 

* Source Control - Familiarity with source control: Git, SVN, etc. 

* Experience - We prefer 5+ years of experience for lead roles. 


Preferred 

* BS/BA degree with CS concentration, or equivalent experience. 

* Back-end development experience in Node or Java is helpful. 

* Experience with front-end build tools: Webpack, Grunt, Gulp, or JSPM. 


Projects 

Employees will be exposed to many clients and technologies as they complete projects. This will give them many opportunities to grow and stretch themselves. We are committed to training and mentoring to help them be successful. 


Travel 

Candidate should be comfortable with occasional travel as client engagement requires.

Frontend.jobskills: Javascript, Sass
Frontend.jobDescription:
Senior Front-End Javascript Engineer


 

About the Position:

 

Our client is searching for a talented and motivated front-end Javascript developer to join our growing, in-house development team. The successful candidate will work with both front-end and back-end web developers in an agile environment to build all client-side logic. You will be a strong voice and directly influence the direction of our ecommerce platform. You will be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both sides, and engineering the application’s functionality.

 

About You:

 

You have significant experience building JavaScript-based user interfaces and applications, while adhering to requirements and meeting deadlines. You enjoy writing solid, scalable, and bug-free code. You take ownership and are proud of your work, with an ability to work independently and efficiently. You understand and possess the dedication needed to succeed within a growing business. You are a strong communicator and collaborator, and thrive working in a fast-paced environment.

 

Responsibilities:

 
Develop new user-facing features.
Utilize Javascript and HTML/CSS to translate mockups into fully functional features.
Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical and business needs.
Collaborate with designers and back-end developers to implement and improve features.
Write solid, standards-compliant code while recognizing performance, scalability, and security.
Perform peer code reviews with a keen eye towards improvements.
Diagnose and resolve bugs in an efficient and effective manner.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends.
Participate in daily SCRUM meetings.

 

Requirements:

 
Ability to plan and develop features effectively using software development best practices.
Excellent analytical and multitasking skills.
Expert understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, its quirks, and workarounds.
Expert understanding of standards-compliant web markup, including HTML and CSS.
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.
Familiarity with ECMAScript 6/7.
Familiarity with front-end build tools, such as Gulp.js.
Familiarity with server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and/or SASS.

 

 

For immediate consideration, please email resume to druiz@jwnj.com

Frontend.jobDescription:
Chameleon Technologies is searching for a Front End Software Engineer for an FTE role in Charlotte, NC. Our client provides revolutionary dynamic, real-time optimization software solutions. The software automatically and optimally schedules our customers’ resources (assets and people) in real-time. With our software, our customers can make informed, integrated, and intelligent decisions in real-time, all the time. We free up to 30% of our customers’ resources and at the same time reduce their operating costs by up to 20%. We do cool work that provides great value to our customers. Come help us drive real-world operational change in aviation, transportation, logistics, healthcare and more.

As a Front-End Software Engineer for our client, you will build engaging and practical experiences for our customers’ users (employees of various types and even their own customers). Your experience demonstrates your love and understanding of users, your focus on simplicity, and your clean, maintainable and repeatable code. You will use modern languages and methodologies to develop features and bring them to life. You will connect with the .NET backbend platform, especially in RESTful web environments.

You will not be working in a small silo figuring out part of a solution to part of a problem.  Some days you may be working to enhance a specific element of a UI for an existing application, other days you will find yourself supporting a customer in the best use of a platform, and others you may be designing and developing a new user interface for a new market.  This is the real deal.

You will be putting optimization to practical, every-day use, enriching the decision making and operations of our current and future customers.

Responsibilities
:
Work on developing frontend and supporting backend integration for new applications
Work on a team to design, implement, test and support software products, features, and tools
Work directly with experts in resource optimization sciences to develop leading cloud-based solutions and services for advanced applications
Develop maintainable, testable, quality code
Own features from idea to live
Tackle and solve complex problems in usability, scalability, and distributed systems

Requirements
:
BS (MS a plus) in Computer Science or related technical discipline
4+ years of software development experience building high performing, scalable front-end applications using modern languages (C#, WPF, JavaScript, knockout.js, jQuery.js, Ruby, HTML/CSS, Angular)
Experience with Azure, IIS, cloud store (NOSQL), JSON, SQL and ASP.NET MVC is a huge plus
Passionate about developing for the end user

PeerSource is currently recruiting for a Senior Front End Engineer
on a Direct Hire
 basis for our client in Newtown, PA, but for the right candidate there is possibility of full-time telecommuting from the greater northeastern-US area.

 

Summary


 

This is a unique opportunity to join a growing team building the next generation of cognitive computing and big data analytics capabilities. These new capabilities will drive a state-of-the-art platform and services which will provide customers and business partners with actionable insights and analytics to improve performance, reduce risks and provide measurable competitive advantages, across domains such as supply chain management, sales strategy, and consumer marketing.

 

Responsibilities

The Sr. Front-end / Web Application Engineer will be joining a team accountable for the execution of products and services involving cognitive computing and advanced analytics.
Independently performs analysis to develop and implement high-level front-end designs for assigned projects.
Collaboration with graphic designers on look and feel, but should be able to provide basic designs if needed
Creation of applicable wire-frames
Development of specific features and functions where needed
Development in a manner that supports reusable code and libraries for use across the company’s projects and platforms
Validation/assessment of technical feasibility of UI/UX approaches and designs
Optimization for performance and scalability
Validation of front-end collected data prior to submission to back-end for processing
Remains current on industry standards in web development
Ability to research, develop and propose new technologies to improve application architecture
Finds and recommends opportunities for continuous improvement
Authors technical documentation
Drives the development of technical standards

Required Skills

7+ years of current hands-on web application architecture, design, and development experience with deep knowledge in the following areas: JavaScript, ECMAScript 6 /7/ 8, and libraries such as jQuery, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Dojo, Backbone, Node.js, or others
Experience with React / Redux / Sagas,Webpack / Babel,Message Queues / RabittMQ, and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB (preferred), Cassandra, or HBase
Experience in HTML5, CSS3, AJAX and responsive web design concepts
Experience working in a highly collaborative team environment with agile best practices such as TDD, continuous integration, and automated testing and deployment
Experience with cross-browser and cross-device compatibility and browser-specific issues
Proficient in working with data encoding formats such as JSON and XML
Working knowledge of SQL
Experience with Automated UI testing
Experience with Apache and Tomcat in a Linux environment
Knowledge of code versioning tools, such Git
Working knowledge of the current cloud computing environments
Minimum of a Bachelors Degree Required (Masters Preferred) in Computer Science or related field.

No third parties.   Sorry, relocation is not available for this position.


H1 sponsorship is not available.


 

PeerSource, a Denver based technology recruiting firm, values strong relationships with talented professionals!  We offer contract, contract-to-hire and direct hire opportunities throughout the US and support W2 as well independent consultants working on a Corp-to-Corp basis.  Sorry, but at this time we do not work with other agencies representing their own Corp-to-Corp candidates.  W2 employee benefits with PeerSource include options for health & dental insurance, a matching retirement plan as well as reimbursements for education and training related expenses!  Contact us for more details.

If you are a Senior Front End Engineer (React, React Native) with experience, please read on!

What You Will Be Doing

As a Senior Frontend Engineer you will help design and build the mobile app and and web site application that will provide the gateway for our cryptocurrency platform using React Native and React. You will assist in designing the user experience, as well as implementing and connecting to our back end services.
In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on design, architecture and direction. You will interface with and work directly with the back end and cloud services teams as well as Product Management to help launch our platform.

•Design and build the front ends, including mobile and web applications, working in conjunction with back end teams to produce a world-class fintech service
•Create intuitive, simple and effective designs via wireframe and mockup tools, working directly with Product Management, and then follow through with implementation.
•Build quality in, delivering significant unit, integration and system tests along with your code
•Write developer documentation, reference implementations, wireframes/mock-ups and other educational content as needed
•As a secondary objective, assist the other teams directly with code review, design and implementation as needed

What You Need for this Position

We're looking for passionate, professional software engineers who enjoy doing things the right way. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Javascript, React Native and React, as well as user experience design, code security, quality and sustainability. Experience with Python and microservices will be useful to provide the depth we are looking for in this position. As a software professional, you understand the importance of coding clean, estimating, taking deadlines seriously, and interfacing well with other team members and teams.

- At least 5 years experience building enterprise grade mobile and web applications
- Deep knowledge of Javascript and both React Native and React

Experience with:

•User experience design
•Unit and system testing
•Software security concepts and best practices
•Front End: Javascript, React and React Native
•OS: Linux

What's In It for You

•The opportunity to join a well funded, cutting edge financial technology company at a very early stage
•Competitive salary and equity
•Competitive medical benefits
•Generous 401K matching plan
•Flexible working policies: work with your manager to determine the best combination of work at office/work from home arrangements
•A software culture that values quality, sustainability and craftsmanship over time to market
•Smart co-workers who are world class experts in the field of crypto-currency
•A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impactSo, if you are a Senior Front End Engineer (React, React Native) with experience, please apply today!

Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
JavaScript, MVC, CSS3, HTML5, Erlang, Ruby On Rails, MySQL, Redis

Our modern San Francisco headquarters make us easily accessible by all public transit.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be working as an individual contributor to help architect our front end architecture to improve the development workflow, create proper separation of concerns and abstractions to optimize development while keeping the site fast.

What You Need for this Position

7+ years of related work experience
- You understand how front end architectures can be optimized to improve developer productivity while properly separating concerns.
- Expertise in JS and CSS – we write in ES6, use babel to transpile down to ES5, and use SCSS as our CSS Preprocessor
- Strong knowledge of modern MVC frameworks, and the libraries and tooling surrounding them. Rails, Elixir and React preferred.
- Experience and deep understanding of modern development standards, HTML5, CSS3 and cross-browser compatibility issues
- A desire to write great, clean, secure code and always striving to implement features in the best way possible. You've thought ahead about what's to come, thought of all the edge cases, and have proved that with tests. RSpec and Jasmine preferred
- An obsession with new technologies and trends – we don't mind testing new tech out where it makes sense for our products!
- A self-starter mentality, who can work independently and collaboratively. We're a small team, and communication is key in allowing us to move quickly.

Our core stack:
- Ruby on Rails, as our web application framework
- React, built on a custom front end framework following the flux architecture
- Erlang/Elixir, which our real time API has been built in Elasticsearch, pulling from RDBMS and NoSQL data stores
- MySQL and Redis, to store our data
- Ruby On Rails
- MySQL
- Redis

What's In It for You

- Great culture (we're a tight team)
- San Francisco headquarters, easily accessible by all public transit
- A fun team environment with frequent outings and retreats
- Annual Tripping Travel Credit! 
- Generous benefits package  (medical, dental, and vision)
- 401k
- Local gym discountSo, if you are a Senior Front-End Architect with experience, please apply today!

Established in the Greater Atlanta Area for over 30 years, we are an expanding and globally recognized FinTech company with a growing presence across many of America's largest Enterprise retail brands and chains. We are expanding and building out a strategic presence in the Greater Atlanta area and are looking for the best and brightest to join our development team.

Our Front End Developer will have a strong knowledge of modern development practices and trends, and will be primarily focused on supporting our several of our Enterprise FinTech SaaS products. If that sounds like you, please read on.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Award-Winning Company working with Highly Recognizable Enterprise Brands!
- Excellent Compensation (Highly Competitive Base + MERIT BONUS)
- Great Location - Just Outside Atlanta - New Campus Development
- Full range of Benefits (Medical, Vision, Dental, FSA, 401K Match)

What You Will Be Doing

This position involves design, development and post-release maintenance of new and existing products. This includes all aspects of the software development lifecycle including: gathering requirements, developing design specifications, solution prototyping, implementation, development of unit and system tests. The Front End position will join the back office team to work on a variety solutions. The majority of software engineering work performed in this role will be based on the LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) stack and a number frameworks. 
Responsibilities
- Develop high quality object-oriented code using PHP and popular frameworks
- Build APIs and web services to be consumed by internal and external customers using RESTful approaches, JSON-RPC and websockets
- Create desktop and mobile applications utilizing HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript using Sencha Ext JS and JQuery
- Develop unit and system tests for code developed by self and others
- Produce technical specifications and code documentation
- Design and develop SQL data structures needed to support new development efforts (including keys, indexes, triggers and stored procedures).
- Perform application performance analysis and tuning
- Conduct and participate in training sessions
- Identify and recommend process improvements
- Accurately estimate level of effort and forecast completion targets

What You Need for this Position

Qualifications:
- BS Degree
- 2+ Years' Developing enterprise class solutions under LAMP stack
- JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, SASS
- API Design and XML Soap, XML-RPC, JSONP, JSON-RPC and Protocol Buffer
- Single page application frameworks, preferably Sencha Ext JS
- Application architectural principles, such as MVC, MVVM and MOVE
- HTTP protocol and its components, such as headers and cookies
- CORS, CSRF and XSS
- Advanced design patterns and components, such as asynchronous execution, promises, multithreading and websockets
- Ability to troubleshoot and debug complex defects with debugger and profiler tools, such as browser specific developer toolbars
- Solid knowledge of unit and application test processes and tools, such as Siesta, Jasmine, Mocha, Chai and Sinon
- Proficiency with modular development concepts and package management tools, such as Bower and Sencha Cmd
- Familiarity with Linux operating system internals, Atlassian tools (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence), JetBrains tools (PhpStorm)
- Working knowledge of Git based version control systems

What's In It for You

- Competitive Salary and BenefitsSo, if you are a Front End Developer with experience, please apply today!

Frontend.jobskills: Agile, Architecture, Development, JavaScript, Libraries, Library, Lifecycle, Python, Ruby, Sales, Shell Script
Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-End Architect 
São Paulo, Brazil  



About us 

  
Red Ventures is the world’s largest technology-enabled platform for growing sales and optimizing the full customer lifecycle. We own the entire direct marketing funnel for our Fortune 500 brand partners - from demand generation to closing the sale. Our expertise spans multiple industries including Home Services, Energy, Financial Services, Insurance and Software. 


The front end team, part of the technology team, is responsible for developing and maintaining complex, robust and high-performance applications with other Red Ventures engineering teams. This position has high visibility and potential to impact the organization by directly participating in the way we build and deliver the solutions to our partners.  


Our culture is based on freedom, you will be free to run, test and learn and you will have the responsibility to self-manage in a collaborative and agile way. You will have the opportunity to challenge yourself and grow. You could think of the best of both worlds: work in a dynamic start-up environment in Brazil and at the same time be supported by a leading global technology company in a disruptive, entrepreneurial, accelerated career environment.  
  
Role 

  
In this role, you will be responsible for planning, building and maintaining architecture solutions for Javascript-based applications in both server-side and client-side universes, design patterns and new tools, automating build processes, establishing strategies for dealing with performance and infrastructure, development of boilerplates, frameworks and libraries to meet recurring demands of the creative and engineering teams. 
  
  
Who are you 

You have deep experience and understand well the architecture behind a Javascript framework or library; like React, Vue, Angular, Ember, or your own developed solution. 
You can automate tasks and solve problems using a scripting language, such as Python, Ruby, NodeJS, Shell Script, etc. 
You can analyze and solve performance problems and know how the critical rendering path works. 
Experience with task automation/bundling tools such as webpack, gulp, grunt for multiple environments. 
You have experience with the main paradigms and design patterns of Javascript. 
You can architect an isolated, generic solution that works in multiple projects. 
Experience with debugging tools and techniques. 
You can read, write and understand English. 
You know how to communicate your ideas in a clear and meaningful way. 
Composition over Inheritance =) 



   

Responsibilities also includes: 

Plan, design and build solutions for some of the biggest brands in the world 
Help build and maintain scalable web applications 
Deliver modern and testable code 
Work along with software developers, designers and business analystis on a daily basis 
Share knowledge, evangelize best practices, and collaborate with some of the best developers in the country 



   

Nice to have (but not required) 

Experience with DEVOPS 



   

What else you should know 

Structured career plan with recurring feedback sessions. 
An informal work environment that values collaboration and respect for people from diverse backgrounds and cultures. 
Education Incentive: biannual stipend for you to use to advance your skill set through education. 
Direct exposure to the Red Ventures global engineering team in Charlotte 
We encourage group physical activity: we organize races between teams and we also have a partnership with Gympass 
Red Adventure - we organize team outings where we participate in off-site get together (we've already gone to Kart, Archery, Escape 60) 
Freedom to help to improve the development culture every day. 
Health insurance above the market rate. 
Annual financial bonus according to performance. 
Apply Now
