Frontend.jobDescription:
Front End Developer 
Charlotte, NC  





Red Ventures is looking for a passionate  Front End Developer 
 with the skills and the drive to build and maintain digital experiences for some of the country’s biggest brands. You’ll work with top talent including writers, analysts, designers and other developers in a fun, fast-paced environment at our headquarters in Fort Mill, SC (relocation assistance provided). Each day, you'll create, code and optimize websites and user experiences in a workplace where you can see the impact of your ideas.   

Principle duties and responsibilities: 

Execute and hit deadlines as well as provide timely feedback if the scope is incorrect 
Intermediate to advanced HTML, CSS, JS, Git version control 
Can actively produce consistent, quality code in line with our Coding Standards 
Adept communicator with technical and non-technical task creators (tech translator) 
Continuously looks for opportunities for improvement/efficiencies in the codebase they support 
Intermediate debugging skills (ex: debug base HTML, CSS, JS issues) 

Required technical experience:  

3-5+ years experience in front-end web development 
Foundation: HTML5, CSS (SASS preferred), JavaScript (vanilla or jQuery at a minimum 
Git version control 
Build systems – Gulp (preferred), Grunt, Webpack (second preference), NPM, Bower 
Adobe Illustrator/Photoshop and Sketch 

Proficient knowledge and practical implementation of: 

Semantic markup using HTML5 
CSS through the use of pre-processors such as LESS, SASS, etc. 
JavaScript through either vanilla (a plus) or at least jQuery 
Can develop fully responsive websites (using CSS media queries… JS-based solutions not accepted as meeting these criteria) 
Create clean, well organized and structured code in all of the above 
Intermediate debugging and troubleshooting skills 
Experience with build tools (Grunt, Gulp, NPM, Bower, Webpack) 
Experience with version control tools (Git) 
Understanding of further reaching technical concepts (API’s, modular concepts, 
Influential communicator with technical and non-technical individuals 
Share their knowledge and grow fellow developers through documentation, code reviews, mentorship, and training 
Can work autonomously and self-initiated 
Strong attention to detail  

Things that will impress us: 

React JS, Vue JS or Angular JS experience 
Ability to architect and develop their own API’s 
Ability to architect and develop build scripts (Gulp and Webpack preferred) 
Ability to develop Progressive Web Apps (PWAs), Electron apps, React Native apps, or mobile native apps 
Ability to somewhat cross the threshold into the backend (those that go more full-stack) 
Practical Implementation of Web Accessibility Standards (compliance with WCAG 2.0 Level AA preferred) 
Building their own side projects showing more advanced skills 
Contributing to an open source project 
Volunteering time educating/mentoring fellow developers 
Why Red Ventures? 


Red Ventures is a leading digital consumer choice platform. Through deeply integrated brand partnerships and consumer-facing assets, Red Ventures connects online customers with products and services in the home services, financial services, and healthcare industries. We use advanced analytics, data science, and integrated technology to cultivate and customize digital connections between brands and customers. We marry the speed of a start-up, the DNA of a digital agency, the strategic thinking of a consultancy, and the analytical skills of a big data company. Red Ventures is headquartered in Charlotte, NC and has more than 3,500 employees in offices across the US as well as in Brazil and London.  


We don’t do things because “that’s the way we’ve always done it.” We evaluate every process and fix what doesn’t work. We solve business problems because we are a culture of Doers. We care less about roles and more about solutions that move us forward. You will have the opportunity to challenge yourself and grow.  


Where good becomes great. We believe in work/life balance and offer a ton of competitive perks, including:
Competitive pay 
Opportunities for leadership and career progression 
Open PTO policy 
Brand new Learning & Development Center 
401k matching 
Family-friendly health, dental, and vision insurance 
Outdoor amphitheater and jogging/bike trail 
Onsite health center 
Health and wellness programs and classes 
Onsite gyms, basketball court, yoga studio, and bowling alley 
Other perks (just ask!)  

Next Steps 



If Red Ventures sounds like the place for you, please submit an application. Also, feel free to share if you have a presence online with a blog, Twitter, GitHub, Dribbble or another platform.    Apply Now

Qualified candidates will have approximately 2+ years of experience implementing engaging front-end experiences with HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.  Experience with AngularJS is preferred but any modern framework like Backbone, React, Ember, etc. are okay.  Additionally, candidates should have 1+ years of experience with Ruby on Rails and should be comfortable working with the back-end of the stack when needed.  The breakdown is approximately 75% front-end, 25% back-end development.  Any experience with Agile methodology is a plus.  BSCS or equivalent is required.

Frontend.jobDescription:
R0001691 Senior Front End Developer






Job Summary 
​​The Front End Developer is responsible for the development and management of new product design web pages. He/She will have to coordinate with marketing product managers and designers to ascertain applicable information regarding page design and functionality. He/She will use the appropriate technologies and internal systems for development, troubleshooting, testing, and will work in a multi-functional team to complete fast paced projects for the marketing department. The Front End Developer will occasionally develop internal infrastructural applications for monitoring marketing metrics or creating work flow systems for product managers. 
Job Responsibilities 
​

Develop new product design web pages. 

Work with different development and QA teams to code JavaScript snippets in test, and verify projects through development process. 

Oversee site optimization for SEO, cleaner and concise code, and code weight. 

Act as Liaison between marketing product managers and the development teams. May have to work off-hours when issues come up. 

Update internal documentation when new tools are available for other developers to use and distribute the information as needed. 

Create reusable HTML, JavaScript, and CSS modules 

Build out templates using  Handlebars/Angular/React  for new features and layouts. 

Able to build custom Javascript components/modules that can be reused by other developers. 

Perform other duties as required and assigned by manager and upper management. 

Follow legal policies as directed.


Job Requirements 


2-3 years of professional website coding experience 

Strong JavaScript skills are a must. 

Deep understanding of XML Http Requests, event listeners, and cookie/DOM manipulation 

Working knowledge of JavaScript frameworks like  Handlebars/Angular/React 

Must have a passion for clean semantic markup, with an attention to detail.  

Have a good understanding UI design, Usability, and Accessibility.  

Must know how to whip IE8 into submission and tame any other browser inconsistencies that pop up. 

Must be able to work fast and under pressure to create pages, wireframes, and fix bugs. 

Must be passionate about web standards. 

Must be willing to assist other developers and guide them with better development standards when needed


Education 


B.S./B.A. Computer Science or equivalent experience

Frontend.jobskills: .Net, AngularJS, Architecture, ASP, ASP.NET, Browser, CASE, Content Management, Developer, Development, Dreamweaver, GIT, HTML, Hub, JavaScript, jQuery, Libraries, Manager, Management, Project, QA, Security, Subversion, Technical Writing, Testing, Use Case, UX, Version Control, Web Developer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Looking for an opportunity to work with a highly engaging team dedicated to optimizing the user experience on the web? Employer's Planning and Development division, the communication hub of Employer s marketing and communications, public relations, compliance, security, and government relations is seeking a Front End Developer. This person must have a passion for developing highly engaging user experiences, using data to measure the effectiveness of the designs, as well as to seek out new opportunities for digital experimentation. In this role, you ll be working with our Experimentation Product Owner, developers, QA testers, designers, content writers, marketing managers and others to find opportunities for experimentation on our website. You will bring these ideas to life utilizing cutting edge technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, AngularJS, Jasmine, Karma, Protractor, Cucumber. Prior experience with A/B testing tools is a plus. 





 Primary Duties and Responsibilities:  
Translates advanced design compositions into clean, standards-compliant, semantic markup and responsive webpages or native applications by understanding the layout and behavior of the design. Works on moderately complex projects under moderate direction. 
Works with business owners, designers, UX strategists, and developers to implement a high quality user experience. Recommends improvements in functionality, navigation, and UI design elements that enable users and internal business clients to achieve their goals. Builds working relationships across the department. 
Develops working front-end code for testing and experimentation, including usability and A/B and multivariate testing. 
Works with IT to advocate for functional and efficient production client-side code. Collaborates with designers to realize and finalize prescribed web designs and system behaviors. Works with project teams to understand the business needs, and prototypes the design solutions as necessary. 
Effectively presents work to the project team, stakeholders, and departmental leadership. 
Maintains awareness of all of the available components and patterns, and works with project teams to identify new or revised components/patterns required to complete the designs. Collaborates with other teams for new and updated components/patterns. 
Has working knowledge of the client-side and server-side architecture for website development. Creates and maintains reusable component libraries for design patterns and behavior patterns. Incorporates content management systems as needed into the website architecture. 
Provides manager with realistic estimates of the level of effort needed to complete new projects. 
Tests webpages and conducts functional testing for team projects. Audits Employer webpages to ensure they project the desired look and feel. Completes applicable test documentation. 
Researches the evolving technologies related to this role. 
 Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.  

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess: 
Undergraduate degree in information technology or design, or the equivalent combination of training and experience. 
Minimum three years industry/field specific experience. Minimum of one year of front-end development. 
Extensive experience with HTML5, CSS3, and javascript. Experience with two or more javascript libraries, preferably Angular.js and jQuery. 
Experience writing regular expressions preferred. 
Experience with node.js and related node-based tools, as well as the iPhone SDK is preferred. 
Proven knowledge of web standards and cross-browser compatibility issues. 
Extensive experience taking design comps and translating them into their web-based equivalents. 
Experience with version control systems such as Subversion and/or Git, Dreamweaver, and Photoshop. 
Working knowledge of the following UI design practices and concepts: user-centered design, highly interactive interfaces, UI heuristics and principles, technical writing, business and user workflow, logical information organization and navigation, prototyping, and use case scenarios. 
Good interpersonal, organizational, and multitasking skills. 
Strong written and oral communication skills, including interviewing and presentation skills. 
Good analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Strong attention to detail. 
Knowledge of the financial services industry preferred. 

***Please provide examples of your work and/or a link to your website or portfolio. 
 
 Special Factors  
Employer is not offering visa sponsorship for this position. 
 Associated topics: angular, angularjs, asp, asp.net, css2, emberjs, javascript, js, html, web developer  

Department:  Information Technology

This Dallas Corporation that was listed as a top 20 Best placed to work by Forbes is looking for experienced C# Angular Full Stack Developers. You will be responsible for C#  Full Stack Development with an emphasis on Front End and CMS.  This is a team that is responsible for all .COM sites internationally for a Fortune 200 Corporation.  
This is a Full Stack C# MVC Front End Focused position developing frameworks on Sitecore CMS versus Single Page development.  You will develop the frameworks and also customization to the frameworks. The corporate marketing team (for example) will then hang their content on the pages.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Plan, analyze, develop, maintain, and support a moderately complex application or a small system.
Participate in the design, specification, implementation, and maintenance of systems. 
Design, code, test, and document software programs of moderate complexity as per the requirement specifications.
Participate in design reviews and technical briefings for specific applications.
Conducts basic financial analysis.
Estimates time against defined programming tasks.
Assist in preparation of requirement specifications, laying out of screens, reports, and forms including documenting and revising user procedures and/or manuals.
Involved with resolution of low complexity software development issues that may arise in a production environment.
Analyze, reviews, and alters program to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements. Writes documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, and corrections.
Support existing software application to cover incident management, problem management, and release management.
Perform other duties as assigned.
No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.
Decision made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines.

REQUIRED:
Experience building C# applications using the ASP.NET MVC and Web API frameworks
Full Stack C# Development is requiried
Experience in front end is required - JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, jQuery etc....
Experience in CMS Applications is HIGHLY preferred.  They are using Sitecore. Sitecore or other CMS experience such as Joomla, Drupal, Magento will be considered.
Experience working with responsive design, understanding of UI/UX concepts, consuming JSON or XML responses from REST services
Angular is highly preferred
Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) in a related field of work or equivalent work experience.

Employees flock to us from companies like Google, Yahoo, Red Bull, Procter & Gamble, Target, KraftHeinz, Kimberly-Clark -- as well as from every one of our competitors. We've even got some awards under our belt: #1 on San Francisco Business Times Fast 100, #84 on Inc. 500, #31 on Deloitte Technology Fast 500, and included on Greenbook's Grit50 list of most innovative companies in market research. This specialized asset management firm is looking for a Senior Front-End UI Developer to join their small team in the build out of a state of the art analytics system that robustly prices CLO’s. The team has built the back-end in C# on Linux  to allow for seamless integration with financial shops and the front-end in Angular / JavaScript for top notch user experience and usability on the UI.  The firm focuses exclusively on CLO securities, offering investors a professionally-managed and diversified exposure to the asset class, and the technology you'll be building makes it all possible! 

  
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Architect, design and deploy new web applications and features to scale and improve usability of the UI  

REQUIREMENTS:  



A computer science degree or at minimum a passion for computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms

Frontend.jobTitle: Full Stack/ Front End Software Engineer - Data Processing (200K+)
Frontend.jobskills: Algorithms, Architecture, C++, C#, Compilers, Consulting, Development, Java, Management, Programming, Project, Software Engineer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Full Stack/ Front End Software Engineer - Data Processing (200K+)   

Our client builds software to create high performance, massively distributed, parallel data processing platforms that solves the most complex business problems in the world 


The core platform is written in Java and C++ but the firm is language agnostic and open to technologists with Java, C++ or C# backgrounds. 


The ideal candidate is focused on building systems the right way and has had success solving complex enterprise level issues. 


Our client is looking for the best engineers, and will pay 100% relocation expenses. 

  
Project Scope:  


  

They are currently looking for Front End and Full Stack Developers to completely redesign their entire front end in a completely greenfield development project. 

  
Contribution/Impact: 


  

You will be building the complete UI used by fortune 100 clients and their millions of customers globally 

Software Development 


Our technology is the ultimate Big Data / High Performance application development platform in the world.  And that takes the best software developers in the world to envision it, build it, and make it work. 

  

Our development organization is composed of small teams of senior people, with very little management to get in the way.  We don’t even have “product managers” – the staff is responsible for determining product direction and deliverables.  A critical part of our experience is lots of customer interaction, via rotations through our support organization, occasional on-site consulting engagements, and exciting proof-of-concept projects. 


Because our platform is an application development environment, we have to address many challenges in computer language design, compilation, and execution.  A graphical programming language that really “works” is one of computing’s holy grails!  Our goal is to build a very sophisticated/scalable/high performance platform while still making it easy for our users to graphically express their business logic.  This requires a very strong knowledge of computer science, algorithms, operating systems, computer languages, databases, and the like. 


Our technology spans a tremendous range.  This starts with our user interfaces that make complex concepts and processes simple to express and manage for our customers, who themselves are experts in their business but are usually less technically advanced.  Another whole dimension is tracking, categorizing and analyzing everything about the users’ environments through metadata management. 


We have an infinite amount of work to do, from user interfaces, through compilers, to run-time engines.  But we always stay true to the approach:  We always try to think things through “From First Principles” before we do anything.  While architecture is critical, everyone in our development organization is “hands-on”. 


All development work on our products occurs at our headquarters in Lexington Massachusetts.

We are a digital marketing agency specializing in building trust between customers and brands. Our B2Me research process uncovers psychological motivators that become the strategic driver for execution of high impact marketing programs for Healthcare and B2B brands. We build micro-moments of trust across the customer journey by applying principles based on the intersection of marketing, psychology and neuroscience.

What You Will Be Doing

As a front end developer, you'll be a core member of the creative team, and will bring digital projects to life in collaboration with our designers, writers, strategists and account specialists. You'll contribute to the overall vision and direction of projects, using your knowledge of modern web technologies and trends. Working under the direction of the VP of Technology, you'll be building cutting-edge projects such as interactive tools, data visualizations, complex hospital websites and 3d product tours – with an opportunity to branch into other media such as mobile apps, AI, VR and AR. Frontend.jobskills: .Net, AngularJS, Architecture, ASP, ASP.NET, Browser, CASE, Content Management, Developer, Development, Dreamweaver, GIT, HTML, Hub, JavaScript, jQuery, Libraries, Manager, Management, Project, QA, Security, Subversion, Technical Writing, Testing, Use Case, UX, Version Control, Web Developer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Looking for an opportunity to work with a highly engaging team dedicated to optimizing the user experience on the web? Employer's Planning and Development division, the communication hub of Employer s marketing and communications, public relations, compliance, security, and government relations is seeking a Front End Developer. This person must have a passion for developing highly engaging user experiences, using data to measure the effectiveness of the designs, as well as to seek out new opportunities for digital experimentation. In this role, you ll be working with our Experimentation Product Owner, developers, QA testers, designers, content writers, marketing managers and others to find opportunities for experimentation on our website. You will bring these ideas to life utilizing cutting edge technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, AngularJS, Jasmine, Karma, Protractor, Cucumber. Prior experience with A/B testing tools is a plus. 





 Primary Duties and Responsibilities:  
Translates advanced design compositions into clean, standards-compliant, semantic markup and responsive webpages or native applications by understanding the layout and behavior of the design. Works on moderately complex projects under moderate direction. 
Works with business owners, designers, UX strategists, and developers to implement a high quality user experience. Recommends improvements in functionality, navigation, and UI design elements that enable users and internal business clients to achieve their goals. Builds working relationships across the department. 
Develops working front-end code for testing and experimentation, including usability and A/B and multivariate testing. 
Works with IT to advocate for functional and efficient production client-side code. Collaborates with designers to realize and finalize prescribed web designs and system behaviors. Works with project teams to understand the business needs, and prototypes the design solutions as necessary. 
Effectively presents work to the project team, stakeholders, and departmental leadership. 
Maintains awareness of all of the available components and patterns, and works with project teams to identify new or revised components/patterns required to complete the designs. Collaborates with other teams for new and updated components/patterns. 
Has working knowledge of the client-side and server-side architecture for website development. Creates and maintains reusable component libraries for design patterns and behavior patterns. Incorporates content management systems as needed into the website architecture. 
Provides manager with realistic estimates of the level of effort needed to complete new projects. 
Tests webpages and conducts functional testing for team projects. Audits Employer webpages to ensure they project the desired look and feel. Completes applicable test documentation. 
Researches the evolving technologies related to this role. 
 Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.  

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess: 
Undergraduate degree in information technology or design, or the equivalent combination of training and experience. 
Minimum three years industry/field specific experience. Minimum of one year of front-end development. 
Extensive experience with HTML5, CSS3, and javascript. Experience with two or more javascript libraries, preferably Angular.js and jQuery. 
Experience writing regular expressions preferred. 
Experience with node.js and related node-based tools, as well as the iPhone SDK is preferred. 
Proven knowledge of web standards and cross-browser compatibility issues. 
Extensive experience taking design comps and translating them into their web-based equivalents. 
Experience with version control systems such as Subversion and/or Git, Dreamweaver, and Photoshop. 
Working knowledge of the following UI design practices and concepts: user-centered design, highly interactive interfaces, UI heuristics and principles, technical writing, business and user workflow, logical information organization and navigation, prototyping, and use case scenarios. 
Good interpersonal, organizational, and multitasking skills. 
Strong written and oral communication skills, including interviewing and presentation skills. 
Good analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Strong attention to detail. 
Knowledge of the financial services industry preferred. 

***Please provide examples of your work and/or a link to your website or portfolio. 
 
 Special Factors  
Employer is not offering visa sponsorship for this position. 
 Associated topics: angular, angularjs, asp, asp.net, css2, emberjs, javascript, js, html, web developer  

Department:  Information Technology

 Medici Ventures is looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the technical aspects of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code. You will work directly with the UI/UX designer and the Product Owner to define and  build best-in-class  products that provide a profoundly simple  experience for the  customer while ensuring delivery of essential functionality.

Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code

Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs 
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation

Preferred Skills and Experience 
Clear understanding of the fundamentals of blockchain technology

Experience in a Scrum development environment 

  
 Education

Frontend.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Front-End Software Developers in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ).



Responsibilities Include: 
* You will engage with Business Clients, UI Designers, Developers, and Architects to create high performing and easy to use systems via the web as well as mobile-based applications
* You will create and implement design principles that ensures that our content renders well across multiple devices
* You will use and promote the use of front-end and mobile testing tools to ensure quality
* With limited guidance, the Developers will perform defect correction (analysis, design, code) on less complex issues and/or codes applications of medium complexity
* With guidance begins to install, customize, and integrate commercial software packages
* Works with more tenured peers to gain understanding of systems while conducting root cause analysis of issues, reviewing new and existing code and/or performing unit testing
* Works with experienced team members to conduct root cause analysis of issues, review new and existing code, and/or perform unit testing
* Learns to create system documentation/play books and attends requirements, design and code reviews
* Receives work packages from Manager and/or delegates
* Understands and assists in gathering and analyzing customer requirements and may respond to outages following the appropriate processes
* Partners with experienced Team Members to develop accurate estimates on work packages; May begin to identify issues that impact availability

REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) majors or 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree 
* 2-4+ years of Software Development experience in JavaScript, JavaScript Frameworks such as React or Angular, CSS3, and HTML5
* 2+ years of experience on closures/Prototypes/JS this and variable scope
* 1-2+ years of experience working with Agile methodology
* 1+ years of experience with a JavaScript framework like, React, Redux, Angular, or Backbone
* 1+ years of experience in designing/coding for high availability and performance
* 1+ years of experience with rapid prototyping/simulations/iterative design
* Experience in translating front-end mockups and wireframes into functioning applications
* Experience supporting accessibility requirements from ADA (Section 508 subset of a11y)
* Experience at using browser development tools within each major browser
* Experience testing in Selenium frameworks
* Understanding of HTTP interaction with browsers (request types, request headers, synchronous/asynchronous requests)
* Familiar with Gradle, GIT, GitHub, GitLab, etc. around continuous integration and continuous delivery infrastructure

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Our customer is seeking Senior and Mid Level Front End Developers
 with an emphasis in Angular
 (4 or 5 specifically) that will be positioned to provide substantial contributions to a customer-visible user interface. This position requires self-motivated, high-performing software engineers with a demonstrable aptitude for learning and applying new technologies; taking the initiative on a fast-paced, self-organizing Scrum team.
 
 The primary focus will be to implement a complete user interface in the form of a mobile and desktop web app, with a focus on performance. Your main duties will include creating modules and components and coupling them together into a functional app. The artistic design will be delivered to you, together with a few HTML templates, but we will ask for your help in regard to animations, CSS, and final HTML output. You will work in a team with the back-end developer and communicate with the API using standard methods.


 
 Responsibilities


Delivering a complete front-end application

Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop

Writing tested, idiomatic, and documented JavaScript, HTML and CSS

Cooperating with the back-end developer in the process of building the RESTful API


Skills and Qualifications


Proficiency with JavaScript, Angular 4+, and HTML5


Professional, precise communication skills

Deep knowledge of AngularJS practices and commonly used modules based on extensive work experience

Creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components

Ensuring a clear dependency chain, in regard to the app logic as well as the file system

Ability to provide SEO solutions for single page apps

Extensive knowledge of CSS and JS methods for providing performant visual effects and keeping the framerate above 30fps at all times

Thorough understanding of the responsibilities of the platform, database, API, caching layer, proxies, and other web services used in the system

Validating user actions on the client side and providing responsive feedback

Writing non-blocking code, and resorting to advanced techniques such as multi-threading, when needed

Creating custom, general use modules and components which extend the elements and modules of core Angular 4+

Experience with building the infrastructure for serving the front-end app and assets

Architecting and automating the build process for production, using task runners or scripts

Documenting the code inline using JSDoc or other conventions

Writing extensive unit tests using automated TDD tasks

Creating e2e test suites for all components, and running them with Protractor (or a well-reasoned alternative)

Creating configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments

Frontend.jobDescription:
Front End Software Engineer 


Full Time | Reston, Virginia 


Job Summary: 


We're looking for a Front End Software Engineer to help built and scale the controller for our high performance virtualization platform. Unlike traditional virtualization, our platform is controlled by via a cloud portal (imagine if vCenter were SaaS). This portal enables the customer to provision, manage, and non-distruptively upgrade on-premise infrastructure. 
Job Functions:

Write performant, client-side code for high volume, production applications using HTML/CSS/SASS, TypeScript, and AngularJS
Implement design specifications according to wireframes
Fix bugs identified by the quality assurance engineering team
Integrate front end applications with backend services
Write unit tests to verify code and protect against future regressions
Collaborate with engineers and designers to implement solutions to business requirements

Required Skills:

Ability to work independently as well as with peers
Strong knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Experience with JavaScript MV* frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, Ember.js, KnockoutJS, etc.)
Exposure to JavaScript task automation tools (NPM, Webpack, Grunt, etc.)
Familiarity with data serialization formats (JSON, XML)
Github profile with contributions to personal, professional or open source projects OR
Personal website, blog, or portfolio demonstrating competence in the field

Education and Experience:

BS degree in engineering, computer science, or information technology with 2+ years of professional experience
Experience with CSS preprocessors (Sass and/or Less)
Experience with Twitter Bootstrap or Zurb Foundation
Interpersonal skills to succeed in a professional environment

Nice to have:

Experience with TypeScript
Understanding of RESTful API design for web services
Experience with unit and end-to-end testing (Karma, Jasmine, Protractor, etc.)
Experience with back end development (Java, Ruby, .NET, Python, Node)

Application Process :


Please include one of the following:
Github profile with contributions to personal, professional or open source projects.
Personal website, blog, or portfolio demonstrating competence in the field

 

About Cloudistics:


Smartphones and computers are everywhere (like the one you’re using to read this). Technology runs businesses, and the economy. Cloudistics makes it easy for businesses to use technology.

Our solution eliminates traditional virtualization, storage, and networking silos and replaces them with a single, high performance, easy to manage solution. We’re fundamentally changing the way businesses consume infrastructure and IT services.

Fairness Matters:


We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Our client is building a new front end team.  This team will join a newly established server side development team in the development on all new projects for our client that will help them to grow and improve.  This is an exciting green field opportunity to work on new project with new technology and make a big impact.   

 

Technologists at our client are playing a key role in helping build the future of financial services, working hand-in-hand with business partners to create client experiences that are changing the way people invest. We’re looking for UI Developers to join our new Technology Development Center in NYC. We want technologists with a fresh perspective who are passionate about solving complex business, data and technical challenges.

You’ll work with smart, talented people across our business to create groundbreaking, next-generation applications for n-tier cloud architectures. You’ll be involved, hands-on, through the entire development cycle. And you’ll redefine the way our traders, portfolio managers and analysts serve our clients.

We will expect you to be agile / to lead / to think outside the box. In return, we’ll give you challenging work that has an impact / Opportunities to learn and grow / and a collaborative culture that encourages every member of our team to bring their point of view to the table—because that’s how we help our clients succeed. 

 

The Front Office User Interface Sr. Developer is a newly created position which has been established to provide world-class visualization and workflows in support of our Investment process. Our Front Office analysts in Research, Portfolio Management, and Trading demand best-in-class digital solutions to drive our performance in the financial markets.  The F/O UI Sr. Developer will join a team innovating the future of solutions for our investment professionals, providing thought leadership for the development and delivery of engaging and delighting experience for our clients and associates.

 

Principal Responsibilities:
Develop world-class User Interfaces for our Investment Professionals
Leverage cutting edge responsive web technologies such as HTML5, React, Angular, and OpenFin
Ensure quality by a deep commitment to automated testing (Akka, Jasmine, etc.)
Act as a champion and thought leader in creating the TRP digital experiences
Drive rapid site and digital asset development and deployment via creative strategy and information architecture
Create scalable creative experiences that improve usability, and align with Enterprise Digital Strategy and Brand Standards
Ensure compliance to UX design processes and design quality standards

Required Technical Experience:
Proficiency with front-end UI technologies like HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, etc.
Core object-oriented fundamentals (Java, etc.)
A strong understanding and demonstration of user centered design principles
Experience in Agile methodologies
Ability to translate work and requirements to IT teams in a manor conducive to rapid development environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Exceptional communication and organizational skills

Required Soft Skills:
Ability to successfully partner and communicate with all levels of an organization
Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively both with IT, with business management and a demonstrated ability to influence and impact the business
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to forge relationships resulting in successful partnerships
Strong negotiation skills, business acumen and customer focused
Enthusiasm for learning & results oriented

Required Education:
Strong academic record and a BA/BS degree
Computer Science preferred, other applicable degrees acceptable as well

Frontend.jobDescription:
About the Position
This is a unique ground-floor opportunity for a highly motivated and resourceful person to be a leader on our product team. In this role, you'll be involved in every aspect of our product from what we build to how we build it.
What You'll Do
Your objectives are to 1) take comps and build out pixel perfect UIs 2) build out our CSS and JavaScript frameworks to ensure an amazing, scalable and secure interaction for all our customers.
In support of this you will:
• Manage style sheets, JavaScript frameworks and application UX to ensure consistency and scalability with a focus on simplicity, centralized assets and documentation.
• Work with our agile dev team to solve difficult interaction problems and provide input during the UX design phase.
• Ensure the long term quality of our code through unit and functional testing.
• Help support answer technical product questions.
• Be the expert on industry UX/ design best practices.
 
Who You Are
• You are an experienced front end developer with 4+ years professional experience working on a web application.
• You're pixel-perfect and have a passion for building engaging and intuitive user interfaces.
• You're an expert in CSS, LESS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax.
• Experience with AWS, Linux, PHP and MySQL and the confidence to step outside the frontend to keep yourself unblocked a big plus.
• Upgrading an older code base and implementing new frameworks and standards excites you.
• You pride yourself on polished, easy-to-understand communication skills (written and verbal).

 

Perks
• Ground floor opportunity, yet more than just an idea – millions in revenue, profitable
• The rare chance to reinvent a $20bn industry from the ground-up. 
• Flexibility to work from home several days a week or our downtown Denver, Colorado office

• A fun and passionate (yet sane) work culture — we respect your weekends and personal life
• An enjoyable team environment: free lunches, happy hours, sporting events, and more
 
Benefits
• Extremely competitive salary plus incentives and options
• Health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
• Paid cell phone, home internet, transportation stipend, and everything you need tech-wise to own your role
• Unlimited vacation policy and eight paid holidays

We are looking for FrontEnd Developer in Morristown, NJ for Fulltime position. 


 

Please refer someone else if you are not available at this time or you are not right match for this job opportunity. We have great Referral Bonus up to $500!!! Please don't miss to refer someone who are looking for projects.


 


 


Job Description


Title: FrontEnd Developer 


Location: Morristown, NJ 


Type: Full Time


Client: Direct Client


 

Responsibilities

• Develop the client-side user interface of single-page web applications, that closely adhere to visual designs and established design standards, ensuring that they render appropriately across multiple devices and browsers
• Participate in design and requirements planning, providing feedback based on your knowledge of client-side controls, patterns and best practices
• Work within, and help establish, client-side coding guidelines, to ensure reusability, modularity and efficiency
• Work closely with your product team to prioritize and implement new application features, while simultaneously maintaining the quality of existing features and functionality
• Monitor the performance of production web applications to look for opportunities for optimization
• Assist the product team in managing and grooming the product backlog, assigning points to backlog items to correctly establish velocity, and establishing sprint goals
• Own the planning, completion, integration and quality of the code you produce
• Stay up to date with technology, tools, design trends, and industry best practices to help evolve the brand and team skills

Qualifications:

• Preferred 3+ years’ experience developing responsive, single-page applications using the AngularJS framework
• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent work experience
• Deep knowledge of HTML, CSS, REST, JSON, NODE, Bower and similar modern web frameworks/technologies, including Foundation, Bootstrap, React, or similar
• You are comfortable with Agile development tools such as Basecamp, Visual Studio Team Services, Jira Agile, or VersionOne
• Working knowledge of source control systems such as Github
• Working knowledge of debugging, performance monitoring, benchmarking, logging and testing tools
• CMS experience is not required, but is a plus
• Your code is clean, efficient, and you strive for reusability in your designs
• Strong technical understanding of the full stack of digital technologies (browser and server-side), and how they combine to deliver a superior user experience
• Strong customer orientation
• Effective verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
• Motivated to create meaningful product experiences for users
• Customer-centric, willingness to deep dive to understand customer needs and business drivers
• Have a voice to communicate effectively with people who may not speak your “language” as a developer
• Passion to succeed and continually improve skills
• Desire to exceed expectations and to manage multiple projects while meeting tight deadlines
• Detail-oriented and organized
• Excellent problem solver and comfortable in a fast-paced environment
• Capacity to set expectations and be self-directed
• Team player

IntraEdge has an urgent need for a full-time Front-End Developer in Tempe, AZ.  This position has great benefits and is eligible for a 12% Bonus!
You will be working as part of our development team and will collaborate with Architects, Database Developers, Integration Developers, Business Intelligence Developers, and fellow .Net Developers. We need you to be a good developer with the desire to be even better. We will help you to attain your goals with training, mentoring, and by giving you a chance to stretch and grow as a developer. As a Front-end Web Developer, you will be responsible for designing, coding, testing, debugging, and documenting websites and web applications. We believe success starts with having the right people -- those who have the right attitude and aptitude. We seek out goal-oriented professionals who are creators, leaders and pioneers. We value diversity in our workforce. By bringing together people with different backgrounds, thoughts and life experiences, we create a competitive advantage. Responsibilities:
·        Conducts a range of programming tasks including development, debugging, estimating, unit testing, and documentation for a variety of applications, systems, databases, or websites.·        Provides ongoing maintenance of applications, systems, databases, or websites.·        Provides application support including on-call (after hours, weekends, holidays) for priority issues.  Troubleshoots production issues. Evaluates and follows through on issues and problems until resolved or escalated.·        Assists with systems analysis and preparation of detailed systems design specifications.·        Participates in process improvement efforts within the Software Development team.·        Accurately estimates time required to complete development tasks; adheres closely to development plans and anticipates changes to product specification or schedule as they become necessary during a development cycle`
 

 
Requirements:

 
 
 
Minimum 5 years’ experience in custom web application development
A bachelor’s degree in a field related to the position or a combination of related education and work experience in the areas of application/web /systems/database development to equal four years
Solid understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
Solid understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
Solid understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery/TypeScript
Advanced understanding of Bootstrap
Advanced understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as Angular/KnockoutJS
Advanced understanding of responsive web design, asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX

Frontend.jobDescription:
The Front End Development team is responsible for APIs that external developers use to build apps on our platform. Our engineering team has one simple but lofty goal: deliver a breathtaking web experience to our customers. You'll have the opportunity to build extraordinary web applications that are reliable, fast, responsive, and beautiful. All experience levels are welcome!

You will:
Develop on top of rich, complex MVC frameworks
Figure out the application infrastructure to support our web apps
Test your JavaScript rigorously
Follow agile practices
Tweak your code to get the design exactly right
Build a great user experience
Work cross-functionally with our product teams, many other engineering teams, and partner with developers to design and implement our platform.
See the big picture to design robust experiences so the team can be brave, move fast, and break things, without ever showing a negative impact to customers.

You have:
The ability to write JavaScript, both in its raw form and with common JS libraries, (jQuery, Underscore, etc.)
Exposure to the recently popular JS-app frameworks (Ember, Angular, React, etc.)
Experience testing your code (QUnit, Mocha, Jasmine, etc.)
Know how to tease out the right HTML (or HAML) and CSS (or SASS, or Less) for a given design
An understanding of how the web works and can make pragmatic engineering decisions from that knowledge
Innate curiosity and a desire to be responsible for all aspects of building developer platform in a small, highly focused, and very rapidly growing team.
Track record of pursuing self-directed side projects, research, or open source projects.
You must deeply enjoy writing and shipping production software.

In addition:
You can straddle client and server development, creating APIs that drive web apps
Experience with Ember.js and/or d3.js
Interest in open source and early adoption of future standards (ES6, etc.)

Technologies we use and teach:
Responsive web development
jQuery, Ember, Angular, CoffeeScript, Sass, and other web-app frameworks
Maintaining the availability, growth, architecture, and scalability of all public APIs

You will be responsible for designing, building, and owning the customer facing front-end products and services that power all of the above.

Frontend.jobDescription:
About Innova Solutions: 

Innova Solutions is a global information technology company combining a global reach with a local touch. Headquartered in Santa Clara, CA, Innova employs over 1300 technology professionals worldwide with field offices in New York, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Pune and Taipei.
Innova is intensely client‑focused, specializing on Enterprises seeking to raise profitability, increase agility, improve IT efficiency and lower operational risk, all while accelerating business transformation. Innova specializes in highly complex Enterprise infrastructures, helping companies navigate and the challenging integration of the cloud with large‑scale legacy environments.
Innova enables global enterprises to address a dual mandate: to make their current operations as efficient and cost-effective as possible and to invest in innovation to unleash new potential across their organizations.
What makes Innova unique is our ability to help clients meet both challenges. We help them enhance productivity by ensuring that vital business functions work faster, cheaper and better. And, our ability to conceptualize, architect and implement new and expanded capabilities allows clients to transform legacy models to take their business to the next level.
By focusing on four key pillars - Cloud Transformation, Data Analytics, Product Engineering & DevOps and Operations Management, we enable our clients drive efficiency and effectiveness and build adaptable platforms for the new Cloud based, social, mobile enterprise.

As part of our Cloud Services team, we are looking at people with  Front end Lead/Architect for one of our project deploying in Santa Clara, CA. if you are interested please send me your update resume along with contact details to karthik.saraswathi@innovasolutions.com (karthik (dot)saraswathi(at)innovasolutions(dot)com.


 

Front End Lead/Architect 

Duration: Fulltime with Innova Solutions

Location: Santa Clara, CA

Duties and Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Product Management and User Experience regarding product definition, schedule, scope, and project-related decisions
Design, develop, deliver, and maintain product features on realtor.com and other consumer-facing digital properties
Deliver solutions that are of high quality, scalable, cloud-based, re-usable and with intuitive user experience
Work collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum team to plan and execute at high velocity, and across teams in a distributed global delivery model
Investigate technologies that can be leveraged to introduce new innovations in meeting business and customer goals
Provide input into process improvement initiatives to improve quality and timeliness of deliverables with high predictability
Sprint planning and management of cross-application/module dependencies
Manage a team of developers and contribute towards establishing technology center(s) of excellence, best practices within the larger team

Education, Skills and Experience:

Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field.
10-12+ years of hands on professional software development experience architecting, building, deploying, and maintaining apps at scale.
Successful track record of delivering on projects, both individually and as a team member
Rails experience: You can understand and communicate a feature design from model(s) to endpoint(s) to the front-end
Working experience with a front-end framework (Angular.js, Ember, Backbone, and React/Flux).
Proficiency in client-side web technologies (HTML5, CSS, JS, Bootstrap)
Experience with server and client performance optimization for high traffic web applications (Preferred)
Experience building mobile responsive sites (Preferred)
Experience with unit test frameworks, and test automation tools is a definite asset (Preferred)
You are passionate about creating world-class web experiences for our customers and will work hard to achieve this.
Strong problem solving skills and ability to clearly communicate technical concepts in simple terms
Passion for learning, continuous improvement, sharing and working in a team environment
You take pride in writing clean, quality code, but can balance this with business practicality
You hold a point of view and aren’t afraid of challenging assumptions, but are humble enough to recognize when you are mistaken.
You are able to learn quickly and effectively apply new knowledge, demonstrating the desire to stay in touch with emerging technologies

Regards,

Karthik SVVS

Lead -- Talent Acquisition

Innova Solutions Inc..

Desk No:- 408-708-9839

Email:-Karthik.Saraswathi@innovasolutions.com

Address: 3211 Scott Blvd, Suite # 202, Santa Clara, CA 95054

My client is a stable, profitable, growing eCommerce organization with a niche market command and tons of growth potential.  They are currently staffing a team of Web Developers to completely revamp their high-traffic, public-facing transactional eCommerce system and are seeking a solid Front End Web Developer.

Qualified candidates will have 2-3 years of hands-on experience developing web applications using HTML5, CSS3, Javascript (jQuery, AngularJS), etc.  Ideal candidates will have experience working on highly-transactional, public-facing websites, ideally in the eCommerce space.  BSCS or equivalent is desired.

The Front End Web Developer will participate in full life-cycle development of new features and ultimately a complete re-write of the website and features.  Candidates must have excellent communication skills as they will work in a collaborative team environment with two other Development teams, Product, etc.  This position features competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits and lots of room for professional growth.  Please send your resume to nyjobs@cypressg.com for immediate consideration and more details of this opportunity.

Frontend.jobskills: HTML5, JavaScript, Angular
Frontend.jobDescription:
Lead Front End Developer (High-growth tech company)


 

This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in developing the front end of web and mobile interfaces for our new platform that will be used by hundreds of thousands (if not millions) of consumers. You’ll be leaned on as the subject-matter expert when it comes to all-things front end. We are passionate about building easy to use, beautiful, well-structured products that delight our customers, and we strive to do so with code and technologies that are high-quality, modern, maintainable, and elegant. This is a full-time role with a very generous salary, benefits, and perks.

 

Responsibilities


 
Work with a small, innovative team developing an entirely new application as we expand our product and platform offerings.
Evolving our web experience to use fast and fluid rendering and interaction technologies.
Build great consumer-friendly interfaces that allow consumers an equally effective experience across both web and mobile browsers.
Evolve our "run-anywhere" HTML5 experience to use fast, fluid, native rendering and interaction technology.
Design and tune novel approaches for high performance with Big Data on performance-constrained browser or mobile devices and networks.
Code in and learn multiple technologies across our suite of desktop, server, cloud, and mobile solutions.

 

Skills / Qualifications


 
You have high standards, and your software practices ensure you deliver high quality even under schedule pressure. For instance, you believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools and techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support. You deliver more results by using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices. Demonstrated ability to code a delightful user experience/flow.
Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all become better. You assume good intent in others, and actively do your part to make a positive work environment.
Self-Motivated. You don't need to be micromanaged.
Strong skills and experience in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3. Experience or familiarity with one or more web frameworks such as AngularJS, Backbone, Ember, Bootstrap, and Knockout. Ideally, you have experience developing large-scale web or mobile applications.
Interest in diverse applications and user communities.
At least 3 years’ experience developing commercial web applications.

Frontend.jobskills: JavaScript, Ethereum, React.JS, TypeScript, Redux, REACT, ES6, Blockchain, dApps, Solidity - JavaScript, Ethereum, React.JS, TypeScript, Redux, REACT, ES6, Blockchain, dApps, Solidity
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
JavaScript, Ethereum, React.JS, TypeScript, Redux, REACT, ES6, Blockchain, dApps, Solidity

If you are a Frontend Developer with experience, please read on!

We are working with a protocol that enables decentralized origination, underwriting, issuance, and administration of tokenized debt assets in a highly generic and unopinionated construction. The protocol aims to build a common informational interface by which exchanges, brokerages, and traders can reasonably price a tokenized debt default risk without having to rely on a singular centralized data broker. The debt issuance scheme leverages two classes of utility players that compete in distinct marketplaces for compensatory fees -- underwriters and relayers. The former are trusted originators and assessors of debtor default risk, and the latter facilitate the funding and issuance of debts in a trustless manner. Both can be empirically evaluated on historical asset performance, and, as such, markets have lucid signals with which to evaluate the default risk of tokenized debts attested to by any given underwriter or relayer. The debt issuance process only requires one on-chain transaction to execute, and is heavily inspired by the mechanics of the 0x Protocol.

What You Will Be Doing

We're looking for an experienced, detail-oriented software engineer with an enthusiasm for building feature-rich, well-tested, and polished web applications using component based frameworks like React. This individual will spearhead the building of a suite of first-party applications that showcase the protocol's capabilities and give non-technical users a tangible way to interact with the ecosystem.

- Build out well-tested, polished user experiences and applications using modern, component-based frameworks like React
- Spearhead a user-focused product lifecycle by distilling user feedback and metrics into actionable product improvements
- Shepherd products from designs and specifications to live deployments
- Build reusable components and libraries for consumption by the open-source community that pull data from and interact with the Ethereum blockchain

What You Need for this Position

- 4+ years of experience in software engineering
- Proficiency with React, Redux, Typescript, and ES6
- An ability to write high quality, well tested code
- An understanding of the basic mechanics of blockchain applications and dApps 
- A passion for decentralized technologies and their potential to transform the financial system 
- Familiarity with Solidity development (nice to have)

What's In It for You

- REMOTE
- $110K – $130K base salary
- 1.0% – 5.0% equitySo, if you are a Frontend Developer with experience, please apply today!

Frontend.jobDescription:
Full Description:   

Senior Front-End Processor Engineer 

Location:   Aurora, CO. 

Required Clearance:   Secret 


 For immediate consideration, please send your resume to tim.forbert@teamitec.com . Job Code: #145241 

Job Description:   

 1. ITEC is seeking a Senior Front-End Processor (FEP) Engineer that works closely with other Integrated Product Teams, System Engineers, manufacturers, and vendors to meet FEP requirements for the program. 

 2. The qualified candidate must effectively install, configure and maintain over 400 FEP and COMSEC devices, including performing firmware and software updates. 

 3. The qualified candidate must have Infrastructure Engineering design and documentation tool knowledge and experience. 

 4. Other roles of this position include, but are not limited to: 

 1. Support of the FEP Working Group. 

 2. Support the design of new FEP solutions and troubleshoot problems with existing FEP solutions. 

 3. Work directly with vendors to maintain hardware and upgrade software/firmware. 

 4. Support risk management activities by developing risk mitigation recommendations in support of reducing program risks. ? 

 5. Create/maintain FEP maintenance schedules for multiple environments. 

 6. Create/maintain FEP Operation Guides. 

 7. Complete FEP related Discrepancy Reports and Change Requests (DRs/CRs). 

 8. Write and submit Request For Materials (RFMs) to obtain equipment from vendors. 

 5. An active US Government Secret security clearance is required as of day one of this assignment. 

Required Skills/Experience:   

 * Minimum of 4 years' experience in Hardware or Infrastructure Engineering. 

 * Experience in network hardware systems design. 

 * Project Management experience. 

 * General knowledge of COMSEC equipment. 

 * Demonstrated written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills and creating SOPs. 

 * Ability to understand and communicate complex problems at different levels of detail. 

 * Ability to decompose large, complex problems into components and the vision to develop integrated solutions between these. 

 * Active US Government SECRET Clearance. 

Desired Skills:   

 * Experience with FEP, Crypto KS-252 and KG-175 devices. 

 * Experience in FEP subsystem development. 

 * Experience presenting solutions to Engineering Review Boards and Change Boards. 

 * Hands-on experience configuring and troubleshooting Cisco, Linux and/or Windows systems. 

 * System Engineering knowledge including requirements management and verification traceability. 

 * Experience supporting Integration & Test (I&T) activities. 

 * Experience in Operations and Maintenance (O&M) support. 

 * Experience working in a multi-disciplined engineering environment. 

 * Familiarity with the system development life cycle. 

 * Experience defining interface definitions Interface Control Documents (ICDs). 

 * Experience working in a development or Satellite Operations environment. 

 * Experience with Ground Systems Operations. 

 * Six Sigma certification. 

Required Education:   


 Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience. 


 For immediate consideration, please send your resume to tim.forbert@teamitec.com . Job Code: #145241 


 With continuous growth since our inception in 1999, ITEC has a strong and reputable presence in the aerospace and Department of Defense (DOD) market. ITEC is a member of the National Association of Government Contractors. ITEC has experienced exceptional growth because of our commitment to our customers and employees. 


 We invite you to learn more about ITEC at www.teamitec.com . Join us. We are always seeking great talent to join our ITEC Team. 

ID:   145241

Frontend.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce is working with a well-known, technology oriented, firm located in the heart of New York (Soho), New York (NY). They are seeking a talented and dedicated Senior Front-End Developer to be part of this growing department. This is a well-established firm with a startup culture that offers a casual environment, a technology team who loves to embrace new tech stack, offers work from home flexibility, PTO flexibility and lots of other perks.


As a Front-End Developer, you will:
* Develop web sites, applications, and mobile apps with a focus on optimal user experiences
* Use Test Driven or Behavior Driven Development Methodologies
* Write Unit and Integration Tests
* Provide Estimates for Technical Tasks
* Play a key role in the architecture and design of our products
* Participate in Code and Design Reviews

Benefits:
* A fun, collaborative team of professionals with expert level skills
* The opportunity to build web based business applications and publications
* A fast paced, dynamic, iterative development environment
* An organization that values coding skills and personal initiative: your ideas will make a difference
* Top notch compensation and benefits including health benefits, matching 401K, gift budgets and work / life balance
* A great working environment

REQUIREMENTS:
* Have a BA / BS in Computer Science; MS a plus
* The ideal candidate will have 4-5 years of professional experience programming JavaScript interfacing with various back end technologies; Experience with Node.JS and React is a plus
* Experienced developing web sites and applications with a focus on optimal user experiences using object-oriented JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, JSON and MySQL
* Have thorough knowledge of browser behavior and compatibility, cross-browser issues and solutions
* Familiar with UX principles
* Experience using a VCS, preferably Git
* Experienced with OO Design Principles and Patterns
* Familiar with MVC and templating
* Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills
* Familiar with React, Redux and a node framework
* Familiar with build systems (e.g., Gulp, Grunt, Webpack)
* Experience with microservices
* We are looking for an enthusiastic, friendly person who values small company culture and teamwork

You are:
* Passionate about coding and new technologies
* Dedicated to solving problems elegantly and innovatively
* Big picture thinker with attention to details and appreciation for analysis
* A developer who consistently delivers and keeps up to date on best practices/standards and programming methods
* Interested in being part of a team dynamic by participating in code reviews and proactively helping out fellow developers

You want:
* To build world class websites with dynamic UIs leveraging HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JavaScript Frameworks, Ajax, REST, JSON
* To work with a team of talented and enthusiastic developers
* To drive business growth through technology initiatives

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Outstanding Company, Great Benefits, Amazing Culture  


Backing our front end, our core data processing engine exemplifies Big Data. It already processes tens of billions of records daily; we are revamping it to be more scalable, in execution time, data volume and resource usage. We are improving our operational infrastructure & processes to support a rapidly increasing, global customer base and expanding data volume. Working in high growth startups

Frontend.jobskills: JavaScript, REACT, Redux, Apollo, Python, Postgres, graphql, Django, Flow, TypeScript - JavaScript, REACT, Redux, Apollo, Python, Postgres, graphql, Django, Flow, TypeScript
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
JavaScript, REACT, Redux, Apollo, Python, Postgres, graphql, Django, Flow, TypeScript

All applications with 100% completed skills and questions sections WILL receive a call about this position.

If you want to accelerate your career growth, you need to stop thinking about the day one stuff. Instead, think year one, and beyond.

For example, consider this position we're working on. It involves a small-sized (25 person) San Francisco-based Technology company that asked us to find them a Senior Front-End Application Developer with a strong background and passion in JavaScript, React, and scaleable and modular architecture - and and help them become as big as their dreams. As a result, you will, too! That's the stuff beyond year one. 

If you're interested, here's what year one is all about.

Performance Profile:
1) Work on the most exciting web platform in the world, a suite of extremely ambitious design-focused apps for building and managing digital experiences at scale. We're looking for someone who can hit the ground running.
2) Build, write and maintain beautiful code in JavaScript (ESNext flavors via Babel) and build on React / Redux / Apollo along with flow for static type checking. 
3) Take ownership of your work and projects. We don't want an order-taker. We want someone who will propose the best options to the customers.
4) Utilize your empowered entrepreneurial spirit to advance your career here.
5) Grow into a management and leadership development opportunity (if that's your thing).

Fast track your career by applying today.

What You Will Be Doing

Performance Profile:
1) Work on the most exciting web platform in the world, a suite of extremely ambitious design-focused apps for building and managing digital experiences at scale. We're looking for someone who can hit the ground running with an active knowledge of the WordPress core and proper plug-in development techniques.
2) Build, write and maintain beautiful code in JavaScript (ESNext flavors via Babel) and build on React / Redux / Apollo along with flow for static type checking. 
3) Take ownership of your work and projects. We don't want an order-taker. We want someone who will propose the best options to the customers.
4) Utilize your empowered entrepreneurial spirit to advance your career here.
5) Grow into a management and leadership development opportunity (if that's your thing).

What You Need for this Position

- Realistically, we need someone with at least 5+ years experience  in JavaScript with an understanding of Python. (You don't learn these things overnight). Coming from a competitor of ours (platform based software or services) would add a lot of credibility.

- Someone who is smart, tech-savvy, friendly and always up-to-date on new technologies.
- A strong background in JavaScript and Python
- Experience with Django, Postgres, and GraphQL
- Knowledgable about browser performance and how to measure, diagnose, and improve it.
- Ability to collaborate with the rest of the team to set and enforce best-practices for a team-based development environment.
- A fundamental understanding of how the internet works.

Bonus points for any of the following:
- Familiarity with React, Redux,  and/or GraphQL {insert cutting edge thing here}). :)
- Familiarity with Flow, or TypeScript

Most important is a hands-on understanding of development and a desire to exceed your own expectations of what you're capable of We want to transform the way our clients build their sites.  If you pull all of this off, the CTO will be thanking you!

While this is all of the Year One and Beyond Stuff, Day One is pretty good, too. These are things like the compensation, the company, the people, and the location. However, none of this matters unless "Year One and Beyond" makes career sense for you.

A strong predictor of success for this person is having previously developed and architected scaleable and modular front end applications.

What's In It for You

- We offer a competitive compensation package
- We CREATE a great place to work. We're working on incredible exciting projects and people love working here.
- Our benefits package is fantastic. 
- Massive career growth opportunity
- Challenging problems and a creative, fun work environment
- Bright and engaging co-workers
- Growing company with a start-up approach and feel
- We do award winning work for some big names.
- You have the freedom and opportunity to write the rules and have an impact on how the work directly. 
- We have the entrepreneurial spirit. We're not looking for order takers. 
- We want the best and the brightest, is that you?We're interviewing now.

If this is something that excites or interests you, apply today.

Connect w/me and engage via LinkedIn:

Frontend.jobDescription:
Full Description:   

Senior Front-End Processor Engineer 

Location:   Aurora, CO. 

Required Clearance:   Secret 


 For immediate consideration, please send your resume to tim.forbert@teamitec.com . Job Code: #145241 

Job Description:   

 1. ITEC is seeking a Senior Front-End Processor (FEP) Engineer that works closely with other Integrated Product Teams, System Engineers, manufacturers, and vendors to meet FEP requirements for the program. 

 2. The qualified candidate must effectively install, configure and maintain over 400 FEP and COMSEC devices, including performing firmware and software updates. 

 3. The qualified candidate must have Infrastructure Engineering design and documentation tool knowledge and experience. 

 4. Other roles of this position include, but are not limited to: 

 1. Support of the FEP Working Group. 

 2. Support the design of new FEP solutions and troubleshoot problems with existing FEP solutions. 

 3. Work directly with vendors to maintain hardware and upgrade software/firmware. 

 4. Support risk management activities by developing risk mitigation recommendations in support of reducing program risks. ? 

 5. Create/maintain FEP maintenance schedules for multiple environments. 

 6. Create/maintain FEP Operation Guides. 

 7. Complete FEP related Discrepancy Reports and Change Requests (DRs/CRs). 

 8. Write and submit Request For Materials (RFMs) to obtain equipment from vendors. 

 5. An active US Government Secret security clearance is required as of day one of this assignment. 

Required Skills/Experience:   

 * Minimum of 4 years' experience in Hardware or Infrastructure Engineering. 

 * Experience in network hardware systems design. 

 * Project Management experience. 

 * General knowledge of COMSEC equipment. 

 * Demonstrated written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills and creating SOPs. 

 * Ability to understand and communicate complex problems at different levels of detail. 

 * Ability to decompose large, complex problems into components and the vision to develop integrated solutions between these. 

 * Active US Government SECRET Clearance. 

Desired Skills:   

 * Experience with FEP, Crypto KS-252 and KG-175 devices. 

 * Experience in FEP subsystem development. 

 * Experience presenting solutions to Engineering Review Boards and Change Boards. 

 * Hands-on experience configuring and troubleshooting Cisco, Linux and/or Windows systems. 

 * System Engineering knowledge including requirements management and verification traceability. 

 * Experience supporting Integration & Test (I&T) activities. 

 * Experience in Operations and Maintenance (O&M) support. 

 * Experience working in a multi-disciplined engineering environment. 

 * Familiarity with the system development life cycle. 

 * Experience defining interface definitions Interface Control Documents (ICDs). 

 * Experience working in a development or Satellite Operations environment. 

 * Experience with Ground Systems Operations. 

 * Six Sigma certification. 

Required Education:   


 Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience. 


 For immediate consideration, please send your resume to tim.forbert@teamitec.com . Job Code: #145241 


 With continuous growth since our inception in 1999, ITEC has a strong and reputable presence in the aerospace and Department of Defense (DOD) market. ITEC is a member of the National Association of Government Contractors. ITEC has experienced exceptional growth because of our commitment to our customers and employees. 


 We invite you to learn more about ITEC at www.teamitec.com . Join us. We are always seeking great talent to join our ITEC Team.
