Frontend.jobskills: HTML,  CSS, Post CSS, Engineer
Frontend.jobDescription:
*Job DescriptionUnited Technologies Corporation (UTC) has a deep history of innovation that brings together big thinkers, problem solvers and a culture for pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.  Our global reach and rich history uniquely positions us to succeed in the new digital economy.  Our investment in digital innovations will make travel better, people safer and urbanizing cities more comfortable and connected.
UTC is committed to leading in the digital era and will unleash the size and scale of its businesses on the digital world of big data and the Internet of Things.  We are looking for the very best thought and technology leaders who will help grow our Digital Accelerator in Brooklyn, New York – In a vibrant, urban, oasis overlooking the iconic Brooklyn Bridge.  Come join us in this journey. 
About United Technologies – NYSE UTX:


With revenues of approximately $57 billion, United Technologies Corporation (UTC) is a Fortune 50 company that provides high technology products and services for the aerospace and commercial building industries.  Our aerospace businesses include Pratt & Whitney and UTC Aerospace Systems.  Pratt & Whitney is a world leader in the design, manufacture and service of aircraft engines.  UTC Aerospace Systems is one of the world’s largest suppliers of technologically advanced, aerospace and defense products.
 
Our commercial building businesses include Otis Elevator and Climate, Controls & Security.  Otis is the world’s largest manufacturer and maintainer of people-moving products, including elevators, escalators and moving walkways.  UTC Climate, Controls & Security is a leading provider of heating, air conditioning and refrigeration systems, building controls and automation, and fire and security systems.  These companies are leading to safer, smarter, sustainable and high-performance buildings.
 
Ranked among the world’s greenest companies, we do business in virtually every country of the world and have over 200,000 employees globally. 
 
 
Position:


We are seeking highly motivated Software Developers who will directly impact the next-generation of our products and services. You will play a hands-on role in the design and development of new digital apps as well as improvements to our existing digital portfolio. In this position you will be exposed to all software system components, including the UI, backend systems, database, performance tuning, security design, and mobile and desktop deployment. You will have the ability to grow your experience and explore new technologies within our cross-collaboration team setting that is leading the digital transformation for United Technologies.
 
As a member of a cross-functional team of product managers, software architects and designers, you will combine your software development and analytical skills to build web & mobile apps that solve real world problems leveraging best of breed digital technologies. This role will also work closely with UTC's engineering, design, operations, marketing and service delivery teams to challenge the boundaries of what's possible.
 
This position will provide the unique opportunity to operate in a start-up-like environment within a Fortune 50 company. Our digital focus is geared towards releasing the insights inherent UTC's best-in-class products and services. Together we aim to achieve new levels of productivity by changing the way we work and identifying new sources of growth for our customers.
 
What You’ll Do


Develop and maintain user-facing features
Ensure technical feasibility of UI/UX requirements
Optimize application code for speed and scalability
Identify strategies to systemically improve code quality
Automate repetitive tasks and enhance the developer experience
*Education / CertificationsBachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent practical experience
*Experience/QualificationsTechnical Skills

Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent practical experience
10+ years of experience
Strong JavaScript (ES2015) development skills, and proficiency in a framework for building interfaces (React, Angular)
Mastery of HTML5/CSS3, and proficiency in CSS pre-processing (SASS,LESS)
Experience building Responsive and Single Page Applications (SPA)
Experience in web application development and associated skills (REST, HTTP, JSON)
Familiarity with networking and security basics (ssh, certification, DNS, key management, CORS)
Usage of dependency bundling tool (Webpack, Browserify)
Experience with browser testing and debugging
Affinity for profiling and analyzing code to identify areas for improvement
Usage of Continuous Integration services (Jenkins, CircleCI)
Experience working in a Test Driven and Agile environment
Preferred Skills

Experience with low-level JaveaScript APIs  (ServiceWorkers, IndexedDB, Canvas, SVG, Fetch)
Familiar with Platform and Cloud services
Experience with micro-service oriented application architecture
Experience rapid prototyping and concept development
Soft skills

Excellent analytical and multi-tasking skills
Ability and eagerness to pass on knowledge to other team members
Ability to define and develop improved working practices
Organizational and presentation skills
In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)
Can demonstrate close working relationships with “back-end” engineers and understand how best to integrate a front-end toolchain into a modern web stack
A sincere commitment to crafting readable and reliable code
EEO/AAP StatementUnited Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Our client would like to recruit a front-end software engineer. As a member of their team, you build software around the needs of some of the world's leading doctors and researchers, helping them find, visualize, and make best use of complex medical and scientific data – typically through the browser on mobile or desktop. Your work will provide the bridge between our users' intentions, and their ability to actually get things done with our data.
When you're not building new products, you'll spend 30% of your time working on R&D projects – helping us forecast the likely intersection of technology and medicine in 3-5 years time.
If you are interested in joining a small, agile team whose goal is to have a meaningful impact on people's lives, we want to hear from you.

You are:
 Able to influence product and interface concepts from their earliest stages.
Able to write client-side code to create fast, responsive, future-friendly web applications.
Fluent with data, and able to make good decisions when data needs to be prepared and visualized in the browser.
Comfortable enough in your craft to optimize existing web applications, based on test data, analytics, or human insights.
Familiar with test driven development and good engineering practices.
Independent enough to work on small scale projects gathering requirements, prototyping, and laying down the foundations of good software.
Capable of communicating and collaborating on larger, longer-term projects involving interdisciplinary team members.

 BA/BS in Software Engineering, Interaction Design, or a related field.
3+ years of applicable industry experience.
Expert-level HTML, CSS, JS along with experience in current frameworks.
Experience with React JS, Angular JS, and/or ES6 a huge plus.
Strong portfolio of completed work.
 Nice to have:
 A design sensibility; ability to make solid aesthetic choices independently.
Experience working with 2D and 3D data visualization.
I look forward to hearing back from you.
Best,

STI is seeking a Front-End Software Development Manager for our Client in Glendale, California.

 This position is responsible for leading the design, coding, and unit testing of your work and other developers within your function, following the Client's engineering software management methodology and ensuring adherence to those standards. The Manager of Software Development will leverage best-in-class systems and processes for collaborative planning and execution. The successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of successfully developing high quality production code, scalable software products and platform capabilities. S/he will lead continues delivery transformation providing efficiency to company roadmaps.

 JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
 * Manage the technical teams working in Node.JS, Angular,.JS, and backbone stack, in their delivery of projects and technical design solutions for varied business or technology work requests.
 * Develop UML design documentation for your code/modules, and work with the team to ensure they follow the proper development practices, and develop proper code.
 * Develop modular code that can be re-used in various configurations and scales for large application needs
 * Continuously look for efficiency gain and improvements to your work product
 * Facilitate communication inter-teams and within to ensure cohesiveness, and clarity and efficiency.

 * Mentor and train developers on best practices, build high-performing teams, and ensure quality and customer focused deliverables.
 * Manage the work deliverables based on proper prioritization and efficient coordination of all tasks, and issues.

 Required Qualifications

 EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
 * 9-12 + years of experience working in software development with 7+ years of management experience in a fast-paced software development team.

 * Must have 5+ years of experience in consumer-facing, ecommerce and mobile systems a plus.

 * Demonstrated knowledge of Linux

Frontend.jobDescription:
Did you know that Employer has a program that focuses on making our existing and new applications as accessible as possible? Accessibility ensures all users have equal access to information and functionality regardless of ability (visual, hearing, motor, cognitive, and color perception). The Accessibility program is working with all of the IT sub-divisions to evaluate and improve the web experience for all of our clients. Being a virtual company, this is so important! 

The Accessibility Developer will work with the project teams across IT to support in implementing accessibility standards, build out training materials for teams to use along their accessibility journey, and contribute to office hours and other forums to further educate the developers at Employer. Front-End/UI skill-sets, relationship management, and leadership impact are the primary tools needed for success in this role. 





Duties and Responsibilities: 
Provides senior level system analysis, design, development, and implementation of applications and databases for client/server-, Web-, and/or PC-based software or middleware. Integrates third party products. 
Translates technical specifications, and/or logical and physical design into code for new or enhancement projects for internal clients.  Develops code and test artifacts that reuse subroutines or objects, is well structured, backed by automated tests, includes sufficient comments and is easy to maintain. Writes programs, appropriate test artifacts, ad hoc queries, and reports.  Employs contemporary software development techniques to ensure tests are implemented in a way that supports automation. 
Elevates code into the development, test, and Production environments on schedule. Provides follow up Production support. Submits change control requests and documents. 
Thoroughly understands software development methodology. Thoroughly understands architecture standards. Trains and mentors staff with less experience. Resolves issues elevated from staff with less experience. 
Participates in design, code, and test Inspections throughout life cycle to identify issues. Explains technical considerations at related meetings, including those with internal clients. 
Performs systems analysis, including system requirements analysis and definition (e.g., prototyping), and logical and physical design. 
Writes the system/technical portion of assigned deliverables. Assists technical team members with the system/technical portion of their deliverables (e.g., systems testers, test plans). On small teams, the developer may write these items. 
Thoroughly understands client business functions and technology needs. Has a broad understanding of Employer's technologies, tools, and applications, including those that interface with business area and systems. 
Is highly functional on large, matrixed project teams. Interfaces with cross functional team members, including database administrator, IT security, project manager, technical writer, and clients. Communicates systems issues at the appropriate technical level for each audience. 
Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established milestones. Thoroughly understands and complies with all Information Security policies and procedures, and verifies deliverables meet Information Security requirements. 
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned. 

Education & Experience (Qualifications): 
Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience. 
Minimum of 5 years developer or systems analyst experience. 
Strong written and oral communication skills. 
Strong, demonstrated analysis and problem solving skills. 
Strong planning and organizational skills. Knowledge of or ability to learn the Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0 level A and AA) and mentor other crew. 
Assistive technology knowledge and experience is a plus (JAWS, NVDA, WindowEyes, ZoomText, VoiceOver). 

Advanced knowledge of one or more development tools and programming languages:

Frontend.jobDescription:
Parkifi is solving the world’s parking problem. By providing easy access to analytics on spot-level parking data from lots, garages and on-street spots, we enable more efficient usage of the limited parking spaces and enforcement resources. Delivering data-driven insights on parking from coast to coast, Parkifi is active in Smart City development as well as the local Denver area IoT community driving more devices to be connected, providing relevant and timely data to our customers. Parkifi brings together the Iot, Big Data, and Real World to solve one of the most fundamental challenges facing the modern city today.

Visit  www.Parkifi.com . 

A successful Senior JavaScript Developer has all the following: 
 

5+ years of Software Development experience in a variety of programming languages 
Prefers to work in an XP process (pair programming and TDD). 
Advanced full-stack experience AngularJS, React, vueJS, Rails or other JavaScript frameworks 
Experience with Java/Spring, Elixir, Ruby is a strong plus 
Deep understanding of RESTful APIs, database, and caching techniques 
Unix/Linux/Mac OS experience 
Shell scripting (bash, sh, zsh) 
Experience on using Git, Rally, Jenkins and CircleCI 
Working knowledge of testing frameworks like Protractor, Jasmine, Karma, Selenium 
Experience working with RabbitMQ or other messaging systems 
Exposure to relational databases (Postgres and MySQL) as well as NoSQL technologies like DynamoDB and MongoDB 
Experience with cloud technologies(AWS/AzureGCP) is a strong plus 

Strong background in building dynamic, high-volume and scalable system with Java using an Agile development methodology 
As a Senior Frontend Software Engineer, you will play a central role in the design and development of the Dish IoT product(Parkifi). The ideal candidate will have a passion for development and a strong background in building dynamic, high-volume systems using an Agile development methodology. The candidate will be working on our Parkifi (a DISH IoT) development team in our Denver downtown office. They will be working in an extremely collaborative and fast-paced environment using both scrum and XP methodologies. As a fast growing start up, we look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced agile environment. Most importantly – We look for people that can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done. 
 

Primary responsibilities fall into the following categories: 
 

Develop with a focus in AngularJS, react, vueJS, Rails, or other JavaScript frameworks 
Experience on designing, building large scale application and micro service architecture 
Experience on production support and maintenance 
Create code within a TDD and pair programming environment 
Work in fast paced, agile methodology 
Act as a technical mentor and coach to less experienced developer 

#LI-KK1 Denver, CO 
#CB1

If you are a Software Developer with experience, please read on!

What You Will Be Doing

We are looking for a new team of gung-ho programmers that want to revolutionize how business is conducted. We are building a platform that will replace the internal systems of businesses across multiple industries, as well as serve as a base to add on any number of new fully integrated systems. We have an initial version of this platform in production, but are looking to add to our team of programmers individuals that want to take it to the next level and share in the rewards of its success.
Successful candidates will become part of a small team of developers and will have a high level of involvement in coding final software features, either on the front end, back end or both, based on experience and capabilities.
We are a hardworking company that puts in long hours but still finds time to have some fun. We keep the office atmosphere pretty flexible and work with each employee to help maximize their productivity. We do personalized coaching and mentoring with each employee to help them grow professionally and to give them opportunities to take on new roles as the company grows and changes.
We are not looking for candidates that want a 9-5 job. We are looking for someone who is passionate about coding, wants to eat, sleep, and breath the company and the product, and wants to share in the success of their hard work. We push our employees to constantly improve themselves and grow, and we believe that their success as individuals will translate into our success as a company.

We offer a base salary and the potential for stock ownership in lieu of cash bonus. Frontend.jobDescription:
Description 

InsideSales.com  offers the sales industry’s first comprehensive sales acceleration platform that creates high performance sales teams with breakthrough technology, and increases the revenue of their customers’ world-wide by applying our machine learning and innovative technology.  Our product is pure technology, supported by a predictive machine learning engine.  

InsideSales.com  is growing incredibly fast and is funded by some of the top venture capital firms, as well as by Salesforce and Microsoft.   Our leadership team hails from great companies including Salesforce, eBay, IBM, Infor, Citrix, VMware and Amazon.  We have high expectations and have attracted great leaders who have enjoyed a similar ride elsewhere, and are excited to be here.  


Joining a fast growing company is a great way to accelerate your career. We’re transforming how SALES is done, applying technology to revolutionize and modernize.  Want to bet on your career and learn a lot?   Come join us. 


Engineering for scale: 


InsideSales.com  builds for the cloud, deploying as a software as a service (SAAS) platform.  We have a portfolio of seven products, and are very focused on building a true platform of micro-services.  We’re initiating a major transformation of our platform to realize this vision.  


You’ll learn about building a large scale platform of distributed micro-services, using cutting edge technologies.   

We need you if you: 


Love a challenge – the best technology problems are those tackling really hard business and scaling problems 
Delight in building scalable, fast, robust and elegant software in modular components 
Are proud in producing high quality solutions and iterate until they are truly awesome 
Learn constantly about new technology, challenges and lessons from your mistakes 
Cooperate in a team environment where you can learn from your peers and they can learn from you 



Many job descriptions read like a shopping list for the impossible.  At the core, we’re looking for great software engineers.  Technologies change, but great minds transition.  That said, the following set of qualifications are relevant and useful to the problems we’re solving:  

Position Responsibilities: 

Work closely with product owners, senior engineers, designers, programmers, and QA to deliver industry-leading solutions 
Responsible for constructing solutions based on customer requirements 
Contribute to the implementation of major features and components from requirements and designs 
Contribute to the creation of functional and technical specifications 
Responsible for contributions in technical design, task estimation, implementation, automated testing, debugging, and deployment 
Participate as a productive member of an agile team of engineers 
Produce high quality, test-driven software 
Assist in planning, costing, designing and testing 
Communicate well with product managers, customer support, and other team members 
Promote established standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the software development life cycle 
Responsible for Tier 1 services for identity management and license management 



  Requirements: 

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent and/or the ability to show us that you are a great engineer 
3+ years of software development, ideally in B2B Saas or a B2C web environment 
Experience mentoring junior engineers and leading design efforts on complex systems 
A demonstrable track record of building great software 
OOP, web, and services experience.  All the skills to build great distributed and complex systems 
Experience in working in small Agile teams and iterating to build great solutions 
Ability to work in a Linux environment 
Experience in building RESTful services across some combination of Node.js, Go, Scala, Python, C#, Java.  
Web development skills in Javascript, preferably with React or AngularJS. 
Database experience – both SQL and NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, etc) 
Experience with queuing technologies including RabbitMQ 
Experience with cloud deployment  services, like AWS. 



InsideSales.com offers competitive compensation, generous benefits including a matching 401(k) program, healthcare insurance and reimbursement accounts, as well as a gym membership and ongoing training & education programs.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Collectively, we are a unique group of technologists with broad capabilities operating as a flat organization, working in a brand-new state of the art office located near Central Park. We are independent and employee-owned, our decisions are not driven by outside shareholders or short-term market fluctuations.

 Technology is co-located with the business in our Global Headquarters. Technology doesn't just enable our business, but is taking accountability to create tools to give our business a competitive edge. Your work space is designed for collaboration with huddle/scrum rooms, audio/visual connections across the floor, soft seating and dedicated white-noise development spaces. Employee feedback is taken seriously and contributes to our constantly evolving office environment.

 Responsibilities:   

 We are looking for a Senior Developer to be part of our rapidly evolving technology environment.
 You won't be in a cube, coding in a vacuum, but taking an active role in developing business technology tools. You will work as part of an agile team participating in analysis, design, development & implementation of applications, systems and processes that address business needs & are aligned to a multi-year roadmap.

 Specifically aligned with Marketing group you will focus on our web capabilities and integration between related systems such as Sitecore, Sharepoint, Seismic, Eloqua & Salesforce.com.

 Senior Developers are part of the wider NB Technology Team, and have a voice in contributing to the firm wide technology agenda, integrating best practices, technology standards and innovation across the entire team.

 The right candidate would:   
 * Balance strong object oriented design and programming concepts with the ability to communicate clearly with both business and technology users.
 * Participate in the analysis of requirements and collaborate with team members to convert them into high-performing, scalable solutions
 * Be able to develop in a variety of platforms, using the right tool for the right job all while leveraging industry & firm frameworks where appropriate.
 * Discuss and debate solutions, both process and technique ? ask why things are done and challenge the status quo before executing.
 * Actively participate in the Agile process, following Scrum Methodology working in sprints on stories defined & prioritized by the product owners.
 * Voice opinions at all times, seeking ways of improving the process and their outcomes.
 * Have a strong sense of ownership, taking pride in their work & contribution to the team.

 Required Skills & Experience
 * BS / MS in Computer Science or similar discipline.
 * 5+ years of application development experience in modern OO languages in C#/.Net using enterprise frameworks and design patterns.
 * 5+ years of experience with HTML, CSS3, Bootstrap 3, JavaScript, JQuery, SASS, Angular2, ReactJS
 * 2+ Custom SharePoint development including web parts, page layouts and PowerShell.
 * Must have a solid understanding & experience of relational databases and data structures including Linq to SQL, XML, JSON, store procedures, triggers and database design.
 * Experience with ASP.NET MVC & Sitecore a plus.
 * Strong working knowledge of principles of responsive development.
 * Experience developing for cross browser compatibility.
 * Well rounded developer with interest and aptitude to quickly learn new tools and technologies.
 * Solid analytical, design, and problem solving skills.
 * Strong communications skills, both written and verbal.
 * Poised under high pressure situations.

 * Experience in Financial Services Industry, Asset Management a plus.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Title: 
Lead Front End Developer
Job Location:
 Chicago,IL
 
Duration:
9+months
 
Description:
Advise clients on front-end strategy, framework selection, emerging technology.
Contribute to the development of our internal tools and reusable architecture.
Be a change agent. Help move our design, development, and delivery processes into the next generation.
Develop front-end code based on wireframes, visual designs, and UX specifications.
Use front-end frameworks such as: React, Angular, Ember, Vue, etc.
Integrate with REST APIs or other back-end frameworks.
Accurately estimate upcoming work and deliver reliably.
Be a mentor to junior developers.

Must Have

JavaScript – Demonstrable mastery of JavaScript, and experience with one or more front-end frameworks: React, Angular, Ember, Vue, etc.
HTML – Mastery of HTML: semantics, accessibility, and cross- browser compatibility.
CSS – Mastery of CSS, including preprocessors (Sass preferred), naming methodologies such as BEM, and techniques for scaling CSS on large projects.
Automation – Familiarity using Node libraries to ensure code quality: JSLint, JSHint, ESLint.
Testing – Experience with JS unit testing approaches, such as: Jest, Jasmine, Mocha, etc.
Performance – Experience creating code optimized for production, via JS minification, “tree shaking” dependencies, image compression, etc.
Collaboration – Ability to collaborate with team members across various disciplines: UX, design, tech, business, QA, etc.

Source Control – Familiarity with source control: Git, SVN, etc.
Experience – We prefer 5+ years of experience for lead roles.

Preferred

BS/BA degree with CS concentration, or equivalent experience.
Back-end development experience in Node or Java is helpful.
Experience with front-end build tools: Webpack, Grunt, Gulp, or JSPM.

 

Regards,


Sanjay

sanjay@systemskills.net

Frontend.jobDescription:
***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies***

Front-End Engineer

Our client is seeking a Front-End Engineer to join their team in Beaverton, OR. As a software engineer in the content space, you will be responsible for creating high quality applications that will reach consumers around the world. You will work with the engineers and product owners across multiple teams to develop and grow tools to manage and deliver digital content across the organization. You will have the opportunity to be a strong advocate of both the tools and direction of the team as we continue to build the next generation platform. 
Responsibilities of the Front-End Engineer

Developing new, reusable components and libraries using modern front-end technologies.
Building associated tests (unit, automated, e2e) as a part of the deployment pipelines.
Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.
Working closely with design teams, translating prototypes and wireframes into high quality code.
Partnering with other engineering teams to provide direction and recommendations for better performance and experiences.
Understanding business requirements and translating them into technical requirements.
Qualifications of the Front-End Engineer

Core web fundamentals: HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript including the DOM lifecycle and the object model.
Thorough understanding and experience with React/Redux and its core principles.
Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript (ES6).
Familiarity with full-stack data flows and RESTful APIs.
Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms such as JSON Web Token.
Test frameworks and tools such as Jest, WireMock, and Jenkins.
Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git.
Basic Linux and command line skills.
Experience working in an agile team.
Experience with Amazon Web Services are a plus.
Experience with Node is a plus.
Experience with front-end frameworks like Foundation or Bootstrap, and CSS preprocessors like SASS or LESS experience are a plus.
Experience with JavaScript-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and Bower are a plus.
Benefits

Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k.
About VanderHouwen 

VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide.  Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.

Frontend.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in search of a Front End JavaScript Developer in Boston, Massachusetts (MA).


Overview:
The Digital team at our client is looking for an experienced Front End JavaScript Developer who has proven work experience developing and supporting enterprise-class web applications utilizing all front-end technologies. Leveraging a solid knowledge of HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and JavaScript frameworks, the candidates will work in a collaborative environment to develop highly interactive digital experiences.
 
The candidate will take direction from tech and creative leads while communicating issues, providing estimates, and helping to envision creative solutions to technical challenges. The candidates must be team-oriented and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ideal candidate will have experience interfacing with various back-end technologies, as well as frameworks and services. Our Front End JavaScript Developers must demonstrate the ability to master new/emerging technologies and take initiative to offer technical direction and creative solutions.

REQUIREMENTS:
* 5+ years of experience focused on Front End development
* Significant experience in coding and unit testing in HTML/HTML5, CSS3 
* Experience building a comprehensive pattern library 
* Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery and BootstrapJS
* Excellent understanding of how content, design, and UI work together for an optimal user experience 
* Understanding of semantic meanings on markup code and W3C standards 
* Thorough understanding of fluid and responsive layout, browser behavior, and compatibility, and cross-device issues and solutions 
* Strong understanding of peer review and source control (preferably git)
* Ability to own the end-to-end front-end development of a project 
* Able to create markup that is consistent across all browsers and platforms, understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues, and ways to work around them 
* Ability to promote good coding practices

The Front-end Development team supporting Optimization and Content Management has a job opening for a front-end developer that will produce cutting-edge user interfaces for web applications running on desktops, mobile phones and tablets.
This role will work in a fast-paced cross-team collaborative environment working with business stakeholders to maximize the performance and profitability of digital web properties featuring the services available in the product line.

Staying on top of current trends in web development

Experience working with JavaScript frameworks, AJAX, DOM manipulation and JSON

Job Title: 
Front End Engineer

 

Location:
 Santa Clara Valley, CA 95051

 

Start Date: 
Flexible but need candidates to be able to start in the next 2 – 4 weeks

 

Contract Length: 
12 month assignment with possible extension option

 

Shift Hours:
8 – 5, Monday through Friday.

 

Position Summary: 
The client is looking for an accomplished senior engineer with a deep understanding and genuine passion for front-end development.

 

The candidate will be expected to: 

Build complex user interface from the ground up using the latest web technologies.
Develop new user-facing features using frameworks such as Angular and React.
Collaborate with a other team members including Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts.
Communicate and present their work in a clear and simple manner.
Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code.

 


A good candidate will also be: 

A team player who likes to collaborate and ask questions
A self-starter who likes to innovate
Have a passion for simplicity
Have excellent communication skills
Flexible and has a willingness to learn and try new approaches Positive and able to adapt quickly to change

 

Key Qualifications:

5+ years of hands on front end development experience with web apps using HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other industry standard frameworks.
Extensive experience with front end frameworks such as React and Angular
Experience with CSS pre-processing frameworks (Sass, Less, Stylus)
Confident being hands-on from initial wireframes, through prototyping, into building the final product.

Experience with code versioning tools and processes Good to have

Experience in working with Open Source tools and technologies

 Prefer bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent

Frontend.jobDescription:
SkillStorm is seeking a Senior Front-End Developer for one of our clients in Jacksonville, FL.

 

Job Description: 



The Senior Front-End Developer will be working in a highly collaborative role with our digital, marketing and development teams. Responsibilities will include developing and evolving various state of the art desktop, tablet and mobile experiences for all client-facing digital properties. This position will collaborate with partners through all stages of a project to fully understand the scope, requirements and project objectives. You must possess a solid understanding of future-friendly web principles, great technical knowledge, and a proven expertise developing with web best practices. Plus, as a Senior Front-End Developer, you’ll be expected to stay on top of the latest technology, web and mobile trends.

 

Essential Functions: 

Lead the development and maintenance of sophisticated, elegant and blazing-fast websites and applications for all of client-facing properties
Very strong ability to communicate with internal and external partners, strong problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership
Deep understanding of web best practices and a passion to stay on top of the latest web/mobile technologies
Must have strong initiative and work ethic to manage competing priorities and meet critical project deadlines

 

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements: 

Organizational and time management skills to complete multiple projects in a fast-paced environment while adhering to set timelines and budgets 
Very strong ability to communicate clearly (written and oral) and effectively
Ability to take complex tasks and requirements and develop simple, clean and high-performing solutions
Ability to represent front-end development standards on enterprise level initiatives
Proven ability to write clean and well-documented code
Very strong knowledge of responsive web design best practices, and mobile-first methodologies
Strong rapid prototyping skills with the ability to shift directions to support business needs
A strong ability to optimize code from pre-production to production for outstanding site performance
Very strong knowledge of the full-stack while working in an MVC-style development and consuming web services (APIs)
Very strong passion for quality assurance and ability to write detailed end-to-end tests

 

Training and Experience:

5+ years professional experience (or equivalent) developing
Expert knowledge of browser technologies (HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript
Professional experience with Angular 1 and 2 (TypeScript), ReactJS and CSS pre-processors
Experience creating and maintaining various build tools (ex. Gulp or Webpack)
Strong knowledge with Jasmine, Karma, Nightwatch (or equivalent) for testing
Experience working with version control systems like TFS or GitHub and enterprise content management systems (Adobe Experience Manager AEM, Sitecore, or similar)

 

Desired Skills: 

Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent training is strongly preferred 
Experience contributing to large open-source projects
Understanding the power of digital analytics and the ability to utilize quantitative metrics to support decision making
Ability to develop mobile apps (iOS, Android)

Job Title: Senior Front End Engineer-
 React


Location: Sunnyvale, CA


Duration:  12+ Months


 


Job Description
:


We are seeking a talented Senior Engineer with strong Front end experience and a proven track record of building high quality scalable web applications, and solid leadership abilities. You will be responsible for implementing pixel perfect designs that balance challenging customer needs with application performance. Requirements: - BS in Computer Science or related technical field required.

ü  Qualified Full Stack Engineer with strong emphasis on Front End Experience with proven experience with React JS or equivalent, Node.js and Javascript.

ü  Experience in HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, AJAX, Responsive Design, and general Web 2.0 techniques in the context of interactive Web Applications

ü  Experience with XML and XSLT technology

ü  Experience with building fast and efficient web applications with pixel perfect design

ü  Experience with deployment technologies like Capistrano or equivalent

ü  Experience with Source Code Management Tools (GitHUB)

ü  Experience with frontend performance optimization tools like Pagespeed etc.

ü  Experience with Source Code Management Tools (Github)

ü  Experience developing using relational databases such as Oracle or MySQL

 


Additional Job Details

As a Software Engineer in Search Tools team, you will be making a positive impact on our Customer experience.
The Tools are used daily by Merchants, Engineers and Executives to make informed decisions, change User Experience, etc.
All teams within our Search team — business, evaluation, operations, system, big data, leadership — depends on the data we gather about business and needs to make impactful decisions.
Our work is high-impact: it makes the entire Search team, particularly the product operation team, able to iterate faster and react to changes that accelerate business growth.
As a Search Tools’ member, you will have visibility into every other team.

 


Position Description

Design high performance, highly scalable web application.
Build and maintain new features on supported Tools platforms.
Work with business and PM to draw and visualize key insights.
Stay abreast of the fast moving field of Web UI, SPA, big data, open source.
Leverage and improve upon the computing resources of the world’s largest retailer.

 

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related fields with 3-5 years of experience as software engineer or similar role.
Proficient in Javascript
Proficiency with the Web architecture, at least one modern javascript framework (React.js preferred).
Excellent communication skills.

 

Additional Preferred Qualifications

Experience building SPA (Single Page Apps).
Experience building services using back end technologies (Nodejs, Rails)
knowledge of SQL and database technologies (Hive, MySQL, Cassandra, MongoDB)
Knowledge of Ruby and Python
Self-starter who is willing to learn new technologies and dive-in to imperfectly-formed technical questions.
Building novel visualization tools that help Search team members easily use core datasets to generate insights.
Deep knowledge in computer science fundamentals and software design best practices.

  This is an outstanding opportunity for a Front-end Web Developer with our client in the Dallas area. You will be responsible for writing high-quality production code at the heart of the client*s core platform. You will contribute to a highly collaborative team of JavaScript/HTML/CSS Developers interfacing with a Java/Spring back-end building a cloud-based platform; develop, test, debug, document, and maintain the front-end of the core product; and, improve and utilize company standard patterns for software development to ensure consistently high levels of quality and productivity. You will embrace Agile principles and support iterative processes to maximize the delivery of this valuable software. 

 This position requires 2 - 5+ years of JavaScript development experience, with strong knowledge of HTML and CSS. Must have experience with one or more JavaScript frameworks and libraries such as AngularJS, Ember.JS, Ext JS, Backbone.JS, Handlebars, and Underscore.JS/Lodash. Some familiarity with JavaScript testing and automation tools, including: Karma, Jasmine, Istanbul, Grunt, Gulp, SASS/LESS is needed. Nice to have experience with: React, D3, Highcharts, Redux, ImmutableJS, RxJS, LoDash, Wijmo, & WebPack. A strong grasp of object-oriented principles and front-end patterns is required. Ideally, you are highly motivated, with enterprising instincts, and an ownership mentality; you thrive working with talented teams seeking to achieve superior results; love to learn and apply new technology; and, you are comfortable working closely with business stakeholders, user experience designers, and quality assurance. You must embrace evolving requirements and specifications; believe in the value of test automation; and, enjoy solving challenging problems. Excellent written and oral communication skills, negotiation, collaboration and interpersonal skills are essential. BS Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related fields.

* Experience in creating innovative pie charts, tables, and dashboards with card layout is desirable
* Experience developing enterprise GUIs is highly preferred
* Strong experiencer in Python is preferred; however, a reasonable Python understanding is negotiable
* Flask server framework, Django experience is desirable
* Experience with GUI localization implementation is strongly preferred; Support of Chinese language is an immediate requirement
* Previous experience in web development or other related fields
* Familiarity with HTML, JavaScript, or other related languages
* Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
* Strong attention to detail

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Frontend.jobskills: Application, Applications, Architecture, Computer, Development, Engineer, Engineering, Engineers, Foundation, JavaScript, Project, Quality, Scripts, SDLC, Software, Testing, User Interface, UX, Web
Frontend.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client seeking a Front End Engineer in San Diego, California (CA),

Overview:
This is a team currently in the forming and storming stage. A startup within an industry leading company. We are extremely motivated to deliver awesome to our customers as well as push the boundaries on technologies and processes. You will work on everything from automation scripts to front end design to business-critical business logic that drives our current tax products. Not only is this project a monumental task that is set to lay the foundation for decades to come, but these tools will be an integral piece for migration, maintenance, and new artifacts from now and well into the future.

Why this opportunity:
This Team is a growing with a growing inventory. The engineer will be part of maturing the process and technology and be a key player in the migration of a large application to a new architecture.

Essential Functions:
* Development: Creating 50% vs. Maintaining 50%/Front End 80% vs. Back End 20%
* Quality: Development 50% vs. Quality Engineering 50%
* Testing: Manual 25% vs. Automation 75%/Front End 80% vs. Back End 20%
* DevOps: Development 90% vs. 10% Ops
* Full Stack: Front 80% vs. Back 20%

Responsibilities:
* Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
* Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
* Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
* Build page navigation buttons and search fields
* Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
* Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
* Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders

REQUIREMENTS:
* BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
* 5+ years of experience designing and developing web, software, or mobile applications
* Excellent communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Business Acumen - strategic thinking & strategy development reporting

Nice to haves:
* Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
* Portfolio of design projects
* Expertise with wireframe tools (e.g., Wireframe.cc, InVision, etc.)
* Expertise with: JavaScript (especially ReactJS)
* Experience in the software design/architecture process
* Expertise with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

Frontend.jobskills: React.js, Angular.js 1.x, Vue.js, Flux, Redux, javascript, Java, .Net
Frontend.jobDescription:
At CBTS, we take pride in being a company of over 700 highly qualified engineers with advanced industry certifications helping our customers succeed every day.   We have a culture of innovation, of agility, of continuous learning.  Ours is an entrepreneurial environment, promoting creativity and a climate that cultivates new ideas. CBTS’ commitment to customers to providing flexible, tailored solutions breeds flexibility in our employees and the organization.  

 So, are you ready to make an impact? Our employees don’t come here to coast. They join our team for the rewarding challenges and ongoing opportunities to help expand technology into the future. Be a part of our growing community.
We are looking for a strong JavaScript developer who is proficient with React.js or Angular.js 1.x or Vue.js.

This position can sit in Cincinnati, OH; Lexington, KY; Louisville, KY; Indianapolis, IN or Columbus, OH.


POSITION DESCRIPTION:


Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux) or Angular 1.x. You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is important.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Developing new user-facing features using one or more of the key JavaScript based frameworks listed in the Job Description
Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code
Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
Creating highly visible responsive design patterns

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
Thorough understanding of React.js or Angular.js or Vue.js and its core principles
Experience with popular javascript workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
Experience in either Java or .Net stacks
Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript
Experience with data structure libraries (e.g., Immutable.js)
Knowledge of isomorphic React is a plus
Familiarity with RESTful APIs
Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token
Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git, SVN, and Mercurial

WHAT WE OFFER:
A fast-paced environment delivering next generation technology solutions
An opportunity to give back to our communities
Exposure to amazing industry leading / trend setting organizations
A comprehensive benefits and compensation package

 

APPLY TODAY! YOUR FUTURE IS NOW!

Frontend.jobskills: eCommerace, HTML, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript,Adobe CS, UI Optimization, Responsive Design
Frontend.jobemploymentType: Full Time, Contract Corp-To-Corp, Contract Independent, Contract W2, 12 months
Frontend.jobDescription:
Must present links to portfolio with submission!!!!

The E-Commerce Front End Developer makes certain the site looks and functions appropriately for all who use it. This role has expert understanding of Web programming languages and coding standards to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences while also having a keen eye for detail. The E-Commerce Front End Developer works closely with a talented team of Information Architects, Visual Designers, and Developers from concept through production. This role is instrumental in fulfilling the company's vision and providing advanced solutions for our E-Commerce site and related digital marketing campaigns.

Key Areas of Responsibility 
• Leads front-end development efforts for project from conception to implementation. 
• Write standards-compliant code including testing/debugging in multiple browsers and platforms. 
• Works with Visual and UX Designers to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences, microsites, HTML emails, and other digital media. 
• Ability to take graphic files and translate them into functional experience on web and mobile platforms. 
• Participate in the functional requirements definitions for new or modified applications 
Responsibilities 
• Work closely with internal development and design teams to ensure flawless integration with back-end technology and a great user experience 
• Maintain continuous contact with all internal and external stakeholders through the project and after completion making sure features are delivered with high quality and on time. 
• Help with and manage production tasks 
• Perform code reviews

Minimum Qualifications 
• Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience. 
• 5 years of E-Commerce related design and development experience. 
Other Required Qualifications 
• Expert knowledge of HTML, HTML5 and CSS 
• Knowledge of working with JavaScript frameworks to create rich interactive content 
• Expert knowledge of user experience best practices and ability to implement solutions based on unique needs of specific users 
• Proficiency with Adobe CS. 
• Familiar with interaction design and information architecture methods and principles. 
• Knowledge of the user-centered design theory and demonstrated participation in an application of study findings to range of past projects. 
• Experience developing UI optimization for small screens 
• Knowledge of W3C standards and SEO principles 
• Strong attention to detail and ability to creatively problem solve. 
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholders including senior leadership. 
• Train and mentor junior designers. 
• Proven track record of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously and negotiating work flow, while meeting deadlines. 
• Portfolio required.

Preferred Qualifications 
• Experience with E-Commerce websites 
• Solid understanding of Responsive Design 
• Good understanding of Web Accessibility

Rate: 55/W2 or 65/C2C.   Can also be in Vernon Hills, IL. 

Great work environment, possibility of going much longer than 6-12 months. 

Key Areas of Responsibility 
• Leads front-end development efforts for project from conception to implementation. 
• Write standards-compliant code including testing/debugging in multiple browsers and platforms. 
• Works with Visual and UX Designers to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences, microsites, HTML emails, and other digital media. 
• Ability to take graphic files and translate them into functional experience on web and mobile platforms. 
• Participate in the functional requirements definitions for new or modified applications

Minimum Qualifications 

• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 
• 5 years of E-Commerce related design and development experience.

Other Required Qualifications 
• Expert knowledge of HTML, HTML5 and CSS 
• Knowledge of working with JavaScript frameworks to create rich interactive content 
• Expert knowledge of user experience best practices and ability to implement solutions based on unique needs of specific users 
• Proficiency with Adobe CS. 
• Familiar with interaction design and information architecture methods and principles. 
• Knowledge of the user-centered design theory and demonstrated participation in an application of study findings to range of past projects. 
• Experience developing UI optimization for small screens 
• Knowledge of W3C standards and SEO principles 
• Strong attention to detail and ability to creatively problem solve. 
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholders including senior leadership. 
• Train and mentor junior designers. 
• Proven track record of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously and negotiating work flow, while meeting deadlines. 
• Portfolio required.

Preferred Qualifications 
• Experience with E-Commerce websites 
• Solid understanding of Responsive Design 
• Good understanding of Web Accessibility

Front-End Java Developer 
Washington, DC metro area


Ref#2018-1483



For a large financial services client, we are seeking a Java Developer (Front-End, Full Stack), to work on a 1 year or longer project
 involving their Single-Family forecasting framework.  The ideal candidate will be a “guru-level” web user interface designer, used to rapid, iterative prototyping, who thrives in a fast-paced, low-structure environment.  The hired developer will develop the front-end GUI for the framework, working with an Oracle database.

Responsibilities:


Frontend web application design and development of the GUI automation pages

Prototype, research and develop solutions

Collaborate with SAS developers, testers, production owners, business users and project managers with minimal supervision and guidance.

Work independently to understand user stories and design appropriate system solutions and contribute to all phases of system development.



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.

5+ years with front-end Java development and web application user interface design/implementation

Strong experience with JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, JSON, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS

Strong experience with Tomcat, relational databases (prefer Oracle and Netezza), and SQL

Understanding of Maven

Full-spectrum application building with minimum requirements specified

Used to responding quickly to changing requirements and working with heterogeneous technologies

Assurance of delivery with limited resources

Prefer experience with Spring Framework and Java based web applications; experience in corporate training; experience in the financial services industry.



Company Overview


The Oakleaf Group is a mid-size consulting firm with offices in Bethesda, MD and New York, NY. Our people are our greatest assets and our company culture is grounded on that belief. Our goal is to thrill our clients and challenge and reward our employees.  As a member of the Oakleaf team, you will have an exciting opportunity to work with emerging technology, modernize financial applications, and grow in a friendly workplace where you can work independently and collaboratively. In this position the ideal candidate will work to solve complex “hot topic” issues currently faced by the financial services industry. We bring depth of experience to a wide range of highly satisfied clients, delivering trusted advice along with quantitative, technology, regulatory, and operations strategies. Do you possess the talent and dedication to be part of our growing team?


Third party candidates will not be considered for this position.


As a condition of employment with The Oakleaf Group, any successful job applicant will be required to successfully complete a background investigation, which may also include a pre-employment drug screen and/or a credit check for positions in some areas of our business. The Oakleaf Group is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to race, religion, gender, native origin, age, disability, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. The Oakleaf Group participates in the E-Verify program.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Front-End Engineer

 

W2 only. No C2C or sponsorship available. 


 

Description:

The Front-end Engineer will work in a collaborative environment with product managers, business analysts, Drupal developers, and UX designers to help transform the way that the client interacts with the public. The selected candidate will be responsible for translating design mockups into functional and accessible production-ready code, creating lightweight proof-of-concept prototypes, collaborating with back-end engineering teams, and working with Drupal themes, with a focus on the current redesign of the client's primary website and front-end component library.

 

Responsibilities:
Build web applications with high-quality, responsive, accessibility-compliant code
Ensure cross-browser, cross-platform, and cross-device compatibility
Work closely with product management and design to understand stakeholder requirements and craft elegant, usable, and technically-sound solutions
Extend and implement our internal UI pattern library
Work closely with back-end engineers to ensure code quality and integration
Help to create code documentation to assist with ongoing support and maintenance of applications
Collaborate with vendors and other technical partners as needed

 

Skills & Experience:
Strong verbal and written communication abilities
At least 5-7 years of experience within software development
Expertise in modern HTML, CSS, and Javascript
Strong experience with component based UI development, writing semantic & accessible code
Experience writing highly structured JavaScript
Working knowledge of CSS preprocessors like LESS or SASS
Experience with cross-platform, cross browser, and cross-device development and testing
Demonstrated ability to write documentation for both developers and non-technical audiences
Solid understanding of responsive design principles
Experience using Git version control
Experience working in an agile development environment
Experience working with PatternLab
Familiar with atomic design methodology
Experience with React
Experience with Drupal and Drupal theming
Experience with design tools like Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite
Experience working with one or more modern Javascript frameworks such as Backbone, Ember, or Angular
A Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science or IT strongly preferred; graduates from a bootcamps or other certification programs will also be considered

 

 

For over two decades, Millennium Consulting has been a leader in professional staffing. Today, Millennium caters to a diversified portfolio of market-leading customers. Since its establishment, Millennium has relentlessly focused on unwavering integrity while perfecting the recruitment of subject matter experts for complex, mission critical projects. Our approach remains unchanged: Sweeping analysis of our clients’ staffing initiatives and organizational culture, combined with a personal approach to long-term relationship building to identify the most impactful talent.

Position: Sr. Front End Software Engineer


Location:Phoenix, AZ


Contract to Hire


 


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES


Utilizing technical expertise; Creates system requirements, performs design and analysis, and coding and unit testing of complex to highly complex system functionality and/or defect correction across multiple platforms. Identifies ideas to improve system performance and impact availability. Resolves complex technical design issues.

Provides functional and/or technical guidance in evaluating applications systems or evaluating requests for proposals. Coordinates changes and influences and prioritizes tasks with business or technical departments.

Analyzes and influences technical, system, and/or user requirements. Identifies and creates solutions to improve system performance and availability. Facilitates root cause analysis of system issues to minimize impact and future occurrences.

Creates system documentation/play book(s) and serves as a lead technical reviewer and contributor in requirements, design and code reviews. Typically serves as a resource to the business.

Develops accurate estimates on work packages and ensures the accuracy of estimates developed by less experienced internal and third party team members. Analyzes and designs specifications for less experienced internal and third party team members to execute. Acts as a technical resource throughout the development life cycle. May also actively contribute to the technical and soft skills development of team members.

Assists team leads and management with delegation of technical work packages to cross-functional and third party team members for execution through the full development life cycle. Keeps management appropriately informed of progress and issues.

Coordinates system application transition from development teams to maintenance and production teams, and/or constructs and implements necessary controls to assure system/application traceability.

 

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) majors or 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree.  

AND, 6+ years of software development experience with at least 2 years in CSS3 and HTML5, JavaScript and JavaScript libraries/tools such as JSON, AJAX, React, AngularJS, JQuery, and experience with CSS libraries/tools such as Bootstrap.

 

PREFERRED


3+ years of experience with a JavaScript framework like, React, Redux, Angular, or Backbone.

2+ years of experience working with Agile methodology

Proficiency in translating front-end mockups and wireframes into functioning applications

2+ years’ experience in designing/coding for high availability and performance.

Position Title: Front end Agile Project Manager

Location: Chicago, IL

Duration: 6 months contract

Start date: ASAP

LOCALS PREFERRED

 

Please send Resume in Word format along with Contact details, Visa status and Hourly Rate expectations to sonia@openmindtechno.com


 

Description:

This Agile PM will be responsible for supporting an $8M project that will deliver new front-end screens to an existing application that interfaces with external customers.
 

The Agile Project Manager (APM) is responsible for planning, leading, organizing, and motivating agile project teams to achieve a high level of performance and quality in delivering agile projects that provide exceptional business value to users. The APM may be responsible for managing several concurrent high visibility projects using agile methods in a fast-paced environment that may cross multiple business divisions. 

The APM may play a number of different roles in actual practice:

•At an enterprise level, leading and managing large, complex enterprise-level projects consisting of multiple Agile teams and/or requiring integration with other activities outside the scope of the Agile teams

• At a team level, playing a consultative role to help put in place the appropriate people, process, and tools and coaching members of the team as needed to optimize the efficiency of the project team

•In situations that require a hybrid Agile approach, using good judgment and skill to develop a project management approach that is suitable for planning and managing the effort to achieve the project goals within designated project constraints

In performing these roles, the APM will be expected to use a high level of knowledge and experience in blending traditional project management principles and practices with an Agile development approach in the right proportions to fit large, complex, mission-critical, enterprise-level projects and with the appropriate level of planning and provide the right balance of agility and predictability.

Essential Job Requirements:


•Project Planning and Management – Define project scope and schedule while focusing on regular and timely delivery of value; organize and lead project status and working meetings; prepare and distribute progress reports; manage risks and issues; correct deviations from plans; and perform delivery planning for assigned projects

•Team Management – Assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments, removing roadblocks to their work; leveraging organizational resources to improve capacity for project work; and mentoring and developing team members

•Product Owner Support – Support the Product Owner in managing customer expectations for project deliverables, managing stakeholder communications, and helping to implement an effective system of project governance

•Process Management and Improvement – Define and manage a well-defined project management process and champion ongoing process improvement initiatives to implement best practices for Agile Project Management

•Team building – promote empowerment of the team, ensure that each team member is fully engaged in the project and making a meaningful contribution, and encourage a sustainable pace with high-levels of quality for the team

Qualifications:


•Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment

•A proven track record of successfully implementing software or web development projects using Agile methodologies including 8+ years of experience as a Project Manager managing large, complex projects in a high-tech development environment with multi-function teams. PMP preferred

•Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent preferred

•Experience overseeing multi-function project teams with at least 10-15 team members including Developers, Business Analysts, and QA Personnel

•Balanced business/technical background:

oSufficient level of technical background to provide highly-credible leadership to development teams and to be able to accurately and objectively evaluate complex project risks and issues

oAbility to provide leadership to business analysts and collaborate with customers and develop strategies and solutions of high business value

Skills Required:


•BA or BS or equivalent experience is required; MA or MS is a plus

•Strong interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building

•Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands

•Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs with the ability to establish/maintain high level of customer trust and confidence

•Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives, goals, and commitments are met

•Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using appropriate tools:

o Agile Project Management tools such as Jira/Greenhopper, Rally, VersionOne or equivalent

o Microsoft Project, Visio, and all Office Tools

• Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level

•Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view

 

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Please send Resumes to sonia@openmindtechno.com for immediate response.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Are you interested in helping consumers backup and restore their data? Do you enjoy working remotely with the occasional travel? If so, we may have your next opportunity that is challenging yet rewarding!  

 

About this Role


Smart Solutions is in search of an efficient frontend Sr Java Software Engineer
 to join our client’s team in sunny California but will be able to work remotely. Our client specializes in cloud-based technology and backing up data and these roles will help support this initiative.

As a frontend Sr Software Engineer, you will work on server-side APIs that authenticate users at login, accept backups, manage data, and prepare restored data for customers. Additionally, you will help build new features and support tools to help diagnose customer issues.

This role is for an engineer with a strong skillset in Java and Apache Tomcat. It is ideal for someone who enjoys programming their own design in addition to the client’s designs and a self-starter who isn’t afraid to reach out to ask for help. Some training onsite is required at first but will move to remote work with the exception of working onsite 1 week per quarter.  

Our client offers a list of great benefits including competitive pay/401k/healthcare plans, unlimited vacation days, awesome people working on fun, exciting projects, and more!

 

What We're Looking For

Proficiency in Java and Apache Tomcat
Comfortable and experience with Linux, Unix, and Windows
Experience with very large-scale, complex systems supporting 1000s of servers and millions of customers and with a lot of legacy code
Additional nice-to-have experience includes Cassandra, JavaScript, ReactJS, Python, Struts, and JSPs
Relentless attention to detail and adheres to best practices
Able to take a customer POV and focus on resolving their issues
Ability to learn and adapt quickly to changing technologies and trends
Willingness to do what it takes to get the work done with a good attitude

 

Interested and ready for a new challenge? Please submit your resume and salary requirements to Exl_SMSolutions+Team+Resumes+Req-7472@mail1.cbizsoft.com or apply on our website at jobs.smart-solutions.com  

 

Why Smart Solutions?


Smart Solutions is an IT consulting firm local to Madison, WI. We have been helping great people find great jobs for over 20 years! If you're looking for a place to develop professionally, you can stop looking and start growing with Smart Solutions. What's important to you is what matters most to us. We work hard to help you fulfill your personal and professional needs and achieve your career goals.  

 

It's in Your Benefit


Through our Smart Plus Program, we help consultants develop their interpersonal and soft skills through consultant-created Smart Talks. In addition to an amazing company culture that is employee-oriented and dedicated to your growth both professionally and personally, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance, 401(k), Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Short and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, and much more!  

 

Hungry for more Smart knowledge?


Please visit our website at www.smart-solutions.com Smart Solutions, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer functioning under an Affirmative Action Plan. U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.  

 

Head for IT. Heart full of Ambition. Bring both to Smart Solutions.

Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Description:


The Trade Flow Analysis team is seeking a front end developer who has experience working on HTML5, Javascript and Angular technology. This group provides a suite of pricing, analytics and content tools for traders, sales people and external clients. The candidate will work on suite of applications that supports the Electronic Trading business. Specifically on trade/order visualization and analytics.

This specific position will work in our Trade monitoring and visualization projects. This team builds applications used to monitor Execution Quality and Anomalies in the trade flow. The tool offers real-time monitoring of orders in detail and in aggregate, alerting on the anomalies, ability to interact with trading components to action specific anomaly scenarios during the trading day. Currently the tool covers a fraction of the trade flow. There is an initiative to expand and scale the functionality to include all of the institutional flow. To this end, we are looking for a developer who has experience in HTML5, Angular/Javascript, Java, has experience in working with large scale realtime datasets, timeseries databases, preferably has exposure to FIX protocol.

 

Required Skills


-          Demonstrated experience working on HTML5, Javascript and Angular technology.

-          Working knowledge of UNIX/LINUX.

-          Demonstrates exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.

-          Strong communication, organizational, and collaboration skills.

-          Ability to multi-task and work well under pressure.

-          Experience working on large and medium scale projects in agile environment.

 

Desired Skills


-          FIX Protocol

-          Equities trading systems

DPP Tech was founded by a group of highly motivated technology professionals who set out to differentiate in the way we offer services to clients. Our goal is to deliver quantifiable results in a timely and affordable manner to clients in key industry verticals worldwide. We integrate expert industry knowledge, process and technology frameworks, strong partnerships, and a global workforce to provide strategic solutions that generate sustainable results. 
 
DPP Tech currently provides solutions services to large Silicon Valley companies including PayPal, Cisco, GAP, Equinix, etc. by participating at various levels from project management and system architecture to implementations.
We offer a variety of benefits including but not limited to Relocation expenses, paid Health insurance, 401K, Annual Leave, etc.

I am Rahul from Orion Systems Integrators Inc. 

Our Clients is looking to fill the below position that matches your skills and I wanted to check if you are available and interested in this opportunity. Details are as given below –
