Contract

Procedure to Apply
 You can call me on (732) 813-0309 Ext. 116__ or email me at rahul.v@orioninc.com.

Description:


The .NET Developer will provide architectural and “big-picture” oversight for development of new, and enhancement of existing, windows and custom applications. They will be responsible for ensuring quality and consistency of the software architecture, adherence and utilization of best practices across code, and ensure continual integration of new features and functionality to support internal and external client needs. They will also act as a mentor, providing day-to-day technical guidance to the development team and be assisting with collective skill development.

Role and Responsibilities: 

Develop, maintain, and/or enhance a suite of custom windows application as the needs of the internal business and our clients expand and evolve.
Identify potential software architecture capability gaps, architectural risks, assumptions, and approaches, outline interdependencies, determine optimization opportunities, and ensure scalability and flexibility.
Create documented system architectures and assists in detail designs, class diagrams, use cases and coding specifications. Creates overview system documentation for developed applications.
Lead/mentor developers and share knowledge through knowledge-sharing presentations and code review sessions.
Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player and exhibit exceptional relationship management skills (both written and verbal)
Additional responsibilities may be assigned as needed based on the needs of the business and clients.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

At least 8 years of experience with object-oriented design and development, with a focus on C# (.NET 4.5) language
Strong problem-solving abilities, and an ability to understand and adapt to new concepts and technologies quickly
Ability to design and (re)evaluate architecture of an application and its functionality, as well as integrate new development into existing architecture
Understanding of Software Development Lifecycle using Agile or iterative development and experience participating in each phase of the lifecycle.
Should be an evangelist for design best practices, technical documentation, and creation of workflows/diagrams to be used as a reference.
Experience designing and implementing integration points for 3rd party systems and data points into custom internal applications
Proven track record of multi-tasking business development, people management skills, and desire for mentoring and nurturing in-house developers
Ability to evaluate overall architecture of an application, looking for structural quality, best practices, code quality, reusability and scalability, and – where applicable – use of open standards
Ability to work independently as a self-starter, and within a team environment.
Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment with changing business rules and objectives
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including providing multiple solutions to singular issues and pros/cons for each approach.
Experience with DevExpress custom controls (or similar), and AS/400 systems is desirable

Technology Background:

C# (.NET 4.5 and above)
Windows Forms and Web Development
Understanding of PCI DSS v3.2 compliance requirements for Application Development
Visual Studio 2017, MS SQL 2014
TFS 2017 for Agile software development practices and code management
Strong proficiency with SQL query creation and optimization, indexes, programmability, and table relationships for complex data structures
Web service development and utilization (WCF, WebAPI preferred)

Best Regards
,

Rahul Valmiki

3759 US 1 South, Monmouth Junction, NJ 08852

Phone: +1-732-813-0309 Ext. 116

As a privately held company, Princeton Information is solely committed to the success of clients and consultants - not to any shareholders. Princeton is committed to going above and beyond to ensure that each meeting you have with a client is a successful one!

Frontend.jobDescription:
PolySign Senior Front End Engineer


As a Senior Frontend Engineer at PolySign you will help design and build the mobile app and and web site application that will provide the gateway for the PolySign cryptocurrency platform using React Native and React.  You will assist in designing the user experience, as well as implementing and connecting to our back end services. 

In this position you will work on a small team with other top talent with a significant impact on design, architecture and direction.  You will interface with and work directly with the back end and cloud services teams as well as Product Management to help launch our platform.
What you’ll do:Design and build the PolySign front ends, including mobile and web applications, working in conjunction with back end teams to produce a world-class fintech service
Create intuitive, simple and effective designs via wireframe and mockup tools, working directly with Product Management, and then follow through with implementation.
Build quality in, delivering significant unit, integration and system tests along with your code
Write developer documentation, reference implementations, wireframes/mock-ups and other educational content as needed
As a secondary objective, assist the other teams directly with code review, design and implementation as needed
What we are looking for:
We’re looking for passionate, professional software engineers who enjoy doing things the right way.  The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Javascript, React Native and React, as well as user experience design, code security, quality and sustainability.  Experience with Python and microservices will be useful to provide the depth we are looking for in this position.  As a software professional, you understand the importance of coding clean, estimating, taking deadlines seriously, and interfacing well with other team members and teams.
Required Skills:At least 3 years experience building enterprise grade mobile and web applications
Deep knowledge of Javascript and both React Native and React
Extensive experience with:
User eXperience design
Unit and system testing
Software security concepts and best practices
Track record of creating intuitive, effective and simple front end designs and implementations for both mobile and web
Track record of writing high quality, sustainable, testable code using best software development practices
Strong sense of software craftsmanship, professionalism and responsibility
Understanding of Agile estimating and planning methods, and a record of estimating and delivering to schedule
BS in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience
Bonus Skills:  Knowledge of Python and Python libraries
Experience with
Object oriented concepts and design patterns
Microservice architectures
SQL and NoSQL
Experience with electronic financial exchanges and markets
Experience with cryptography, particularly digital currency
Key Technologies:Front End: Javascript, React and React Native
Backend: Python, Node, postgresql, websockets, ZeroMQ, Docker
OS: Linux
What we offer:The opportunity to join a well funded, cutting edge financial technology company at a very early stage
Competitive salary and equity
Competitive medical benefits
Generous 401K matching plan
Flexible working policies: work with your manager to determine the best combination of work at office/work from home arrangements
A software culture that values quality, sustainability and craftsmanship over time to market
Smart co-workers who are world class experts in the field of crypto-currency
A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact
Who we are:
PolySign Inc. is a stealth mode startup in the San Francisco Bay Area working in the area of institutional custody for cryptocurrencies.  Our solution will be a key component to the mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies.  Cryptocurrencies are an exciting emerging market with considerable opportunities for success.  As member of a small, world class technical team, you can can have a huge impact on our solution and the success of cryptocurrencies.

PolySign, Inc. is co-founded by Arthur Britto, a co-founder of Ripple. In just five years, Ripple is a recognized leader in payments technology and has been recently recognized by CNBC as the 5th most valuable startup in the United States. Fortune.com has reported Ripple as one of the five hottest fintech companies in the world.  For more information on Ripple, see the Ripple Press Center.

Frontend.jobTitle: Front End Senior Developer - Java/AngularJS/JavaScript (Federal Technology Consulting) - Secret
Frontend.jobskills: Agile, AngularJS, Architecture, Consulting, Developer, Development, Excel, GIT, HTML, HTTP, IBM, J2EE, Java, JavaScript, Linux, Management, Project, Recruiter, Research, Scripts, Scrum, SDLC, Security, Source Code, Supervision, TDD, Testing, Version Control
Frontend.jobDescription:
Do you enjoy cutting edge technology and solving difficult problems? Are you interested in working across a variety of areas from requirements to architecture, testing, deployment and beyond? If so, Deloitte could be the place for you! Harnessing the power of emerging technologies requires you to overcome complex systems integration challenges, both within your own organization’s walls, and with your external partners, suppliers, and clients. Join our Systems Integration team and bring focus to the toughest problems in the Federal community through the design, development, and implementation of software solutions. A career at Deloitte will put you on the frontline, supporting Federal agencies tasked with the most critical technical challenges.  
 

Work you’ll do

 

As a Senior Consultant in our practice you will:

Provide Technology Solution Development and Integration across the SDLC including requirements, functional specs, design, custom development, integration, testing, and deployment 
Perform project tasks independently, and may direct the efforts of others  
Participate in or lead the development of client deliverable content  
Anticipate client needs and formulate solutions to client issues 
Review deliverables for accuracy and quality 
Provide coaching to junior staff   
Contribute to new business and proposal development  
Manage own personal and professional development, seeking opportunities for expansion of consulting skills and experiences 

The team

 

Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping Federal government initiatives today. Deloitte’s Federal practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change.  Carrying out missions in the Federal practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients.  Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the Federal marketplace.

Our Federal SI team manages the complexity inherent with technology change, from requirements planning to architecture, testing to deployment, and beyond. We also offer a complete range of industry-leading services, including systems development, solution and platform integration, and program management, functional, and testing services.

 

Qualifications

 

Required:

Bachelor's degree and at least 3 years of technology consulting or other relevant industry experience 
Experience working independently with minimal supervision and guidance 
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment 
Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives 
Demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience 
Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools Strong understanding of SDLC methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, RUP, other) 
Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives 
Experience in implementing large-scale custom development and/or systems integration projects in one or more phases of the SDLC 
Experience working with business users to gather requirements, writing functional and technical specifications and communicating technical requirements 
Must be able to obtain and maintain required clearance for this role 
Proficiency with JavaScript and HTML5 
Experience with Java and AngularJS 
Deep knowledge of and work experience with AngularJS practices and common modules 
Creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components 
Lead junior team members 
Works well in a team and is flexible in a fast paced environment 
Writing and executing unit tests  
Creating configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments 
Experience with GIT 
Knowledge of web application security  
Experience working with git for version control 
Experience working in a Linux environment 

 

Preferred:

Degree in computer science, information systems, or other technology-related field 
Ability to translate requirements into design specifications and experience in developing design documents  
Software development experience using object-oriented languages (i.e., Java, C#, C++) and frameworks (i.e. J2EE or .NET) 
Knowledgeable in software quality concepts such documenting source code and software language specific code quality practices  
Understanding of software development team management support tools such as IBM Jazz, HP ALM, JIRA and Collabnet  
Knowledgeable in concepts of Continuous Integration  
Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD)  
Secret clearance 

 

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.  From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.   Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.  
 

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.  Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.  
 

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.   Learn more about Life at Deloitte.  
 

Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.   Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.  
 

Recruiter tips

We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to.   Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

#IND:PTY 
#CB 
Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  


At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard.

Frontend.jobTitle: Senior Front End Engineer - AI startup - New York
Frontend.jobskills: Senior Front End Engineer - AI startup - New York
Frontend.jobDescription:
Our client is rapidly becoming one of the pre-eminent Artificial Intelligence start-ups in the entire country. Based in Manhattan and led by one of the foremost experts in AI technology, they are actively looking to expand their small yet talented team of software engineers.


This is the perfect opportunity for someone looking to make a career change and land in a spot where you will not only enjoy showing up to work every day, but where you will get the chance to work with cutting edge technologies and truly make an impact in the AI/Machine Learning space.

Having raised a significant Series B through a number of leading investors, our client is currently looking to bring on a Senior Front End Engineer with a desire to work at the forefront of AI innovation.

The ideal candidate will have:

B.S in Computer Science or related field

5+ years' experience working as a Front End Engineer

Proficiency in JavaScript and it's modern frameworks, particularly React/Redux, Babel, and Webpack

Demonstrate the ability and desire to pick up new languages and frameworks with relative ease

Desire to enter into a small, growing team and assist in mentoring team members




Compensation for this role will go to about $190,000 base salary. This client offers a tremendous benefits package to all employees, including, but not limited to: health care, unlimited vacation days, flexi-time and the ability to work from home when needed, and free catered lunches.

For a more detailed discussion in confidence please contact Sean Karch at +1 646 766 1205, or email

Frontend.jobTitle: Front End React Engineer - FinTech - New York

Frontend.jobDescription:
Our client is a rapidly growing fintech startup looking to drive innovation in banking technology. They are the first customer-centric system built in the cloud that gives banks and credit unions the flexibility to innovate using modern technology while being able to still own their brand.

They are looking for a front end engineer who has worked with react and is able to write intricate front end SPA's and also has the ability to jump into a full stack role when necessary. They are looking for someone with CSS/Sass experience and knowledge of git/github. Also someone has has worked in an agile/scrum environment.

They offer competitive pay and sizeable equity.

For more information, contact Ariana Harrison at 646-766-1217.

They are looking to hire an experienced front end engineer who is passionate about building financial technologies. This role works with design, product, and development to create a web-based application. It builds front end tools and visualizations for data driven insights.

Frontend.jobTitle: Front End Engineer - Hedgefund - New York City
Frontend.jobskills: Front End Engineer - Hedgefund - New York City
Frontend.jobDescription:
Interested in joining one of the most technologically advanced, science-driven companies in the world? One of our most forward thinking clients has created a new group, charged with automating an industry that's failed to keep pace with technology. They will be building products from the ground up using their technology.

This new team does not currently have any Front End/ JavaScript focused engineers - this is an opportunity to be the first through the door and be someone who sets technical direction, creates road maps and making architectural decisions. The impact you can have on this enormous project could be vast.

Aside from being an expert in working with both core JavaScript as well as one of its frameworks (React.js, Angular.js, Ember.js, etc.), the ideal candidate will meet the following criteria:

B.S. in Computer Science or a related field

+5 years professional experience as a software engineer

Ability to work with product owners to analyze requirements and translate them into technical solutions

Experience with AWS and/or GCP and developing Cloud solutions

Experience with agile development practices



Compensation for this role will go to $200,000 base salary, with bonuses guaranteed, as well as 100% health coverage and a fully funded 401k. In addition their office is littered with board games, computing history, 3D printers, hacker rooms, gyms (yes, plural) and areas dedicated to L&D - there is a class on a new topic every day employees can attend for free. Also, they do your laundry.

Frontend.jobTitle: Front End React Engineer - Hedge Fund - New York

The role requires experience with javascript, React.js or Angular.js and a computer science degree or related field. Experience with Java, Python or Amazon Web Services are a plus.


For more information, contact Ariana Harrison at 646-766-1217.

Frontend.jobDescription:
The Creative Group  is looking for a freelance UX Designer with coding experience for our client in Buckhead. This opportunity would start ASAP! You would be helping to develop and implement world class software solutions that help CIO's and CTO's optimize their IT investments, improve operational performance, and mitigate project risk. Teaming with other professionals in the Software Services practice, the UX Designer Front-End Developer's responsibility is to prototype, design, code and unit test custom applications. 

The UX Designer Front-End Developer will participate in the overall development lifecycle including the analysis, design, testing, and implementation of custom client software solutions, and help align business requirements with software functions and features. 

Skills Required 

 Experienced at creating and revising information architecture documents and diagrams including but not limited to: content diagrams, content maps, wire frame diagrams, comprehensive diagrams and static prototypes.  

 Fluent in responsive design, mobile/tablet UX/UI 

 Interest in constantly keeping up-to-date of latest trends, best practices and competitive activity 

 Proven experience showing clear understanding of the intersection between user needs, technology requirements, and business goals 

 Artistic eye for design and the ability to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail 

 Proven experience understanding of the latest design and technology trends and their role in a commercial environment 

 Expert level knowledge of HTML 5, SASS, JavaScript and "responsive" UI 

 Experience with Front-End SharePoint development through SharePoint Designer 

 Experience testing UI across multiple device and screen layouts  

 Experience with Gulp build processes

Frontend.jobTitle: Sr. Front End Engineer (web / UI / Full Stack Developer)
Frontend.jobskills: Front End Development JavaScript Libraries / Frameworks ReactJS, Redux, Angular.js, Angular 2+, Vue.js, Aurelia, MobX, Ember.js, Meteor.js, jQuery Backbone UI Full Stack
Frontend.jobDescription:
Please note I have direct access to the Hiring Director of Engineering on this position.

A brand-new data and cloud based SaaS company fresh out of stealth mode is looking for a Sr. Front End Engineer and 2 Mid-Level Front End Engineers. The company has been in business for 5+ years, is global, has 300+ employees, is experiencing 200+% annual revenue growth year after year and recently completed its Series D round of funding at $100 million for total funding of $230 million. The company’s current products have been industry tested and benchmarked at performance levels significantly higher than all of their competitors. The company has been voted as one of the Bay Area Best Places to Work in 2015, 2016, and 2017.

The Sr. Front-End Engineer and 2 Mid-Level Front End Engineers will work within an Agile environment with short sprints and will be responsible for new development of robust high-volume complex high-performance customer facing products and systems by implementing the latest bleeding edge technologies available including JavaScript Frameworks and Libraries. Sr. Front End UI Engineer and 2 Mid-Level Front End Engineers will be responsible for ground up new development for complex products built for the cloud (vs basic UI web development). In this position, the Sr. Front End Engineers will be responsible for managing and handling large volumes of highly interactive data. The Sr. Front End Engineers will work alongside and with extremely intelligent and bright Java Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers and UI Designers and Architects in the full life cycle development process of the User Interface/Front End. The Sr. Front End Engineers will be responsible for reviewing prototypes from wireframes and mockups and work alongside Product Managers and UX Architects and Designers to develop the customer user experience of brand new products that are utilized by customer Data Scientists and Sr. Data Engineers. The Sr. Front End Engineers will be responsible for full life cycle front end development utilizing JavaScript, and JavaScript Frameworks (ReactJS, Angular.js, Angular 2+, Vue.js, Aurelia, MobX, Ember.js, Meteor.js and/or Backbone) and JavaScript Libraries (Redux, RxJS, jQuery/jQuery UI, etc.), CSS 2/3 and HTML 4/5 for presentation layer and User Interface.

The Sr. Front End Engineers report directly to the Director of Engineering

The company offers full benefits (PPO & HMO) including dental and vision, matching 401K, 3 weeks of vacation, 8 paid sick/personal days, flexible time off, gym membership subsidization, Short and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Wellness Programs, extremely casual dress and flexible work hours that all start upon employment.

This is an outstanding opportunity for a Sr. Front-End Engineer to build and/or enhance their experience building new bleeding edge systems from the ground up. This is all brand-new development. The Front-End Engineer will advance their skill set in an environment which promotes sharing, collaboration, growth, and professionalism. The Hiring Director of Engineering, VP of Engineering and the company have an established reputation for allowing Engineers to progress their careers at aggressive paces and to be exposed to new, complex and bleeding edge technologies.

 

REQUIREMENTS:

MUST HAVE 1-5+ most recent years’ experience focusing on Front End UI Development

MUST be at the expert level with JavaScript Frameworks (ReactJS, Angular.js, Angular 2+, Vue.js, Aurelia, MobX, Ember.js, Meteor.js and/or Backbone)

OR

JavaScript Libraries (Redux, RxJS, jQuery/jQuery UI)

MUST have experience developing the Front end for large complex high-volume customer facing products, software, sites and/or systems

Expert with HTML 4/5 and CSS 2/3

MUST be able to employ front end optimization techniques to resolve performance and rendering issues

 

Experience with any of the following are only a Plus (NOT
 mandatory):

 

ES6 or EMCAScript or ES2015

CSS precompilers such as SASS, Stylus and LESS

Front end optimization techniques to resolve performance and rendering issues (HTTP Profiling, PageSpeed, bundling, code minification, etc.)

Experience with general UI template libraries (Handlebars, Mustache, etc.) a plus

Experience working within an Agile, TDD, BDD or similar development environment

Experience working within a Continuous Integration (Jenkins, Bamboo, TeamCity, Maven, etc.) environment

A/B Testing

Experience with build automation or Source Control tools: GIT, SVN, etc.

Experience with issue tracking/project management applications (such as Jira, Daptiv, FogBugz, etc.) BS and/or MS in CS, Engineering, Math, Physics or equivalent is a plus

Frontend.jobskills: HTML5, CSS3, SASS, web development
Frontend.jobDescription:
We are searching for a Senior Front End Web developer/designer to join our client's Digital Team in its Marketing and Communications Group.


 You will participate in a wide variety of projects for clients and corporate users.

 LOCATION

 Saginaw, MI
 
 This role is not available as a remote/telecommute opportunity.

 COMPENSATION

 $70K to $80K, potentially higher for a candidate that is an exceptional fit
 
 Please note: In some cases, our client elects to engage candidates in a contract-to-hire model. If this applies to you, you would be an employee of Stout Systems for approximately 6 months and then convert to employment with our customer.

 REQUIRED

Minimum 5 years' on-the-job experience. Please note that candidates must possess strong skills in both UI/UX design and front end web development.
Proven experience in HTML5, CSS3, SASS
Strong design skills, demonstrated in a portfolio of Web design work.
Must have a good grasp of responsive design, bootstrap, working with CMS's, mock-ups, wireframing, etc.
Intermediate knowledge of compatibility and cross-browser issues.
Knowledge of email design, code and test.
Must have experience working with Fortune 500 companies.
Must be a positive self-starter and possess a strong work ethic, an ability to meet/exceed deadlines, and have excellent interpersonal skills and strong attention to detail.

PREFERRED

Associate's or bachelor's degree in related technical field.
Experience with JavaScript and JQuery.
Ongoing fluency in best practices for web-based, app and mobile information architecture and responsive design, as well as deep and broad knowledge of usability principles and techniques.
Knowledge of graphic design standards, and techniques for web and mobile development
Knowledge of accessibility standards for web applications.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Implement innovative, cohesive and intuitive front-end user interfaces on multiple platforms for digital applications.
Implement design requests and provide on-going site maintenance.
Turn wireframes and mockups into HTML/CSS/JavaScript using clean code.
Resolve known UI-related bugs/issues with the software.
Produce a wide variety of deliverables, including ongoing site support tasks (site page updates, banner ads, landing page design).
Modify and create front-end HTML code to support these deliverables in CMS and similar environments.
Ensure consistency with standards and guidelines - including brand compliance.

Please send resumes to recruit@stoutsystems.com.
 

 Note: Even if you decide not to apply for this position, please recommend this job to a qualified colleague!
 

 See more openings at www.stoutsystems.com/openings. 

 


More jobs: www.stoutsystems.com. Please respond by E-MAIL ONLY. Only responses from individuals will be considered. No corp-to-corp solicitations considered.

Frontend.jobskills: js, javascript, adobe creative suite, sketch, invision, git, agile html, css, tdd
Frontend.jobDescription:
Position Overview:


Asynchrony Labs, a subsidiary of World Wide Technology, Inc. has an opportunity for a Front-End Engineer / UX Developer.  Asynchrony Labs Front-End Engineers (FEE) create engaging user experiences by designing, developing, and supporting web application projects. FEEs will collaborate with clients and team members to define, estimate, create, and deliver the entire visual layer that conform to brand and industry standards.

Candidate must have experience with traditional user experience (UX) principles and processes such as task flow analysis, wire framing, prototyping, and usability analysis. All project teams utilize agile project methodologies such as pair programming and test-driven development (TDD) and candidates must be able to flourish in a highly collaborative environment.

Candidate will be a member of the Asynchrony Labs UX team and contribute to the growth and improvement of the entire team through mentoring, peer review, and creative collaboration. Along with client projects, the UX team also provides design support for marketing, business development, and corporate communications for Asynchrony Labs and parent companies.

 The following knowledge skills and attributes are required:

Strong written and presentation skills, comfortable working directly with clients
Very strong knowledge of web UI execution (HTML/CSS/JS)
Adobe Creative Suite, or similar (Sketch, Invision)
Hands-on knowledge of file version control systems such as GIT
In-depth knowledge of responsive design practices, including cross-browser and device compatibility issues and limitations
A strong portfolio displaying examples of web execution
5+ years’ experience supporting web projects
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in either Graphic Design or CS/IT curriculum

 The following knowledge skills and attributes are preferred:

General understanding of Agile Development processes
High attention to detail, pixel-perfect execution, and able to solve visual design challenges

World Wide Technology, Inc. offers excellent benefits and competitive compensation. Visit our company web page at www.wwt.com for more information.


Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled


Work Site Location:

2300 15th Street - Denver, CO 80202

Frontend.jobskills: HTML5, REACT, CSS3, UI/UX, Selenium, Angular, AJAX, JQuery, Groovy, Grails - HTML5, REACT, CSS3, UI/UX, Selenium, Angular, AJAX, JQuery, Groovy, Grails
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
HTML5, REACT, CSS3, UI/UX, Selenium, Angular, AJAX, JQuery, Groovy, Grails

If you are a skilled Frontend Engineer/Architect that is an expert in JavaScript + HTML5 + CSS3 + React/Angular and is looking for an interesting/comprehensive project to dive into, please read on!!!

**THIS ROLE IS 100% REMOTE, WORK FROM HOME**

Located in beautiful Redwood City CA, we are a well-funded enterprise orchestration and scheduling platform.  Our product helps companies improve the capacity of their operations teams, get rid of bottlenecks, and scale faster.

This is a full-time role, and the particular project is to develop a client facing app that showcases/highlights our platforms functionality, layout, and widgets/plugins.  Imagine building a SquareSpace or Wordpress style app that allows our current and potential clients to easily explore how our products/services could be applied to their needs.  

Our ideal candidate will be able to visualize the totality of the project and take ownership of what needs to be done.  You will not be working in a vacuum as the team will provide input/direction, but we are looking for someone that can complete the project from start to finish without the use of additional resources/team members.  We're looking for a superstar that can do this.  

Sound like you?

What You Will Be Doing

- Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
- Build reusable code and libraries for future use
- Multi-iteration product releases
- Setup  framework and methodology for the UI testing (eg, Spock, Selenium)

What You Need for this Position

- 3+ Years Working Experience 
- BSCS degree 
- JavaScript/HTML5/CSS3/React/Angular 
- Familiar with API layer/interfaces such as REST
- Experience setting up a UI test framework for functional testing and browser compatibility using tools like Robot, Selenium
- Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them

Nice to Have:
- Consumer UI/UX experience 
- Grails
- General Groovy knowledge is a plus; Java experience also a plusSo, if you are a strong Frontend Engineer/Architect looking to work REMOTELY, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

Frontend.jobTitle: Front End Engineer - Tech Co Disrupting the Healthcare Industry!
Frontend.jobskills: HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Django, Angular.js, C/C++ - HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Django, Angular.js, C/C++
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Django, Angular.js, C/C++

If you are a Front End Engineer with over 5 years experience, please read on!

Want to use your engineering chops to help others? 
Join our engineering team and touch over a million patient lives a year! 

Have you ever found yourself or a loved one waiting hours in a hospital Emergency Room to get care? Do you wish your physicians were more accessible and easier to make appointments with? We are looking for a front end engineer who can help redefine the healthcare systems. 

We use a hospital's data along with proprietary external data signals to help managers proactively manage day-to-day operations. Our algorithms analyze hospital data along important operational and clinical metrics, allowing hospital staff to both monitor operational performance and automatically diagnose operational issues in real time. In addition, our machine-learning based forecasting techniques enable hospitals to predict patient volumes and optimally allocate resources – such as staff, beds, and rooms – to meet this demand. These insights are delivered to staff in the workflows with which they are already accustomed.

What You Will Be Doing

- The role will be split between active front-end features development along with DevOps responsibilities. 
- Implement the core front-end features and UI of AnalyticsMD front-end system 
- Experience building Front-end visualization products that delivers core Analytics Visualizations, Reporting, Dashboards 
- Manage the deploy, monitor and troubleshoot live services on AWS environments 
- Work closely with the backend team to understand the APIs which will be used

What You Need for this Position

- Full-stack software development experience with a distinguished track record on delivering technically demanding projects 
- Architect efficient and reusable front-end modules that drive module design development
- Prior experience with front end visualization stacks such as Django, backbone.js, Coffeescript/Javascript, d3.js, Angular.js, JQuery, HTML5 and CSS3 
- 5+ years of professional experience working with modern programming languages such as Java, C/C++, Python and SQL 
- Ability to quickly learn new technologies and work effectively in a fast paced dynamic environment 
BS, or MS in Computer Science or equivalent

What's In It for You

- Competitive salary of $90K-$150K
- Equity 
- Full health, dental, vision benefits
-  A chance to make a different in the health care industry as we know itSo, if you are a Front End Engineer with over 5 years experience, please read on!

Job Description:


Senior Front-end Engineer
  will work closely with product, design, UI / UX, support and back-end development teams to build and improve all aspects of our user facing experience.

The ideal candidate for this role is passionate not only about front-end web development technologies and but also about building and maintaining a highly usable, visually appealing and intuitive user interface for our clients.

Responsibilities:

Create new and maintain/refactor existing client-facing interfaces using modern development practices.
Collaborate iteratively with product and UI/UX teams to translate business requirements into projects with established requirements and scope that have an achievable and sustainable schedule for development. 
Architect and implement new or bring in existing third party reusable UI components, libraries and patterns as appropriate.

 Team Responsibilities:

Make technological recommendations while weighing various tradeoffs.
Participate in code reviews to lead team to the highest standards.
Effectively communicate with customer support to resolve production issues.
Deliver products on time in an agile and continuous development environment.
Work to establish front-end best practices and share these guidelines across all other development teams through documentation, style guides, exemplary code and build tooling.

Experience delivering product features in a Consumer or Enterprise SaaS company.

Experience with modern JavaScript libraries, frameworks and tooling such as Vue.js, AngularJS, React, Ember, Node.js, webpack.

.
Experience with CSS preprocessors such as LESS or SCSS.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Care deeply about accessibility or have implemented WCAG compliant code.
Full-stack development experience, especially with Ruby on Rails.

Without our suite of software applications, hospitals can't be 100% sure they have everything they need for a surgical procedure – until the surgery starts. We design our software to help hospitals deliver safer patient care and work more efficiently with medical device companies. By providing actionable information to the end user, we predict and prevent issues before they ever impact the patient. 

 

The Role:         

We're looking for a senior front end developer who is passionate about user experience and building elegant solutions to tough engineering problems. You will be an integral member of our Agile development team and report directly to the Director of Product. We're a highly collaborative environment, but our team is also self-motivated and works independently. We strongly believe that great products aren't be created in isolation. Our dev team interacts with our healthcare customers to understand their needs and ultimately deliver the best user experience possible. The position is almost entirely remote - we have our daily stand up via Slack and you'll be asked to come in a handful of times a month.

 

The Opportunity: 

We're growing like crazy and we're just getting started. Our team is extremely motivated but also a lot of fun, and most importantly, we're passionate about solving healthcare's messiest problems with new technologies. The role is Chicago based with the option to work from home. Competitive salary, annual bonus, healthcare benefits, annual conference/training budget and opportunity for LTI. 

 

About You: 

High level of motivation, initiative and sense of urgency 

Passionate about learning new technologies 

Comfortable taking ownership of your work with minimal oversight 

Experience leading a frontend development team 

Experience and understanding of Microservices 

Ability to dive into multiple technologies at a time 

Experienced in Test Driven Development 

Has worked in a HIPAA compliant environment (preferred) 

 

Requirements: 

Bachelor's Degree – engineering or computer science focus (preferred) 

5+ years development experience 

Focus on building modular, reusable code and UI elements 

Knowledge of AngularJS, React, Ember, Backbone and/or other modern JavaScript frameworks and experience building applications with vanilla JavaScript 

Understanding and experience working with SASS or LESS and familiarity with SMACSS or BEM methodologies 

Experience working with Gulp, Grunt or similar task runners 

Experience working with Jasmine, Karma, Protractor or other JavaScript testing tools and frameworks 

Experience with consuming REST APIs and third-party integrations 

Knowledge of JavaScript Hybrid development

Frontend.jobTitle: Senior Front End Developer - Remote in Seattle area!
Frontend.jobskills: C#, JavaScript, Microsoft Azure, CSS, HTML, ASP.NET, MVC, Bootstrap, Graphic - C#, JavaScript, Microsoft Azure, CSS, HTML, ASP.NET, MVC, Bootstrap, Graphic
Frontend.jobDescription:
Minimum Required Skills:
C#, JavaScript, Microsoft Azure, CSS, HTML, ASP.NET, MVC, Bootstrap, Graphic

If you are a Senior Front End Developer with experience, please read on!

What You Will Be Doing

-Develop new products and enhance existing products utilizing the Microsoft technology stack: C#, ASP.NET, MVC, Entity Framework, Dapper, and SQL Server 2014/2016.
-Fully versed in Test Driven Development (TDD)
-Participate in code / design review processes.
-Desire to have full ownership of the entire SDLC from conception through build and deployment, to ongoing production operational support (all team members are expected to take an on-call shift to support our systems 24/7.)
-Deep knowledge of HTML/CSS is a must
-Develop rich, interactive web front-ends by utilizing frameworks like Bootstrap, jQuery, TypeScript, and Kendo UI.
-Globalization of products in support of our large overseas client base
-Build and own key pieces of our proprietary platform
-Build and maintain customer facing RESTful APIs.
-Lead and mentor developers and knowledge share
-Work with product owners and business team to understand requirements and resolve issues.
-Respond to production issues or problems with our existing products.
-Participate in a small, experienced, energetic team on a rapid, agile development schedule.

What You Need for this Position

-Solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) and computer science foundations, such as memory management, big-o notation, and algorithm optimization.
-Deep knowledge of the .NET Framework, Azure Web Frameworks, Visual Studio, C#, ASP.NET, MVC.
-Knowledge of processes and concepts like Git, DevOps, Continuous Deployment, and Continuous Integration is a major plus.
-Expertise in writing clean, organized JavaScript while utilizing related frameworks like jQuery and Angular.
-Strong knowledge of software design patterns, such as MVC, Factory, Singleton, etc. and experience applying them in n-tier architectures.
-Experience building mobile applications (personal just for fun experience counts) is a major plus.
-Experience in unit-testing and continuous integration.
-Strong knowledge of software implementation best practices.


Qualifications:
-BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent
-7+ years of experience as a developer using .NET and SQL Server is preferred (lead developer is a plus)
-Experience designing/building native Cloud applications (e.g. AWS, Azure)
-Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player and exhibit exceptional time management skills.So, if you are a Senior UX/UI Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Frontend.jobskills: Agile, Ajax, AngularJS, Browser, CSS, Developer, Development, GIT, JavaScript, jQuery, Libraries, Management, Mobile Development, Mobile Application Development, OOP, Project, Scrum, UX, Version Control, XML
Frontend.jobDescription:
Job Summary:  


Currently seeking a Senior Front End Developer to join our Application Development team. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX designs and wireframes to actual code that will produce the visual elements of our websites and applications. You will work with the UI/UX designers, and the rest of the development team, to bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation. 

NOTE:  Its 65% Development and  35% Design.  MUST have  Angular  

Responsibilities: 


Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders to ensure the technical feasibility on UI/UX designs and translate them into technical requirements or user stories 

Participate in the creation of interactive prototypes and annotations for new features or projects 
Design, develop, test, review, deploy, and support desktop, custom web, and mobile applications. 
Employ best practices for designing reusable code and libraries relating to UI features 
Optimize UI features for maximum speed and scalability 
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back end 
Develop and maintain UI features to be integrated into the Sitecore platform 
Partner with app dev management and PMO to provide technical guidance on project scope, timelines, milestones and deliverables.  


  Position Requirements: 
  Bachelor' s degree (preferably in computer science) 
5+ years of post-higher education relevant work experience in web and mobile development 
Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript 
Knowledge of and demonstrated work experience utilizing JS frameworks such as AngularJS and jQuery, as well as common CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap 
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them 
Good understanding of CSS pre-processing platforms such as LESS or SASS 
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX 
Good understanding of SEO principals and ensuring that applications adhere to them 
Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. 
Basic knowledge of NodeJS and Grunt and/or Gulp 
Basic understanding of OOP JavaScript patterns and techniques 
Experience using Git for version control 
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. 
Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment using Agile/SCRUM methodology 
Excellent communication skills 
Design experience is a big plus!  

Required Skills: 
  HTML5 
CSS3 
LESS and SASS 
AngularJS 
jQuery 
Git 
XML 
Javascript 
jQuery 
AJAX 
JSON 
Responsive web site design 
Bootstrap 
Photoshop or Sketch 


  Experience with the following is a plus: 
  SiteCore platform 
C# or .NET page creation 
VisualStudio 
VSTS or Jira for project tracking 
Mobile Application development

Frontend.jobDescription:
Candidate will have ideally 7 - 10 years of experience.

 Develops, enhances, tests, supports, maintains and debugs software applications that support business units or support functions.

 A senior member of the technical team responsible for assisting senior business leaders and management.

 May provide strategic technical direction and system architecture for individual initiatives.

 Utilizes in-depth knowledge of technological alternatives and business system requirements to recommend innovations that enhance and/or provide a competitive advantage to the organization.

 Leads or has responsibility for estimation of effort for software application for one or more programmers.

 Coordinates collaboration with external programming teams to deliver software on time and within budget. Provides feedback and technical guidance to project managers on issues of critical importance to achieving business objectives. Is clearly recognized as a content expert by peers




Position summary and key responsibilities



This role is for passionate, multi-talented IT professionals with technology, design and business backgrounds, as well as a great propensity for creative problem solving. In this role one will be responsible for leading & creating interactive Web UI front-end with high fidelity to production front end code from a combination of wireframes, visual designs and design standards.



Certain projects may also require creation of visual designs and wireframes directly from business concepts in accordance with user experience standards and guidelines. The candidate will also need to guide the creation of design standards to ensure that they are technically feasible and will work in the production environment; this requires close partnership with production application development and architecture teams to fully understand server-side constraints as well.



Meticulous attention to detail and a proper sense of urgency are essential to success in this role. Frontend Demos will be regularly reviewed at senior levels in the business organization and prompt turnaround of deliverables is crucial to the success of the initiative. A portfolio review may be required as part of the interviewing process.



Primary Responsibilities include:
* Develop innovative and engaging responsive/adaptive UIs with the latest technologies

* Building multiple designs/layouts for UI concepts and translate these designs in a HTML template, adhering to web standards.

* Visualize concepts quickly and cleanly through rapid prototyping methods.

* Build optimized, standards based, cross-browser compatible HTML/CSS.

* Contribute to creating and maintaining web design parameters, and visual standards.

* Creatively figure out how innovative design ideas can be implemented and tested

* Provide or seek out expertise in presentation-layer practices and trends

* Develop ADA Compliant frontend UI

* Work in close collaboration with the PMO, User Experience designers, Technology teams and provide all groups with a clear, accurate, evolving User Interface.

* Responsible for the components of complex front end engineering and/or analytical tasks and activities. Assists in establishment of contracts for services over REST with lower tier subsystems while coordinating with multiple teams for achieving a robust subsystem design and integration of the total system. Serves as a fully seasoned/proficient technical resource; provides tech knowledge and capabilities as team member and individual contributor. 
Required Skills 
* Minimum of 7 to 10 years experience in web design / development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Razor/Angular MVC, JQuery based on web standards and best practices for scalability and accessibility. 
* Expertise in JavaScript and Frameworks, like - Angular, JQuery, etc. Ability to write reusable, modular CSS for large applications. Expertise in HTML5, CSS3
* Experience with CSS preprocessors, like - SASS/LESS; JavaScript Templating Framework, e.g. Handlebars; JSON Objects; SVGs;, 
* Excellent knowledge of UX patterns and practices for web application design and development.

* Ability to build clean HTML code, utilizing latest, creative CSS techniques.

* Knowledge of design patterns and principles (e.g. OO Javascript).
* Experience with source control tools (TFS, Git).
* Experience with build tools (Gulp).
* Good understanding of REST standards.
* Strong problem solving skills and analytical thinking.
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal).
* Ability to work with cross-functional multicultural teams.
* Scrum agile methodologies.
Specialized Skills
*  Proficient understanding of client-side scripting in advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etc. 
*  Experience in implementing ADA/Accessibility (Level AA & AAA) Requirements
*  Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
*  Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
Desired Skills:
* Experience with JavaScript Animation Libraries, like - Velocity.js, CSS Animations; Node JS, Grunt/Gulp 
* Keeps abreast of UX Design Patterns, technical trends, develops and incorporates them within assignments as appropriate. 
* Strong understanding of User Experience, Information Architecture, and Interaction Design concepts. 
*  Has expert knowledge of cross-browser design/development and sound knowledge of table less page layout , proficient in developing CSS-driven UI layouts and Image Sprite utilization (optimization techniques). 
* Has experience creating and documenting Web UI coding standards/guidelines and design patterns is preferred. 
* TDD, BDD processes
* Cordova, PhoneGap, React Native

Experience in designing, architecting and building complex application interfaces using JavaScript libraries
Good base engineering knowledge understanding abstraction, polymorphism, composition vs inheritance, design patterns, IOC etc.

Frontend.jobTitle: Web Application Sr Front End Developer (Contract)
Frontend.jobskills: Application, Browser, Desktop, Developer, Development, DOM, E-commerce, Ecommerce, HTTP, J2EE, JavaScript, Performance, Project, Systems, User Interface, UX, Version Control, Web
Frontend.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has an immediate need for a Web Application Senior Front End Developer (FED) to join our client's e-Commerce User Experience team in Dallas, Texas (TX).


Overview:
You will drive performance improvements for our e-Commerce sites and customers through focusing on improved JavaScript and data loading practices. As part of the UX team, the FEDs provide direction for all future development of client's front-end technologies. You will work closely with Product Owners, Business Analysts, Project Managers, UX Architects, Visual Designers, and J2EE Developers/Tech Leads in order to delivery new features for each the global eCommerce site.   

As a senior Front-End Developer, you are responsible for establishing and executing the User Experience Front End Technology vision, maintaining industry best practices and standards for the client's user interface (UI) development.

REQUIREMENTS:
* 5+ years of experience in Web Application development
* Experience working with Front-End Frameworks
* Experience with version control systems
* Proven record of producing high performance code that is readable, reusable, maintainable, and extensible
* Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript/jQuery, AJAX, and DOM manipulation
* Understanding of how to use developer tools to analyze site performance and where to refactor existing code
* Clear understanding of the HTTP request methods
* Understanding of the critical rendering path
* Developing cross-browser and cross-platform compatible solutions for desktop, mobile, and fully responsive sites using adaptive technologies
* Good communication and conversational skills in order to communicate technical information, concepts, and ideas to non-developer team members
* Ability to take the initiative in problem solving with being able to meet fixed deadlines
* Ability to efficiently debug JavaScript with the ability to improve performance

Preferred Skills: 
* Experience with Hybris Cloud 
* Experience with GIT
* Experience with Atlassian toolset (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)
* Experience working within a global company with many cultures, languages, and time zones
* Experience participating in an Agile work environment

HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React.js, jQuery, Angular.js), and JSON, and awareness of inherent pros and cons of different JS frameworks

Frontend.jobDescription:
VALiNTYRY is seeking a full time Front End UI / UX Designer / Developer (Drupal / WordPress / Unbounce) in Orlando, FL.



When you apply, please provide a link or examples of your Drupal work.



GENERAL SUMMARY:

Front End UI / UX Designer is responsible for the execution of creative and digital deliverables.

 The initial project will be to coordinate and consolidate disparate technologies and websites and help unify them with new branding, messaging, and structure using Drupal.

 Ongoing projects will include CMS Migrations, adaptations, mini-sites and multi-faceted campaign support.

 You'll work on a small team of experts to rapidly deliver designs, templates, and landing pages to our clients.

 We need someone who can translate designs and wireframes into working landing pages and websites in Drupal / WordPress and can understand the BIG PICTURE and begin with the end in mind.

 Great design and usability is your passion.




PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Adhere to and maintain brand standards and its integral role in the organization, providing quality assurance of creative deliverables.

 Build and maintain positive rapport with clients and team members, partner agencies, photographers, and other vendors.

 Maintain accurate and orderly records of jobs produced and attaching final artwork to closed jobs electronically in the Creative Management software program, delivering hard copy files to production/ traffic manager upon job completion and in a timely manner. 

 Monitor and update the status of jobs assigned on a daily basis through the utilization of Creative Management software program and communicate to leadership and/or production/ traffic manager if a project will not be completed on schedule.


 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:


Bachelor's degree or art school equivalent and 3 years of progressive experience in design and development


REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:


Portfolio with examples of exceptional digital design capabilities and collaborations

 Advanced capabilities with Drupal or related CMS, MS Office, HTML 5, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, Adobe CC, Drupal, InDesign, Adobe Illustrator, WordPress, Unbounce, Photoshop, and other Mac software

 Established technical knowledge of various media such as web, social media ad design, video, interactive, branded email marketing, etc.

 Fundamental knowledge of creative, advertising, marketing strategy, and promotion

 Ability to work well autonomously and with others using tact and diplomacy

 Strong oral and written communication skills

 Proven ability to successfully manage concurrent projects; work in a fast-paced and complex environment; execute large projects; and work under multiple and competing deadlines

 Strong attention to detail throughout revisions and final approvals







For immediate response please forward resumes to dmartinek@valintry.com

For a list of our current openings please visit Valintry's Jobs Webpage 



Please note: This client is not accepting candidates submitted by other staffing firms or agencies at this time.  Thank you.



 Very Best,



Dan Martinek 

IT Recruiting Manager

(Direct) 407-205-1127

(Cell) 407-616-4619

(Office) 800-360-1407

www.VALiNTRY.com

1201 S. Orlando Ave. #440

Winter Park, FL 32789

Frontend.jobskills: UI/UX web designer & developer,HTML5/CSS3, mobile frameworks,JavaScript, jQuery, PHP
Frontend.jobDescription:
The UI/UX web designer & developer is a disruptive innovator that challenges the conventional in order to deliver exceptional digital experiences across a multitude of platforms As a true advocate and voice of the customer, the Senior UX Architect masterfully crafts user-centered designs while simultaneously executing the business goals and objectives of the organization.

                                   

                                              Duties and Responsibilities


 

 

30
Manage web and digital design projects from ideation to completion by coordinating stakeholders, providing input into decisions shaping the user experience, setting project scope and meeting deadlines.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to develop low- and high-fidelity wireframes and prototypes based on business objectives and principles of user-centered design.
Convert user-driven research, wireframes and prototypes into usable web interfaces using modern front-end development tools, methodologies and processes.

 

 

40
Help internal departments deliver a compelling and cohesive end-to-end experience across all digital touchpoints
Work with developers to bring concepts to life while maintaining best UI/UX practices

 

20
Using a variety of methodologies and best practices, participate in user research and analysis to test, evaluate and strategize on opportunities to continuously evolve the user experience.
Collaborate with marketing research and digital marketing peers to identify and take advantage of conversion rate optimization opportunities.

 

10
Stay abreast of advancements and trends in the fields of user interface design, user experience, front-end development and marketing.

 

 


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities


 


 

Bachelor's degree in visual design, communications, computer science, or related field.

 
Advanced knowledge of HTML5/CSS3, mobile frameworks, principles of design, information architecture, color theory and typography.
Strong knowledge of scripting languages and libraries (e.g. JavaScript, jQuery, PHP)
Deep knowledge of UX processes such as customer journey maps, usability testing, empathy maps, A/B testing, user interviews, card sorting and persona development.
Expertise in transforming concepts into wireframes and prototypes utilizing industry-standard tools (e.g. Adobe XD, Axure, Balsamiq, inVision, Photoshop, Sketch).

 

 

 

 

Other Skills and Abilities


Work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities

 

Thorough understanding of common cognitive biases and how they influence design outcomes.

 

 

Ability and willingness to work within new systems, environments, platforms and processes to craft modern, relevant products that enhance the user experience.

Frontend.jobskills: WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, JQuery, PHP, version control, Adobe CS, Digital asset management, Motion graphics skill, animation, Web content management, visual communication, typography, brand identity and management, marketing principles, responsive/mobile first web design
Frontend.jobDescription:
About

 
Bates is one of the nation s        leading liberal arts colleges, with a long history of        commitments to principles of human dignity and diversity.
 
Since its founding by abolitionists in 1855, Bates has        welcomed men and women from diverse racial, ethnic, religious,        and economic backgrounds. Bates was the first co-educational        college in New England, and some of its earliest students were        former slaves. The college continues to live that promise of      inclusiveness.
 
Bates offers a rigorous and highly        personalized education that centers on deep and sustained        interactions among students, faculty, and community. Bates        engages the forces   intellectual trends, demographic changes,        and technology   that are transforming higher education and the        world into which our students graduate.
 
Bates has highly        competitive admission, graduates over 90% of its entering        students, and over half of its alumni earn graduate degrees.        Bates has 1,700 students, 200 faculty members and 550 staff and        administrative employees.
 
The college is proud of it deep        roots in the Lewiston/Auburn community, Maine s second largest        urban area, with a population of approximately 65,000. Bates is        located on a beautiful, 109-acre, traditional New England campus        in Lewiston, a small city with an entrepreneurial climate, a        lively arts scene, and a dynamic business community. Bates is 35        miles north of Portland, 140 miles north of Boston, and 350        miles north of New York City.
 
 The Position

 
Work as a member of the        college s design team to provide cross-platform designs to be        represented visually in a variety of digital mediums and on a        wide range of screens. The Web Designer creates and produces        engaging, high-level concepts of how the Bates brand is        experienced across platforms, including web, email, social        media, and mobile applications.
 
The Web Designer is a        member of a creative team and works on projects that advance the        key messages of the college, proposing new ideas and        demonstrating available technology to colleagues and campus        partners. This front-end design position requires a passion for        innovative design; knowledge of a wide variety of communication        techniques, technical tools, and emerging best practices; as        well as excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.        It reports to the Director of Design Services in the Bates        Communications Office.
   QUALIFICATIONS  
The successful candidate will          have a bachelor s degree in graphic and digital arts or a          related field.
 
The ideal candidate will have:
  3-5 years of experience in web design.
 Experience in higher education desired.
 Experience with print and web software, tools, and          processes.
 Knowledge of advanced web design            practices, including navigation, information architecture,            and usability, as well as quality assurance testing          processes.
 Awareness of web industry standard best            practices and emerging trends, including responsive/mobile            first web design.
 Core technical skills:
   WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, JQuery, PHP,            version control
 Adobe Creative Suite
 Proficient in digital asset management
 Motion            graphics skill, animation
 Web content          management
 Full understanding of concepts and            principles of visual communication, typography, brand            identity and management, and strong grasp of marketing          principles.
   Ability to work            collaboratively in a professional studio environment with            director, designers, web developers, photographers, editors,            and writers, and to develop strong working relationships            with on-campus partners.
 Keen attention to          detail.
 Strong analytical and problem solving          skills.
 Strong oral and written communication          skills.
 Strong organizational and interpersonal          skills.
 Ability to work under pressure and meet          deadlines.
 Ability to work individually and as part            of a team.
 Ability to work with end users to gather            and refine requirements and resolve issues.
 
Benefits

 
Bates College offers          competitive salaries, excellent benefits (health, dental, 9%          retirement contribution with potential for an additional 3%          match, 24 days of vacation, 12 paid holidays, dependent care          subsidy, free parking, access to library and athletic          facilities & more) and a supportive, collegial environment          in a drug- and smoke-free workplace. 

&nbsp
    APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS  
Please submit a          cover letter, resume, and contact information for three          professional references. This position requires successful          completion of a pre-employment background screening. Review of          applications begins immediately and will continue until the          position is filled. (References will not be contacted without          your permission.)
    
This        institution is using Interfolio's Faculty Search to conduct this        search. Applicants to this position receive a free Dossier        account and can send all application materials, including        confidential letters of recommendation, free of charge.
  
For help signing up, accessing your account, or      submitting your application please check out our  section or get      in touch via email at  or phone at (877) 997-8807.
      
Bates College is committed to the principle of        equal opportunity and providing an educational and work        environment free from discrimination. The college prohibits        discrimination on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic        origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or        gender expression, age, disability, genetic information or        veteran status and other legally protected statuses in the        recruitment and admission of its students, in the administration        of its education policies and programs, or in the recruitment of        its faculty and staff.  Bates College adheres to all applicable        state and federal equal opportunity laws and regulations.  All        college faculty, staff, students, contractors, visitors, and        volunteers are responsible for understanding and complying with        the Non-Discrimination Policy.
 
Inquiries concerning the        college s policies, compliance with applicable laws, statutes,        and regulations (such as Title VII, Title IX, and ADA/Section        504), and complaints may be directed to Gwen Lexow, Title IX        Officer, 207-786-6445 or via email at glexow@bates.edu.

Frontend.jobskills: .Net, Ajax, ASP, ASP.NET, Content Management, Development, GIT, jQuery, Management, Materials, Programming, Project, Source Code, Web-based Training, Web Design, Web Designer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Position Description 
Position ID: R1827 
  
Location: Rockville, MD 
Full-Time with Benefits 
  
We are currently seeking a highly-qualified Senior Web Designer to support the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services’ Quality and Safety Education Portal (QSEP) development team. The QSEP provides on-demand, web-based training, provides a platform for live and prerecorded training broadcasts, performs assessments for several classroom-based, instructor-led courses, hosts additional custom materials and training, and gives health care providers access to information about surveyors’ mission. The Senior Web Designer will create the look, layout and features of the website and the position requires both strong graphic design and programming skills. He/She will work with the Development team to assist with ongoing site maintenance and content management after site creation has been completed. 
  
DUTIES 

Apply Bootstrap 3 styles to new and existing templates 
Optimize existing markup for speed and scalability 
Develop and re-design website pages  
Translate user stories and requirements into functional applications 
Continue design and front-end development on new and existing templates 
Ensure all codes are unit tested and compliant with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act 
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications 
Identify bottlenecks, bugs, and devise solutions to remediate findings 
Help maintain code quality and organization 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
   
Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Graphic Design or related field 
Professional work experience with creative web design required 
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  
   
A minimum of 5 years of applicable experience 
Knowledge of graphic design software such as Photoshop or Illustrator 
Expert knowledge and experience writing HTML5 and CSS3 
Intermediate knowledge, experience, and ability with jQuery, Bootstrap, and AJAX 
Able to work in a team environment and collaborate well with others 
Excellent communication skills, and ability to articulate complex ideas to non-technical staff 
A self-starter with strong self-management skills 
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities 
Able to consistently meet project deadlines 
Basic understanding of ASP.Net Web Forms 
Basic understanding of GIT source code repositories 
Hendall Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. 
*DICE* 

*MON*
