Frontend.jobskills: Accounting, Adobe, Agile, CMS, CRM, Database, Development, DHTML, E-commerce, Ecommerce, Excel, HTML, JavaScript, Manager, Management, Metrics, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, Project Management, Research, Sales, Supervision, UPS, Web Design, Web Designer
Frontend.jobDescription:
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting is looking for a Web Designer to work out of our Kennesaw GA location. \r

Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US (CCHGroup.com) is a leading provider of tax, accounting and audit information, software and services, and is a division of Wolters Kluwer, a market-leading global information services company. It has served tax, accounting and business professionals since 1913. Among its market-leading solutions are The CCH- ProSystem fx- Suite, CCH Axcess-, CCH- IntelliConnect-, CCH- IntelliConnect Direct, CCH- Accounting Research Manager- and the U.S. Master Tax Guide-. Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US is based in Riverwoods, IL, with key office locations in Dallas, Wichita, New York, Washington, D.C., Chicago and Torrance.   
The digital future has arrived and the tax and accounting professions are changing rapidly. Professionals today have different needs, expectations and capabilities. In addition to accuracy, they need greater mobility, simplicity and speed. These needs place a premium on access to active intelligence, agile systems and integrated workflow solutions -- in short "Best in Process" solutions. This is precisely the value that Wolters Kluwer, Tax & Accounting US delivers to professionals. \r
Responsible for developing and implementing marketing, promotions, and creative strategies and tactics to promote and sell the organization's products and services through a CMS-based web site. This position works under general supervision. 


Responsibilities include; 

* Proactively scope and present new ideas to improve the website experience for prospects, leads, and customers 

* Oversee web project management, hitting deadlines and improving efficiency while maintaining the highest standards of quality web development 

* Produce wireframe, mock-ups, and new site pages for internal review and approval as required 

* Develop and implement front-end web code and design standards as appropriate to support web marketing, e-commerce, and public interactive tools/apps.  

* Implement and administer all web CRM and e-commerce platforms which adhere to global Wolters Kluwer standards 

* Work within Marketing Automation tool to design forms, email templates, landing page templates, dynamic content and implement on website(s) 

* Analyze ecommerce and site flow metrics and engagement; create reports, identify opportunities to advance experience and increase performance (Goolgle Analytics, Heat mapping tools, Google Adwords) 

* Assist with defining, advising and/or creating promotional content that will drive increased digital sales and/or engagement 
QUALIFICATIONS 
Education 

Minimum: Bachelor's Degree in Computer, Website Design or related field, OR equivalent. 


Experience 

Minimum Experience: 2+ years of related web design, digital marketing experience, OR equivalent. 


Preferred Experience:  


* Comprehensive understanding of the digital ecosystem and how web, mobile, social, search and e-commerce channels work together to optimize behavior, acquisition and sales 

* At least 2 years web development experience with knowledge of mobile-friendly website design (HTML, DHTML, JavaScript) 

* At least 2 years CMS & Ecommerce system experience; including shopping cart techniques & database development (Magento, Force.com, a plus) 

* Familiarity with audience segmentation and direct experience with web measurement/analytics is required 

* A passion for understanding the consumer mindset and keeping up with media and technology trends; exceptional customer insight skills and the ability to translate those insights into actionable digital marketing ideas is required 

* Experience with Adobe CC and web/design software (InDesign a plus) 

Tools:  


* Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) 

* Tools and process enabling remote connection to internal systems 

* Google analytics, Pardot (or similar), Mouse Flow (or similar) 


Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications: 

* Ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with all levels of management. 

* Ability to verbally relay concepts, goals, project plans to all parties involved in the execution of said plans.  

* Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams as well as working in long-distance situations.  

* Ability to read and comprehend industry specific documents and/or presentations.  

* Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.  

* Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.  

* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. 

* Detail oriented, able to work independently and as a contributor in a team environment. 

* Strong organizational, time management and interpersonal skills. 

* Flexible and responsive to change. 


Minimum travel Work occurs in a normal office environment. \r
  \r
Apply to: 
 https://www.wolterskluwer.apply2jobs.com/ProfExt/index.cfm?fuseaction=mExternal.showJob&RID=18037&CurrentPage=1    
ABOUT WOLTERS KLUWER   
Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.   
Wolters Kluwer reported 2016 annual revenues of -4.3 billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. 
Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. Wolters Kluwer has a sponsored Level 1 American Depositary Receipt program. The ADRs are traded on the over-the-counter market in the U.S. (WTKWY).

Frontend.jobDescription:
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting is looking for a Web Designer to work out of our Kennesaw GA location. \r

Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US (CCHGroup.com) is a leading provider of tax, accounting and audit information, software and services, and is a division of Wolters Kluwer, a market-leading global information services company. It has served tax, accounting and business professionals since 1913. Among its market-leading solutions are The CCH- ProSystem fx- Suite, CCH Axcess-, CCH- IntelliConnect-, CCH- IntelliConnect Direct, CCH- Accounting Research Manager- and the U.S. Master Tax Guide-. Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US is based in Riverwoods, IL, with key office locations in Dallas, Wichita, New York, Washington, D.C., Chicago and Torrance.   
The digital future has arrived and the tax and accounting professions are changing rapidly. Professionals today have different needs, expectations and capabilities. In addition to accuracy, they need greater mobility, simplicity and speed. These needs place a premium on access to active intelligence, agile systems and integrated workflow solutions -- in short "Best in Process" solutions. This is precisely the value that Wolters Kluwer, Tax & Accounting US delivers to professionals. \r
Responsible for developing and implementing marketing, promotions, and creative strategies and tactics to promote and sell the organization's products and services through a CMS-based web site. This position works under general supervision. 


Responsibilities include; 

* Proactively scope and present new ideas to improve the website experience for prospects, leads, and customers 

* Oversee web project management, hitting deadlines and improving efficiency while maintaining the highest standards of quality web development 

* Produce wireframe, mock-ups, and new site pages for internal review and approval as required 

* Develop and implement front-end web code and design standards as appropriate to support web marketing, e-commerce, and public interactive tools/apps.  

* Implement and administer all web CRM and e-commerce platforms which adhere to global Wolters Kluwer standards 

* Work within Marketing Automation tool to design forms, email templates, landing page templates, dynamic content and implement on website(s) 

* Analyze ecommerce and site flow metrics and engagement; create reports, identify opportunities to advance experience and increase performance (Goolgle Analytics, Heat mapping tools, Google Adwords) 

* Assist with defining, advising and/or creating promotional content that will drive increased digital sales and/or engagement 
QUALIFICATIONS 
Education 

Minimum: Bachelor's Degree in Computer, Website Design or related field, OR equivalent. 


Experience 

Minimum Experience: 2+ years of related web design, digital marketing experience, OR equivalent. 


Preferred Experience:  


* Comprehensive understanding of the digital ecosystem and how web, mobile, social, search and e-commerce channels work together to optimize behavior, acquisition and sales 

* At least 2 years web development experience with knowledge of mobile-friendly website design (HTML, DHTML, JavaScript) 

* At least 2 years CMS & Ecommerce system experience; including shopping cart techniques & database development (Magento, Force.com, a plus) 

* Familiarity with audience segmentation and direct experience with web measurement/analytics is required 

* A passion for understanding the consumer mindset and keeping up with media and technology trends; exceptional customer insight skills and the ability to translate those insights into actionable digital marketing ideas is required 

* Experience with Adobe CC and web/design software (InDesign a plus) 

Tools:  


* Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) 

* Tools and process enabling remote connection to internal systems 

* Google analytics, Pardot (or similar), Mouse Flow (or similar) 


Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications: 

* Ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with all levels of management. 

* Ability to verbally relay concepts, goals, project plans to all parties involved in the execution of said plans.  

* Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams as well as working in long-distance situations.  

* Ability to read and comprehend industry specific documents and/or presentations.  

* Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.  

* Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.  

* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. 

* Detail oriented, able to work independently and as a contributor in a team environment. 

* Strong organizational, time management and interpersonal skills. 

* Flexible and responsive to change. 


Minimum travel Work occurs in a normal office environment. \r
  \r
Apply to: 
 https://www.wolterskluwer.apply2jobs.com/ProfExt/index.cfm?fuseaction=mExternal.showJob&RID=18037&CurrentPage=1

Frontend.jobskills: Adobe, Analytical Skills, DNA, Libraries, Outlook, UX, Web Design, Web Designer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Web Designer 
Charlotte, NC  





We're looking for a web designer to join our Creative team, designing responsive and complex websites for the country's biggest brands in a variety of different industries. You will drive our collaborative process; connecting the dots between Content Strategists, UX, Designers and Developers in a fast-paced, challenging environment to create and optimize digital user experiences.  


We’re looking for someone with an energy to excite others; to provide the direction to take us to the next level and a genuine passion for design.  

Qualities we’re looking for in a Designer:  

Proficient in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and/or Sketch 
2-4 years of previous experience in the web design space 
Possess a thorough understanding of design principles and layout strategy 
Passion for your craft, with an appetite to continue to challenge yourself and those around you 
A team player with a positive outlook and an entrepreneurial spirit 
Familiarity with HTML5, CSS3, and using modern front-end libraries/framework 



A sense of humor helps too. We’ve got an incredible campus, tons of amenities, and a casual, often ridiculous, culture. This is the kind of environment where you’ll crack up about something with someone at least once a day. A place where your work friends become actual friends. We work hard and produce an absurd amount of creative content, and yet it never feels that way. Because we’re having fun.  

How We Work: 

Iterate 
 - Red tape doesn’t get in our way. We believe that "Speed Trumps Perfection" so we test daily. 
Autonomy 
 – Aspiring entrepreneurs succeed here because you will have full-ownership over your work from beginning to end.  
Collaborate 
 – Better than making the dream work, teamwork makes the design work. Through open work-space, Slack and peer reviews, our teams work together to build amazing solutions. 
Innovate 
 – With the belief that “Everything is Written in Pencil”, we encourage our teams to test new experiences, learn new languages and challenge the “status quo” to make us better. 



Change the way you think about work  – apply now.   


We love to see examples of your work, include your portfolio link, design samples, or whatever represents you.  

About Red Ventures:  



Red Ventures is a leading digital consumer choice platform. Through deeply integrated brand partnerships and consumer-facing assets, Red Ventures connects online customers with products and services in the home services, financial services, and healthcare industries. We use advanced analytics, data science, and integrated technology to cultivate and customize digital connections between brands and customers. We marry the speed of a start-up, the DNA of a digital agency, the strategic thinking of a consultancy, and the analytical skills of a big data company. Red Ventures is headquartered in Charlotte, NC and has more than 3,500 employees in offices across the US as well as in Brazil and London.  


    Apply Now

Frontend.jobskills: Adobe, Analytical Skills, DNA, Ecommerce, Libraries, Outlook, Web Designer
Frontend.jobDescription:
Associate Web Designer 
Charlotte, NC  





At Red Ventures, our product is our expertise in how to market and sell in the digital world, incorporating digital acumen – think design, creative, SEO, etc. – with real-time consumer data analytics (captured by tools built in-house), to create unique online experiences building our partner’s business.   


What does all that mean? We married data and design, hooking our designs into powerful user behavior technology that helps us find what customers want. The lessons we learn inform new designs, producing websites that perform for big brands - it’s all about inspiring action in customers, and looking amazing in the process.  


That’s where you come in. We’re looking for an Associate Designer to join our Creative team, designing responsive and complex web sites for the country’s biggest brands in the home services, software, ecommerce, mobile, insurance and energy industries. You’ll work with a team of Analysts, Software Engineers, Developers and Content Strategists in a fast-paced, challenging environment to create and optimize digital user experiences.  

Qualities we’re looking for in a Designer:  

0-3 years of design experience 
Proficient in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and/or Sketch 
Possess a thorough understanding of design principles and layout strategy 
Passion for your craft, with an appetite to continue to challenge yourself and those around you 
A team player with a positive outlook and an entrepreneurial spirit 
Familiarity with HTML5, CSS3, and using modern front-end libraries/frameworks

Frontend.jobDescription:
Robert Half technology is looking for Sharp Front End Designer for a UI/UX contract starting immediately. 

Job Requirements 


Three.js or experience with any other JavaScript-based 3D framework 

Strong UI/UX design experience  


Experience send Web Request from the UI to a Web API layer.  


Some 3D Studio Max or other 3D modeling tools experience is a plus 


Experience building wireframes, storyboards, journey/site maps etc. 


Proven portfolio and able to do the work independently 


If you or a colleague are interested in this opportunity, please contact Danielle Chitty at 405-236-0202 or Danielle.chitty@rht.com. You may also apply to any position we have listed on our website at www.roberthalf.com/ok-oklahoma-city. We look forward to hearing from you!

Frontend.jobskills: Adobe, Analysis, CSS, Data Analysis, HTML, JavaScript, Libraries, Research, UX, Web Designer
Frontend.jobemploymentType: C2H Independent, C2H W2, Full Time
Frontend.jobDescription:
We currently have an immediate opening for a full time UI/UX Designer. The UI/UX Designer will work collaboratively with the Product Managers to create clever and innovative designs for new and existing products based on user needs, product requirements, and business objectives. 

Responsibilities: 

Create and design meaningful UX deliverables (wireframes, visual designs, prototypes) for multiple in-house brands. 

Understand our user needs through research, surveys, etc; and compose solutions that measurably enhance the product experience. 

Work directly with product managers, engineers, and other designers to ensure that we maintain a high-quality user experience. 

Quickly and thoughtfully incorporate team feedback into designs. 

Provide static artifacts, high fidelity mocks, or interactive prototypes to support your concepts. 

Requirements: 

Minimum 3+ years of UX / UI design experience with a portfolio documenting examples 

Proficiency in wireframing, visual designing and prototyping user experiences across responsive web and mobile app platforms (Marvel, Principle, FramerJS, etc.) 

Ability to tackle complex problems, and a thoughtful approach to user flow, information hierarchy and interactive details 

Experience with industry standard user experience research methods (data analysis, surveys, usability tests, etc.) 

Expert experience with industry standard design tools (Adobe CC, Sketch, Invision, etc.) 

Ability to understand and write basic HTML/CSS 

Bachelor's degree in design, human-centered interaction (HCI), related field or relevant work experience 

Strong front-end language knowledge (HTML/CSS, Javascript, etc.) preferred 

Experience with frameworks and libraries (Bootstrap, Angular.js, etc.) 


Job Requirements 


HTML - HyperText Markup Language, CSS - Cascade Styling Sheets, JavaScript, Bootstrap

Frontend.jobskills: Adobe, Analytical, Analytical Skills, Application, Applications, Computer, Customer Service, Engineering, Graphics, HTML, Laptop, PHP, Printer, Programming, Quality, Web, Web Design, Web Designer
Frontend.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in search of a Web Designer II in Miami, Florida (FL). The Web Designer develops cutting-edge websites, newsletters, and designs to enhance the end-user experience by delivering high-quality products using industry standards.


Essential Job Functions:
* Collaborates with various teams on content updates for all client Online managed websites
* Creates graphical elements used for all client Online managed websites and applications, such as banners, layouts, design, and icons
* Facilitates developing the styled layouts for all client Online managed websites, including the graphical conversion from Adobe Photoshop to HTML/PHP/CSS
* Keeps immersed in the latest web design trends and implements new ideas into ongoing projects
* Works with client Online clients to define business functions of website, and implement these requirements using cutting edge technologies
* Uses front end optimization techniques to enhance the user experience
* Ensures that all application design and styling is up to industry standards as well as in compliance with University and state regulations and/or practices
* Works closely with the Marketing Team to track Marketing campaign leads captured through our websites
* Works with Google Analytics to track website statistics to view popular pages and improve user's experience
* Plans and designs client Online Email Newsletters for client Online faculty, staff, and students
* Creates marketing email blasts targeting specific demographics for various campaigns
* Creates wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
* Establishes and promotes design guidelines, best practices and standards for client Online websites

REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in MIS, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Studies, Marketing, Communications, Graphic Design, or other related discipline and two (2) years related experience, or and equivalent combination of relevant education and/or experience

Machines and Equipment:
* Copy Machine
* Fax
* Computer & laptop
* Printer
* Scanner
* Telephone

KSAs:
* Knowledge in Google Analytics
* Knowledge of CSS (Cascading Style Sheets)
* Knowledge of Photoshop
* Knowledge of web graphics
* Computer programming and web authoring skills
* Effective analytical skills
* Effective customer service skills
* Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationship with others
* Ability to follow through and carry out assignments
* Ability to follow written and verbal instruction
* Ability to handle multiple projects and work with other team members
* Ability to maintain a high level of professional integrity
* Ability to meet deadlines

Departmental Preferences:
* Experience using Photoshop
* Experience using Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Techniques
* Experience using Google Analytics

Other Essential Requirements:
* On call 24 hour by 7-day for possible emergency situations

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
